This is something I had to get used to over time. I think this becomes a common stumbling block for players of traditional, older rpgs who come to narrative-heavy games. Narrative-heavy rpgs, without the typical pacing of an older hack-and-slash style combat system, appear too simplistic and quick to resolve, when looking at it through the eyes of tradition. For me, the best way to approach it - as someone who plays a lot of these Apocalypse World variants now - is to expand what a turn looks like and push the narrative for every single die roll as much as possible. That sounds obvious on its face, but that really gets you used to this style of game. For Perilous, elaborate on the Challenge tag being removed during a successful roll, to a great degree before moving on to the next turn, and make the failures a drawn-out process that takes some time to enact, in the same vein. Amplify every little thing so that every roll has significant impact on the tale and takes time to work out.

campaign.story:
Slowquest Stick-A-Hero is a way for you to visualise your favourite fantasy TTRPG character, or to make a new one! Not everyone’s skills are in drawing, and custom illustrated portraits can get pricey! Especially when you might go and roll a 1 crossing a lava bridge next session, flailing helplessly to a fiery death (RIP Elwind Greenfoot).
A sticker portrait pack comes with three character blanks (A5, or 148x210mm), each with a different skin tone, plus five full sheets of stickers (clothing, equipment, armour, decorations and more!) to bring the character from your mind-palace into the real world! (additional character blanks will be available to purchase, and free to download and print yourself).
The Stick-A-Hero base pack comes with a huge variety of stickers that cover a wide range to create all the major characters we love to play in popular TTRPG games.
Once the kickstarter ends, you will be able to choose from a range of colour-pairings. Your pack will then arrive featuring clothing/items themed in those colours. This allows the packs to include a wide range of usable clothing without sacrificing your choice of colours (nobody wants a sheet with 6 of the same shirt in different colours, right?)
New stretch goals will be revealed as the next one is reached! They will include exciting goals such as add-on sheets for extra bits and pieces for your characters, additional options for your base pack, and other bonuses.
I will be using Backerkit to manage the campaign after it ends, this will allow you to add extra sticker sheets, portrait blanks, and even other Slowquest items onto your order!
Why are there only three skin-tones?
Rather than trying to cover all the possible skin tones there are (basically unlimited, especially in fantasy worlds), I decided to choose three tones that are quite different from each other, and as a set, will hopefully satisfy the needs of all.

Are the stickers removable/reusable?
The stickers are designed to be stuck down permanently, though when testing, I was able to gently remove and re-stick the stickers if placed incorrectly. So it is possible but I can't guarantee it as a feature.

How easy is it to make a character?
It’s super easy! Young stickerers might need some assistance, but they’ll still have a good time.

How many characters can I make with one pack?
You can comfortably make three characters and still have many stickers left over for extras. Character blanks will be available to purchase afterwards, as well as printable character blanks, available for free.
1 - Supporter (2 Euros)
A pledge of kindness and support. This level signs you up to receive updates on this and future projects from Slowquest.
2 - Digital pack (7 Euros)
As soon as they are available, you will receive the stickers and character blanks as digital files, allowing savvy players to piece together their portraits digitally.
 3 - Early bird pack (13 Euros)
You will receive one sticker portraits pack, which contains three character blanks and all the standard sticker sheets. This pledge level is limited to early birds so get in quick!
4 - Adventurer pack (16 Euros)
You will receive one sticker portraits pack, which contains three character blanks and all the standard sticker sheets. This is enough to create at least three unique characters.
5 - Party pack (25 Euros)
You will receive THREE sticker portraits packs, each containing three character blanks and all the standard sticker sheets. This is enough to create a whole party’s worth of characters!
6 - Master pack (90 Euros)
For those looking for something even more special, this level provides you with the opportunity to have an A6 sticker set sheet of YOUR OWN ITEMS AND CLOTHING. Up to 6 of your own suggested pieces will custom illustrated by me and shipped along with the rest of your pack. (You will receive 4 copies of your custom sheets).
Postage will be indicated as you choose your pledge level and location here on kickstarter. If you include additional products/add on sheets in Backerkit, it may incur additional postage at that time, but will be clearly indicated before any additional commitment.
VAT is included in the price where relevant and will not incur additional costs.
I am Bodie H, an illustrator and designer from Australia, currently living in the Netherlands! It makes me so happy to be making all sorts of fantasy TTRPG content, focusing on fun and whimsical high fantasy themes.
You can find me on the following platforms:
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/slowquest
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/bodieh/
My webshop: https://www.slowquest.com/

campaign.story:
These images show a prototype deck - not (quite) the final design
The DUNGENERATOR is a deck of cards that randomly generates organic dungeons!

You remember that stress dream? The one where you show up to run a game of your favorite dungeon-crawling RPG and realize you've done no preparation? Your players begin to thumb idly at their phones as you glance around the room for inspiration. Where did your pants go?

The DUNGENERATOR is here to help! It's useful for tabletop roleplayers that want a fresh dungeon quickly, without having to sketch a layout or rely upon static maps. Each room in the dungeon it generates includes interesting visual prompts, so you can plop your players into a "generic dungeon" and come out with a unique, satisfying session! It cannot help with the pants.

It features 52 double-sided, poker-sized room cards with over 60 pieces of full-color, hand-inked art by me, ROLLINKUNZ! I've labored for a while (some have said too long) on these puppies, because this is my first Kickstarter, and I really want to make sure these are as special as I know they can be!

You can just shuffle up the deck and start laying out cards, or you can use my simple DUNGENERATION ALGORITHM:
Find and place an Entrance Room card and shuffle the rest of the deck.
Select a Room and attach Room cards to each open passage on it.
Repeat step 2.
If a Room card ever overlaps another, discard it and flip over the previous Room to its Dead End side.
Use Secret Passages to add connections between different parts of the dungeon, if desired.
The result: randomly-generated dungeons with a twistier, more organic feel than you'll get from square tiles!

This reward tier includes the digital version of the DUNGENERATOR deck as a downloadable PDF, as well as my undying thanks!

It also includes early access to all unlocked digital rewards (see "STRETCH GOALS" below)!

This tier includes six printed copies of the DUNGENERATOR deck in nice custom tuck boxes!

This tier comes with enough decks to gift one to each of your adventuring party!

This will allow you to print up any Room in the dungeon as an combat encounter for your minis (or place it on your wall as a nice print)!

campaign.story:
The last dragon prince has been abducted and is kept prisoner by an unknown threat: AZTEC MEXICA. Helm Greycastle and his band of outsider adventures are tasked with exploring the uncharted land that was once at the brink of enslavement by the savage Spanish Conquistadors...but the Aztecs used sorcery to thwart the Conquistador's murderous rampage. The possible enslavement caused the ruler, Montezuma III, to declare himself the dictator of MEXICA causing a power shift and class division. Greycastle and his comrades are recruited by an underground group lead to overthrow Montezuma III and the Gods that suppress the land.  Will Greycastle join the resistance or save the dragon prince and flee?
THE COMIC
The first issue will be 32 pages filled with sequential story art and a one-shot role-playing game that is compatible with the fifth edition Dungeons and Dragons Player's Handbook. The RPG will take place in the fictional Mesoamerican world set in HELM GREYCASTLE, so it's not necessary to play games to know what's going on in the story.
COVERS & VARIANTS
KICKSTARTER VARIANT: Matthew Emmons
COVER A: Rahmat M. Handoko
COVER B: David Lapham
COVER C: MYSTERY ARTIST
REWARDS

(7) AZTEC GOLD colored RPG Nickel Plated Dice dice in collaboration with Yesterdays Co. *Not real Aztec Gold.

Get drawn into the first issue! *Limited to 10!
ADD-ONS!

campaign.story:
Important notice: The delivery of the printed deck will be delayed to January or even February 2021 due to unexpected high interest, winter holidays and a non responsive manufacturer. Read more about it in the update #5

Have you ever had the problem of needing to describe a dungeon and none of the players could really imagine how the structure is actually built? You don't always have to draw a battle map. Sometimes a small picture is enough to quickly show what the situation around the players looks like. Or did you ever try to come up with a dungeon room on the fly and just could not come up with an interesting layout? This deck of dungeon cards is perfect for those situations. 36 (now 54) unique cards full of stairs, dark corners, slim corridors, claustrophobic rooms, crates, barrels and much more to place monsters and treasure in.
Cards can be either used separately or combined to form larger dungeons. You can reveal one card after another as your players make their way through the dungeon and make them curious about each corner.
The cards are made out of professional 310gsm card stock with a blue core and smooth linen finish for the professional look & feel. The deck comes in a custom printed tuck box with a protective matte coating to give your cards the home they deserve. 
Speaking of... Each map (as well as the back of the card and the box) is completely hand-drawn. All 36 cards are already done and just need to be sent off to the printer.
So why Kickstarter? This is a test for me to see if such a deck is even wanted by enough people. If this project gets funded I can let the cards print for a reasonable price per deck without making a loss or charging an impossible high price.
Support Tiers
5€ - Get the PDF
You will get the full Deck of Dungeons (including the back side) as a PDF. This is perfect for those that would like to support this project but can't (or don't want to) afford the price of the physical deck + shipping costs.
15€ - Get the printed deck
You will get the physical Deck of Dungeons. Perfect for Dungeon Masters, as a present or just as a collectors item.
18€ - Physical & digital deck
Get both - The PDF and the printed deck. This is for people who play classically as well as digitally or want to collect the printed deck and use the digital one.
If you want more than one deck please contact me with the shipping country. I would need to calculate the additional costs depending on where to ship. Thank you for your understanding :)
Stretch Goals
I am very hesitant when it comes to stretch goals for this project. This is my first kickstarter and I just want everyone to get what they expect and as smoothly as possible. But if the project gets a lot more supporters than expected, I probably have no choice. So here is the goal:
[Unlocked] 300 Supporters - 54 Cards
If we hit 300 or more supporters I will increase the number of cards in this deck to 54. It doesn't matter if for the physical deck or the PDF version. If we reach 300 backers the deal is sealed. I will invest some extra time to come up with 18 additional cards.
So if you would like to have a thicker deck make sure to share this project and encourage your friends to grab a copy as well ;)
 Shipping
The Deck of Dungeon gets shipped worldwide. The shipping costs will be added after you selected your pledge level. 
Germany: 6 €
Rest of the EU, USA, Canada, Japan: 11 €
Rest of the world: 13 €
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this is my first kickstarter I am fairly confident that everything will go smoothly. The designs for the deck and tuck box are done and I already got several prototype prints of the deck from the printer to check the quality and made some adjustments.

Of course it is always possible that something goes wrong during each step of the process and the shipping could get delayed. But I will try everything possible to avoid those problems and keep you updated on each and every step.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hurray! 🎉 The first batch of shipments went out today. It's not the majority of packages but it's already a good start with countries all over the world.  Don't worry if you didn't get your tracking code today. The Fulfilment center needs a bit to pack and send out all ~1500 packages.
Okay, all fine and good. But when will you actually hold the Decks in your hands?
If you live in Germany you can expect the shipment to arrive within a couple of days after you received the tracking code. A few days more if you live within the EU. But for other countries (continents) it might take longer. Due to the ongoing pandemic packages get shipped via cargo ships instead of planes to the whole of America for example. I am not sure how it is with Asia or Australia but I expect the same.  I really chose the wrong year for this project 😅

Hello everyone!
I have good news. The Decks have been delivered to the Fulfilment center and are almost ready to ship. 😉
Unfortunately I need to clean up the exported addresses. The fulfilment center needs them in a very specific form which can not be provided by the Kickstarter export. For example street and house number need to be in separate fields, phone numbers shouldn't have special characters, names should be first & last name... Checking and fixing all this might take me another day or two. I will make sure to get it done as fast as possible.

Greetings!
I said I would close the surveys on the 20th. But my day job demanded a lot of extra attention the last days so I forgot to give another notice. But now for real. I will close the surveys in around 24 hours. So this is your last chance to fill it in if you didn't do it already and get the Decks as soon as possible. 😉
If you are not sure if you filled in your survey or not you can click on the "View survey" link at the top of the campaign page. It should look like this:

Is it already too late to wich you a happy new year? I don't think so. So - happy new year everyone! Let's hope this one isn't just a sequel of the dumpster fire 2020 has been for a lot of us.
On that note - let's begin this year with some good news. I got the confirmation from the printer that the decks should be ready by the 29th of January and get delivered to the fulfilment center on the week after (probably the 3rd of February). After the fulfilment company put the decks in stock the shipping can begin. For the backers living in the EU shipping should only take a few days. For other countries it might take longer. Especially since DHL decided to move smaller packages via ships and not planes around the globe. But I will get updates keep you updated on this of course. 😊

Hello everyone!
I know I did not post an update for a few weeks now. But that's simply because there is not much to tell you. The Decks are still in production. I also already signed the contract with the fulfilment company. So I am now in kind of a waiting mode. And I hate the feeling that I can't do anything to speed it up right now...
However... I mentioned that I might provide a voucher for everybody who wanted to gift the Deck of Dungeons on Christmas.  And after a couple of weeks of illness (yes, the virus-you-should-not-name) I finally came around to deliver on that. Here are two printable versions of the voucher. One with text and one without in case you want to add your own words. You can download them here:

Hey everyone,
I have a super short update for you. After some back and forth I got the color & sheet proof for the cards from the printer today. I am very happy with the quality and signed it off (Just need to send it back tomorrow). The printer is already paid which means that the full print run of 2000 decks (I still can't believe it...) should begin shortly.

campaign.story:
*desperately* click! click!
Thirsty Sword Lesbians battle the Lady of Chains when her enforcers march down from the frosty north. They rocket through the stars to safeguard diplomats ending a generations-old conflict. They sip tea together and share shy glances at the corner cafe with their old classmates and comrades. Even when swords are crossed, they have the potential to connect more deeply than anyone expects.
A sword duel can end in kissing, a witch can gain her power by helping others find love, and an entire campaign can be built around vagabond matchmakers piloting their sentient gay spaceship from system to system.
If you love angsty disaster lesbians with swords, you have come to the right place.
Thirsty Sword Lesbians by April Kit Walsh is a roleplaying game that celebrates the love, power, and existence of queer people—specifically queer people with swords and a lot of feelings. Flirting, sword-fighting, and barbed zingers all mix together in a system designed for both narrative drama and player safety. This innovative take on the Powered by the Apocalypse engine is a breeze to learn and ensures that no matter how the dice fall, something interesting happens to move the story forward.
In this game, you will solve problems with wit, empathy, and style, fight when something is worth fighting for, and redeem (or seduce) at least a few of your adversaries. You’re part of a community that embodies important ideals and you’ll strive to protect it and make your world better.
Play as one of nine character types: Beast, Chosen, Devoted, Infamous, Nature Witch, Scoundrel, Seeker, Spooky Witch, and Trickster. Each explores a particular emotional conflict that drives the drama and shapes your character’s story. Are you a Beast, faced with the dilemma of expressing your inner truth versus fitting in to a society that demands you conform? A Devoted, who sacrifices for others while struggling to care for yourself? A Trickster, who craves closeness but fears vulnerability? In long-term play, you may even resolve your initial arc and advance into a different playbook as you continue to change and grow, facing new challenges.
Backers get immediate access to the playbooks too. They're form fillable!
Thirsty Sword Lesbians provides clear, robust guidance and support for running the game, including how to make appealing adversaries, set the tone, structure play, and create a safe environment at the table. Handy reference sheets help you narrate appropriate twists and drama on the fly, depending on the feelings and character types you have in play.
Want to jump into a one-shot? The game includes six adventures that can stand alone or kick off a longer series: Sword Lesbians of the Three Houses, Best Day of Their Lives, Constellation Festival, Gal Paladins, and Monster Queers of Castle Gayskull. For even more inspiration, it features The Starcross Galaxy campaign setting along with five more settings from these contributing authors:
 Lesbeans Coffehouse by Dominique Dickey
 Neon City 2099 by Jamila Nedjadi
 The Three Orders of Ardor by Whitney Delaglio
 Les Violettes Dangereuses by Jonaya Kemper
 Yuisa Revolution by Alexis Sara
We also provide ample guidance on how to create your own tales of fighting with swords and falling in love, along with a world building worksheet, variant rules, and a set of starting scenario seeds to play with. Because the game focuses on feelings and relationships, it’s a lens you can use to play in a variety of genres. If you like slashfic of characters with swords, you’ll love this game.
Thirsty Sword Lesbians is explicitly designed to tell melodramatic and queer stories; tales fraught with relationship triangles, mystery, intrigue, relationship anarchy, celebration, and revolution. It includes rules to highlight different identities, emotional connections, and setting elements.
This game is not for fascists, TERFs, or other bigots. The team behind Thirsty Sword Lesbians supports racial liberation, intersectional feminism, and queer liberation. We love and respect transgender people, nonbinary people, intersex people, and women. This game is a joyous celebration of lives and identities otherwise marginalized. If you don’t agree, fix your heart before sharing a table with other people.
What if... not Thirsty? The game fundamentally assumes that the characters crave connection, but that connection doesn’t need to be sexual or romantic. We offer you options for changing how the game addresses connection in our variant rules section.
What if... not Swords? It’s simple enough to swap out a different hand-to-hand combat option. Your campaign or your character can use a labrys, the double-bladed axe that became a lesbian icon in the late 20th century. You can use different styles of unarmed combat or even grapple using telepathic self-projections. It’s also possible to replace the swords with mecha, starships, or guns, but it requires some thought and the book will help you think about how to ensure that it stays intimate and relationship-focused. The conflict doesn’t have to be physically violent, either; you can use any kind of conflict that’s adrenaline-inducing and close-quarters.
What if... not Lesbians? We’ll let you in on a secret: you don’t have to play a lesbian. The game plays with themes that are common for all sorts of people who are marginalized on the basis of gender and sexuality, as well as feelings that go beyond the queer experience. If you want to play thirsty sword cishets, we’re not going to stop you—just don’t be surprised if the game turns them queer.
What if... I’m not good at flirting or zingers? You don’t have to be witty or good at flirting in real life to play a character with those skills, and not every character in Thirsty Sword Lesbians is good with words. Shy and awkward sword lesbians find love, too. You’ll find them well-represented in this game.
Ready? Let’s Go!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a great team on this project. Evil Hat is an experienced RPG publisher. We've run over a dozen successful Kickstarter campaigns and we've printed many roleplaying games in a variety of physical formats over the past few years.

This puts us in a fine position to take on the risks and challenges that will arise. Experience tells us that things don’t always go as planned.

Here's what we can anticipate as potential problems.

The Text: While Thirsty Sword Lesbians is largely done aside from the art and other polishing touches, it's possible backers will identify some glaring issue that we need to address before we take this fully to publication. That can add time, for sure. Luckily we have several talented writers available if we need a fix, as well as layout and editing people on standby, so any necessary changes should proceed quickly.

Printing: We have a strong, established relationship with our printers. We’ve got them on tap to print the books in whatever quantity we end up needing. But printers can run into problems all the same: supply shortages, unexpected delays due to company holidays or industry events, shipping problems, printing errors, and so on. We’ve got the experience to stay atop those potential problems and the flexibility to pivot and address them promptly. In the event of defective product, we will send a replacement at no cost to you. We print our books in the USA, so there's less of a chance the economic policies of the current administration will suddenly cause the cost of the book to skyrocket or otherwise introduce problems getting the books from the printer to us.

Shipping: Packages get lost. We'll send replacements. Shipping can take longer than expected. We won't put the book on sale until all backer copies are shipped out. Shipping costs can end up higher than expected. We'll absorb the overage.

Finances: While Evil Hat has seen some leaner months more recently, we've made the necessary cuts to our expenses to make sure we can sustain the company throughout 2020 and 2021. Also, we've already invested time and money to get Thirsty Sword Lesbians to this point with no pending expenses on the project outside of the ones we're funding here. Our bank account continues to look plenty healthy. If an unexpected cost arises, we've got the cushion to take the hit.

We often run a couple Kickstarters per year. This is a carefully planned process based on our 14+ successful Kickstarters in the past. Because Kickstarter fulfillment takes time, these campaigns can overlap. When it happens, that's something we plan for extensively. We make space for each Kickstarter, fulfillment, and distribution release in our schedule, and we work to ensure that resources are available to take each of our projects across the finish line.

If there's any risk or challenge YOU can think of that we haven't mentioned here, please write in and ask. We love to answer questions, and we do our best to provide an unparalleled customer service experience whenever possible. We intend to impress you.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The stars gutter and the skies fade and the earth grows weary with years. Ages of men and of Outsiders have ascended and been forgotten, and only the bones of their cities and the dust of their dreams remain upon this tired world. The Legacy of their laws is woven deep now, the edicts of dead gods and fallen sorcerer-kings made to trace patterns of power we no longer understand. We are heirs to their unseen empires, and our lives are built upon their ashes.
Worlds Without Number is a tabletop fantasy role-playing game from the creator of the hit sci-fi game Stars Without Number. It's built from the ground up to provide gritty, hard-edged adventure in the fathomless future of the Latter Earth, a fantastic realm of time-lost sorcery, savage foes, and barbaric splendor. The cold steel in the fists of your heroes and the half-understood sorcery in their tomes must suffice to overcome the monstrous remnants of ancient alien rulers and the present depredations of ruthless lords and hideous beasts alike. The riches of lost ages await in the subterranean Deeps that once held their kingdoms, and even the heavens above are not beyond the reach of the recklessly daring.
Worlds Without Number and its fantasy tools are built to be fully compatible with the sci-fi gaming of Stars Without Number and other OSR games, using classic old-school mechanics such as the traditional six attribute scores, hit points, AC, classes, and levels, along with certain modifications and refinements meant to accommodate more modern tastes. This traditional gaming chassis ensures that you can plunder almost fifty years of adventures, games, and other content built for those specifications and take advantage of the wealth of modern material being written for old-school game mechanics. An excerpt of the rough beta character creation, rules systems, and magic chapters is available right here for the curious.
Yet Worlds Without Number is built for more than just OSR enthusiasts. More than half the entire book is devoted to system- and setting-neutral tools for developing fantasy campaign worlds and sandbox adventures. Just as with the award-winning Stars Without Number ruleset, the game is designed for the working GM, someone who wants to forge their own worlds and fashion their own adventures with the most effective tools they can get. While the Latter Earth is provided as the default setting for the game, Worlds Without Number is designed to give you tools that work with the fantasy setting and game system of your choice, whether it's an existing world or a work of your own creation.
So what's in the book? In the system-specific portion of the book, you'll get everything you need to play classic fantasy adventurers in an untamed realm. Old-school character creation rules and classes, the unique talents and knacks of Foci, traditions of High Magic and stranger sorcery to fuel occult character concepts, and crisp, clean system mechanics that are familiar to many but refined with practical experience. GMs will get a sheaf of monstrous foes and eldritch treasures to cast about their world, and everyone involved can confidently play out a broad range of fearless heroics with nothing more than the core book in hand.
Yet the real treasures of Worlds Without Number lie in its mighty tools of crafting and artifice, implements that have been tuned carefully to assist a GM in creating their own settings and their own exciting adventures. These system-neutral tools are built specifically to help GMs of any fantasy game system or setting turn their imaginings into playable content.
 Factions for running setting-level political struggles and background conflicts, the better for giving your world life and motion beyond the PCs' own activities… and when the time comes, the heroes can join the intrigue and conflict as well.
 Major project guidelines and rules, because heroes think big and want to leave their mark on a setting. These rules help you translate the ambitions of your PCs into specific adventures and goals, giving them concrete progress toward their ends and providing the GM with a rich source of adventure grist.
 Setting creation tools for sandbox GMs, walking you through the steps for creating the content you need to run a smooth, enjoyable sandbox campaign. You'll build the parts that matter with tools that help you all the way, letting you focus your time and effort on playable material that your players will enjoy at the table.
 Tags for scheming Courts, raucous Communities, perilous Ruins, and trackless Wilderness are provided, each one providing ideas and outlines for turning tropes into playable content. Those who enjoyed the hundred Tags provided in Stars Without Number will savor the two hundred fantasy Tags provided here.
 Adventure creation tools are there as well, because it's not enough to just tell a working GM to make something up. That work you did in building your setting and giving Tags to your creations is leveraged to speed and smooth the creation of a good evening's play, with tools for creating combat, exploration, investigation, and social challenges, along with guidelines for stitching them together into adventures. Whether a Deep-crawl through abandoned tunnels or a treacherous game of ducal intrigue, these tools will help a GM create something playable.
Worried about finding people to play? Just like Stars Without Number, Worlds Without Number will be provided in a free edition as well, one containing all the above tools and giving curious players one easy download for getting into the fun. But what bonus material is going to exist in the deluxe edition offered here?
 Legates, and the epic-level heroism of these legendary figures. Fueled by the eldritch power of the Legacy, these rules let you play high fantasy heroes with tremendous powers and fearsome prowess. GMs who want to run epic fantasy from the start can use these tools to change the tone of their campaign from gritty fantasy to mythic might.
 Additional classes for PCs who want more finely-tuned mechanical representation of certain concepts. The classes are written to fit into the default Latter Earth setting, but each of them is built to provide support for classic character concepts, whether shape-shifting hero, swashbuckling duelist, mind-bending mentalist, armored war-priest, or hero with a loyal animal companion.
 Extraplanar worlds, with GM tools for building alien realms of strange entities and fearsome perils for the heroes to explore or reckless sorcerers to summon forth. Whether a pocket Iterum of the Latter Earth or the native realm of the devils you need for your own campaign, you can use these tools to build what your world needs.
 One Roll Tables for a number of topics relevant to a GM's interests. Stymied and in need of inspiration? Grab one die of each type, give them a toss, and stitch the results together into what you need.
Aside from these additions, I'm saving some page count for what the backers themselves tell me they want to see. If your particular enthusiasm doesn't make it into the main book, I'll know about it for later consideration when putting together supplements and freebies for the game.
 This Kickstarter is to fund the printing of a Smyth sewn, full-color offset print edition of Worlds Without Number, along with the art costs involved in producing the book. The book will be a US letter-sized volume of about 350 pages, with the pages sewn into the binding rather than the usual print-on-demand glue. It will include printed endsheets and may involve other upgrades such as book ribbons depending on price and availability. Properly-printed books of this kind are much stronger and more durable than conventional POD glued-spine volumes.
This will be my second offset print project, after the successful and fulfilled Wolves of God KS, so I've already had some practical experience in handling this particular workflow. These offset books will be high-quality, sewn-binding volumes that may or may not be available after the campaign; I'm going to make the leftovers available for sale on Amazon and through my own website after all the backers have been fulfilled, but I can't guarantee how many extras may exist, if any. If you want one, this KS is the only sure way to get one.
All backers will receive immediate access to the beta draft PDF, with the Google Docs folder listed in the campaign's first backer-only update. The game is currently rough-draft complete and playable, so you can see from the first moment what kind of tools you can expect from it.
PDF Only backers and all higher levels will receive a DRM-free PDF of the deluxe version of the book, issued as soon as the book is complete. This and all higher levels will also receive a PDF of the game's GM screen, formatted to fit in portrait-style screens.
PDF Only+POD Coupon backers will get the PDF and a DriveThruRPG coupon allowing them to buy a print-on-demand print version of the game at its minimum print cost of about $25 plus shipping. I'm providing this option for backers in places where my own shipping is impractical, or those who want to check out the deluxe version without committing to the expense of a POD just yet.
Credited PDF Only+POD Coupon backers will get the above, but will also get their name in the backer credits of both the PDF and the print versions. While I'd like to thank everyone in the credits, the page count required to add that many names at a visible type size is regrettably difficult to allocate.
Credited PDF+Offset Print levels are available for several shipping zones, including US, UK, EU, CA, and Australia, and include the cost of shipping the book to you. These shipping costs range from $25-$30 depending on non-US location, unfortunately, but my experience in fulfilling Wolves of God obliges me to recognize this.
The mighty Sine Nomine PDF Omnibus level is offered for true fans who scorn mere material goods. This level includes not only a PDF of Worlds Without Number, but DriveThruRPG codes for every single for-pay Sine Nomine product I've ever written as of October 5th, 2020, an oeuvre that includes ten years worth of writing, seven complete RPGs, and 24 other books and supplements. Yes, the entire Sine Nomine catalog is yours at this level at a 25% discount plus the deluxe Worlds Without Number PDF and a POD at-cost print code. While I'm unable to offer discounts for those who already have some of the materials, you have my blessing to give your DRM-free extra copies to friends or interested bystanders.
For those who must have it all, the Sine Nomine PDF Omnibus+Print level has everything the PDF omnibus level offers plus an offset print book shipped to you. It's everything I have; I can give no more than this.
There are no stretch goals planned for this project. While I appreciate the marketing value of such additions, the successful RPG Kickstarters I've run in the past seven years have all been built around simple, specific goals and rewards. I'm but one man, and it would be reckless for me to promise dice, t-shirts, miniatures, commemorative plates, or other tat when what I'm trying to create is a single traditional book. I've been here often enough that I don't need to flail desperately to snatch every possible dollar in a single campaign.
Much as with my prior Kickstarters, all art I commission for Worlds Without Number will be released for free personal and commercial use by others, as I've paid the artists for full rights to the work.
RPG enthusiasts have several reasons to back this KS and have confidence that the goods are going to be delivered.
I've run seven successful RPG Kickstarters, taking in a total of $355,068 from almost ten thousand backers. Every single campaign fulfilled on time or early. I have never been late with a Kickstarter reward, let alone failed to provide it. My Kickstarters are proverbial in their regularity, efficiency, and speed of delivery. My latest KS, Wolves of God, was my first foray into offset printing. The COVID pandemic hit in the middle of its final prep, it lost a printer the first time it went to press, and it still delivered two months before the due date.
My games pull players and GMs. By comparing the number of for-pay deluxe downloads with the number of free downloads of my products on DriveThruRPG, I can get a good idea of how many curious free-version downloaders turn into deluxe-edition buyers. As a result, I can see that as many as 1 in 4 of the free version downloaders decide it's worth paying me $20 for the full version of Godbound or Stars Without Number. This kind of support is tremendous, and shows just how widely-useful these games are to GMs.
I write for working GMs. I write every one of my games to be as useful as possible to as wide a range of readers as I can, whether or not they're going to use the system or the setting. The system-neutral tools I design are built to generate actual, playable content and smooth the rough edges of GM prep work for any game set in the same genre. I support and encourage GMs toward using the systems and settings they like best, so I have a large percentage of faithful customers who buy my books purely for the toolsets I provide within.
Finally, see for yourself whether the game offers the tools and materials you can use. The rough beta is waiting for you in the link in the first backer-only update. You don't have to wonder if the game suits your needs; you can pledge and find out this minute.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've completed seven on-time, successfully-delivered RPG Kickstarters over the past several years, so I know a great deal about what can and might go wrong with the process. My workflow for KS production includes numerous precautionary measures to absorb the inevitable setbacks, complications, and mishaps that always attend any major project. One of the most important measures is a clearly-stated policy on what constitutes "failure" for this Kickstarter and what will happen if that failure occurs. While none of my campaigns have ever been late or failed before, a failure plan is the sort of thing that needs to exist before it's actually needed.

If all promised rewards for this Kickstarter are not either fully delivered or actively in the process of shipping by one year after the promised Kickstarter delivery deadline, or if my death or other complete incapacitation occurs before the project is complete, this Kickstarter will be considered to have failed and the following procedures will go into effect.

* All available work will be released as-is in PDF form to backers in whatever state it exists in.

* A rendering of accounts will be presented on the project, including monies spent on art, printing, shipping, labor, taxes, and all other expenses by category, and an explanation will be given as to why it is economically or physically impossible to complete the project.

* The remaining funds will be returned pro-rata to backers, assuming any funds remain and the refund amounts are large enough to bear the transaction costs.

One of the major selling points of this campaign is the offer of an offset-print, Smyth sewn hardback book for backers. These books are much more durable than conventional glued-spine POD books, and I ran an earlier Kickstarter campaign, Wolves of God, chiefly to gain experience and contacts for successfully executing a print job like this. Despite the plague striking in the midst of the print project, I successfully shepherded it through and got the books sent to backers in September.

I expect to do the same this time around, hopefully with the absence of a pandemic. Even so, there is a non-trivial chance that the situation will conspire to defeat the print run. The printers used will be US-based, to avoid tariff or domestic delivery uncertainties, but some unforeseen disaster may ruin a print run, drive prices to infeasible levels, or otherwise prevent an offset print run from happening.

In such a case, print-level backers may be obliged to accept POD copies in lieu of offset print ones. If it is economically feasible I will endeavor to refund some portion of their pledge in that case, but since the only situation where such a course would be contemplated is one in which multiple disasters have already happened, this project may not have the money to offer such refunds.

I have planned the pledge levels on a worst-case basis, assuming that the offset print books won't actually be any cheaper than the POD standard-color books. Granted a print run of a few thousand, they should in fact be much cheaper, so much so that I can afford to do a second print run if the first is somehow lost or ruined, though this would likely add several months to the delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Munificent patrons,
I've just gotten word from the printer that the offset pages are printed and ready to go into the bindery. Their revised ship date is looking like 6/21 or so. Once it leaves the printer, it'll take about a week to get to the fulfillment house, and I'd expect a week for it to be processed once it arrives.
As soon as the books ship from the printer, I'll post an update here with a final reminder to make sure offset-print backers have their shipping addresses correct, or to update them in the survey if they've changed. When the books have finished intake at the fulfillment house, I'll freeze address changes, enter the shipping info for the backers, and post a final wrap update here. The excess offset books should be available via my webstore and Amazon at some relatively-near point after the shipping, with some held back to cover the inevitable ship failures. I'll post notice here when they're available for general purchase.

updates.update_userinfo: Worlds Without Number Offset Print Shipping Scheduled
updates.update_content:
Munificent patrons,
I've just received word from Jostens that the offset print copies of Worlds Without Number are due to be shipped from their plant to the fulfillment house on June 14th. I tentatively expect it to take about two weeks for the books to arrive at the fulfillment house and be received into their system; at that point, I'll be able to place the orders for those backers who are due an offset copy.
Once the backer copies have been shipped, it's my intention to make the remainder available through my website, as I'll hopefully be able to iron out the integration process there between now and then. I'm expecting about a thousand copies surplus, so non-backers ought to be able to get one if they move with reasonable promptness.

updates.update_userinfo: Worlds Without Number Release Candidate up and backer name finalization requested
updates.update_content:
Munificent patrons,
The release candidate for Worlds Without Number is now up in the beta folder, the Google Docs link to be found in the first backer-only update to this campaign. This is meant to be the final, send-it-to-the-printer, fully-bookmarked-and-indexed text, so the inevitable mistakes and typos you might find in it are genuine mistakes, and I ask that you post them here in the comments if you spot them.

updates.update_userinfo: Worlds Without Number beta 0.20 Now Out
updates.update_content:
Munificent patrons,
It's the first week of the month, so that means a new Worlds Without Number beta is due out. This beta is the pre-proofreading content-final version. It still needs a proofing pass, index, backers, running heads, and the final set of art slotted in, but the text itself is intended to be complete and final. It's not impossible that a few more pages might sneak in before next month's release candidate, but I wouldn't bet on it.

updates.update_userinfo: Worlds Without Number Beta 0.18 Now Out
updates.update_content:
Munificent patrons,
A fresh beta is up in the folder given in the first update of this campaign as December's project update. It's chiefly a blank-filling update, as the bulk of the work was in completing the Court, Community, and Ruin Tags sections, for 150 of the 200 total tags. Wilderness Tags remain, as I just need to come up with 750 clever ideas to flesh those tag elements out. Aside from that main work, however, I've also been fixing typos, correcting bits, and adding some extras. In this beta, you'll find...

Munificent patrons,
Your open-handed generosity has brought the Worlds Without Number Kickstarter to a resounding success. Thanks to your contributions, there is ample money to get art for the book, print the offset print run, and encourage me to continue making more WWN content for the future.
How successful was it? The KS for the revised version of its sister game, Stars Without Number, came in at $192K and 3,143 backers. This one beat it soundly, at $223K and 4,562 backers- and that's without the benefit of seven years of a built-in fanbase that the SWN revised edition had. More than that, SWN managed a very respectable 29% conversion of project followers to backers, but WWN got a full of casual followers to pledge. You've been the very model of generosity.

campaign.story:
What is Ancient Undead Spider Wizard?
Ancient Undead Spider Wizard is a table top RPG dungeon adventure. Gather friends and some dice and delve into a dusty crypt to uncover magical artifacts and defeat the Ancient Undead Spider Wizard.
Ancient Undead Spider Wizard is also a limited-run, 7" vinyl EP.  Each of the four instrumental pieces collected here inspired one of the four feature encounters that await explorers in the adventure.   
Homemade Prototype - Front Cover
Homemade Prototype - Back Cover
The Dungeon
The dungeon's story features the eponymous Ancient Undead Spider Wizard, a powerful undead magic user asleep for time untold. Will the Player Characters' entrance upon the crypt wake the eldritch threat?  
The crypt itself features four magical treasures, each protected by a powerful Guardian.  Only by overcoming the Spider Wizard's Guardians can the PCs amass the power necessary to defeat the Ancient Undead Spider Wizard. 
Be wary! The Spider Wizard seeks to regain dominion over the crypt's hidden treasures and yearns for the power granted by wielding all four artifacts at once. 
Homemade Prototype - Front of Sleeve
The dungeon is written for use with The Black Hack 2nd Edition, but will adapt to your favorite TTRPG systems. The monsters are listed with reference to Hit Dice ("HD"), making the dungeon easily convertible to almost any system that uses HD with little prep. Even games that utilize more complex monsters will only require a quick "re-skin" making game-prep quick and easy. 
Homemade Prototype - Back of Sleeve
The dungeon layout is being completed to achieve a maximum space efficiency for its purpose: wrapping a 7-inch vinyl EP.  The design work has begun, and by using templates made available by the potential manufacturer of the record sleeves, a legible and usable final product will be maintained.    
In order to squeeze as much impact out of the space available for print, Jared Sinclair has agreed to go through my final draft with a fine-toothed comb in order to make sure every square inch of white space is put to its best use.  
Early Draft of Record Cover Design (Check out the old title)
The Vinyl
Thanks to quality mixing and mastering, this is a collection of songs that wants to be played through your favorite headphones or stereo system. The tunes themselves are reminiscent of old-school video game background music if that music liked to rattle your sub-woofer.
The music was recorded mostly in March and April of 2020. It became clear that the Covid19 pandemic was going to alter the ways in which we lived our daily lives. One of the main ways I coped with the change was to spend nights writing and recording music. I was listening to a lot of hip-hop, synthwave, lo-fi, trip-hop, and dub at the time and those influences are apparent here.  
Early Draft of Inner Sleeve Design (Subject to Change)
The Kickstarter video at the top of this page features the single "The Spider," which is Track 4 of the EP and available at bandcamp (starting October 2nd).  You can also check out Track 2 of the EP, "The Cat," in the video below.  
What is the money for?
We are looking to fund the limited run pressing of Ancient Undead Spider Wizard. In order to press, we need to be able to make at least 300 copies. In order to press the records, print the covers and sleeves, and assemble it all for distribution, we will need about $3,000.  If we raise the $3,000, then we are pressing at least 300 copies.  
Shipping will be charged separately from the Kickstarter. 
Basic Shipping will start at $4 for the U.S. and $15 International. Shipping logistics are getting more and more complicated with current events. We will do our best to keep you updated with logistics plans as the campaign progresses.
Ancient Undead Spider Wizard - Wizard in a casket, Spider Power!
Random Encounters: The Mix Tapes
Ancient Undead Spider Wizard features a rollable table for random encounters in the crypt. Each random encounter is meant to challenge the boundaries of Player expectations and fuel imagination for the table at play.
What's more, the random encounter table stretches our musical accompaniment concept even further, as the encounters are all represented by their own tunes found in the Random Encounter Mix Tapes. Random Encounters: The Mix Tape, vol. 1 is available now on the Fish in the Pot itch page and features tracks for the first four random encounters. Volumes 2 and 3 are in mix-down and will be available soon. By the time the game releases all encounters, feature and random, will have their own soundtrack!  The Random Encounter Mix Tapes are (and will be) free to download, so check them out on itch!

updates.update_content:
Thank you all so much for all of your support for this project!  It's been so cool to see these records land in your homes and spin on your turntables. 
As of later this afternoon, about 98% of all of the rewards will be in the post.  This includes domestic and international, all tiers of pledges, and almost all of the add-ons.
There are a handful of folks who finished their BackerKit survey a little late (and a few who still haven't finished their survey).  These rewards will go out the door very, very soon.
If you got a t-shirt add-on, then please know that you will receive your record and other rewards in this initial shipping phase, but your t-shirt will not arrive until later in May.  I do not want to delay the shipping of your game/record and cards.  The t-shirt process is slower than I anticipated and my lack of proper planning has created delays in receiving your merch.  Do not worry.  Once I get the t-shirts, I will ship them separately at no additional cost to you.  All it costs you is just a few weeks of additional time.

Folks,
Most of you have received an email generated by Shipstation saying your package has shipped, but without any tracking information.  Not sure what I did wrong, but Shipstation did not populate the tracking information into the email it sent out to everyone.
If you want to track your package, then go to BackerKit.  BackerKit will have your tracking information link.

Super happy to report that the shipping is on its way out the door.
Batch number 1 (consisting of about 130 orders) is boxed, stamped, and ready to go.
Batch number 2 (consisting of about 120 orders) should be boxed and stamped by the end of today.
Batch number 3 (consisting of about 100 orders) should be boxed and stamped by Wednesday.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping slightly delayed. Still on target for April Fulfillment.
updates.update_content:
Not a huge update, but I wanted to let you know where I am with shipping.
Using BackerKit took a little longer than anticipated.  What I mean is that BackerKit charges cards and finalizes addresses in a very methodical manner that adds days to turn around time and significantly slows the process of funds being made available to a creator.
I've been waiting for your shipping payments to clear and then to hit my bank account so that I can pay to get these records shipped to you.  That looks like it finally cleared this weekend.  Thus, shipping will begin in earnest this week, with most of the work being completed this weekend.  This is a delay from what I promised in the last update, so I wanted to make sure you were all up to speed on what's happening here behind the curtain.

Hello all!
Just a very quick update to let you know that I got a notification that the handout cards are to be delivered to me tomorrow.  Presuming everything went well with the card printing, I plan on starting to batch out the shipping on Ancient Undead Spider Wizard starting this weekend.
I will be finalizing the first big batch of backerkit responses and running credit cards for shipping and add-ons today.  I'll post another update when I've started the shipping process.
Go fill out your BackerKit survey if you haven't yet. The records are here!

Hello all!
The records, the tarot proofs, and shipping materials are all headed to my house. I expect to have everything together by the end of next week and with some luck I'll be able to start shipping stuff out in 2-3 weeks.
Yesterday, I received notice that the Spider Wizard BackerKit was approved for launch.  I will launch it today and send out the required smoke test to make sure that the survey system is working correctly.

I'm receiving some good updates from Kindercore Vinyl and I can't wait to share a picture of the final record with you.  
Once the records are shipped to me, I'll post an update and open up BackerKit and the Merch Booth.
Meanwhile, I still owe around 90 of you access to the Digital Fish package.

Not really much else to report, other than the test press is here!
The inner sleeve looks great. It's a mixture of excitement and relief to know that the dungeon fits on that sleeve and is readable and usable despite the space limitations we were dealing with.
Anyway, yeah... Time to get the green vinyl ready for pressing.  Let's goooooooo!!!

campaign.story:
Title image by Mohamed Saad 
 Video editing by Sin Posadas 
Mask Up. Spill Blood. Drink the Rich.
Brinkwood: The Blood of Tyrants is a Forged in the Dark tabletop roleplaying game about building a rebellion that will overthrow the blood-soaked vampires that oppress and dominate your world. 
Download a Free Preview
You are a brigand, a commoner radicalized by tragedy who has decided to forsake their old life and flee into the woods to plot a rebellion. Cardenfell is your home, a kingdom on the brink of open revolt against the vampiric nobles and factory lords who rule over it. All it will take is a single spark. Your spark. 
Whether you're robbing from the rich and giving to the poor, or assassinating vampires and drinking their blood, every move you make will take you closer to your goal: liberating your home from the vampiric scourge of blood rent and exploitation. 
This campaign will fund a printed, fully illustrated book release of Brinkwood: The Blood of Tyrants.
Forest Brigand - Olivia Rea
Discord - Join the Chat -
Blades in the Dark™ is a trademark of One Seven Design. The Forged in the Dark Logo is © One Seven Design, and is used with permission.
Orslae - The Bloody Isles, Our Grisly Home
Our story begins in Cardenfell, a county on the island of Orslae, itself part of an archipelago known as The Bloody Isles. In many ways, Cardenfell is the beating heart of the Isles; as the saying goes, “Blood flows from Cardenfell.” It is controlled by one of the most powerful and favored vampire counts of the entire Crimson Crown and is as jealously guarded as it is viciously exploited.
Along the edge northern board of Cardenfell, lies your forest refuge, the Brinkwood. Since time immemorial, it has been avoided as a place of terrifying dangers and incredible magic, as all know it as a realm of the fae. And now, it is your home.
Nearly a century ago, the fae retreated into their forests. To this day, they fight a losing war against the vampires who invaded and ravaged their lands. From their magic and their souls, they forged masks able to grant some measure of their power to the mortal brigands who earn their trust. If you don these masks, they will take their toll, etching themselves upon your very soul, but allowing you to drink the blood of the rich and powerful vampires who dominate your world. From their blood, your masks will strengthen, allowing you and your rebellion to overcome seemingly impossible odds.
Vampires are created through imbibing blood sterling, an alchemical mixture of silver and blood.  Throughout the lands dominated by vampires, peasants are obligated to pay "blood rent." Paid in silver or blood, this vicious tax is paid to the vampire landlord who owns the land they live and work on.  It is important to note that vampires are not born, forced into their life, or even incapable of leaving it. A vampire who stops drinking blood will find their power withers away and their mortality slowly returns, but most are unwilling to sacrifice the “gifts” of the blood, even if it means they would no longer need to feast upon their fellow man.
The Duke - Mohamed Saad
Castlepunk - Anachronist Gothic Aesthetic, Punk Intention
We define Brinkwood's aesthetic as castlepunk. Castlepunk is an aesthetic genre that blends elements of gothic horror, medievalism, anachronism, victorianism, gas-punk and fantasy. You might find factories, gearworks, victorian fashion and other out-of-place setting details, but still set against a backdrop of gloomy castles, old decaying cities, and vaulted gothic architecture. This is a world where you’ll still find faeries and other supernatural creatures, but driven to the fringes, back into the darkest parts of the forest where few dare tread.
The “punk” in castlepunk implies a punk aesthetic and intention brought to bear on the setting. You aren’t here to admire the scenery, or brood in secret castles, or soliloquize on your moral complexity or the depths of your depravity while you drink the blood of virgins from a crystal chalice; you are here to fuck shit up. This isn’t a game about having sympathy for blood-drinkers and oppressors; it’s about staking them through the goddamn heart. Be reckless. Be active. Stay mad. Stay punk.
Blood of Tyrants - Olivia Rea
The Rebellion - A Practical Guide to Revolution
Brinkwood: The Blood of Tyrants is based on the Forged in the Dark SRD, but takes cues from games such as Trophy, Belonging Outside Belonging, Dracula Over Europe, and the entire itch.io indie scene. 
Each time you sit down to play Brinkwood, you will choose a different mask for your brigand to wear. The masks you choose will grant access to powerful new abilities and actions, while occasionally offering you mask bargains designed to push your character's commitment to the cause and radicalize them further. 
The decision of which mask to wear allows flexibility both to the player and character, as you can explore different roles and abilities without being "locked in" to an unsuitable build. Is your character without much martial training caught in the midst of battle? Don the masks of Violence or Terror and sow destruction and fear among your enemies. Is your taciturn brigand in a situation where they must deceive their enemies or rally allies to their cause? Take up the masks of Lies or Riot, and sow deception, truth, or hope.
The extensive almanac included in Brinkwood contains descriptions of cities, towns, villages, factions, allies, and deadly vampires, as well as their terrifying servants. As you GM Brinkwood, you will never be at a loss for what lurks around the next corner, and the cycle of foray, downtime, and planning phases will allow you to follow the fiction you and your players create. In play-testing, a 10 minute break before each foray was enough time for our GMs to check up on the lore and use its resources to generate a reliable "idea cloud" to pull from during play.
Brinkwood marries the Forged in the Dark faction game with revolutionary politics by laying out a "map" of Cardenfell before you, and generating opportunities and threats for you to seize, defeat, or ignore at your peril. As your rebellion gains strength, your enemies will take greater and greater notice of the true threat you pose, and the back and forth between vampire and brigand will drive your campaign towards climactic final clashes as your underground rebellion graduates into open revolution.
The Organist - Steph Cheung
Preview - A Sampling of Deeds to Come
Our talented artists and designers have been hard at work to create several previews of what the finished Brinkwood book is likely to look like. Below, is a mock-up of the book's finished cover.

Quotes - Testimonies of Witnesses and Comrades

"If I wanted to throw my boss out of a castle window this is how I'd do it." -Paul "Ettin" Matijevic, author of Breakfast Cult
"...there's a certain catharsis that can be found in sitting down to a table and agreeing to play a game of The Purge, except you're hunting rich people, except the rich people are vampires, and the well just goes and goes." - Jonathan Heddleston, Podpod Castcast
"It has some really beautiful art and graphic design. truly looks professional. there's a tension to the text that conveys the theme of the game with conviction." -Orion Black, author of Mutants in the Night
"Brinkwood is a very timely story of Revolution, camaraderie, and coalition-building in the face of tyranny on top of some really cool twists on the Blades system. Don a mask to strike fear into the hearts of your oppressors and plan a conspiracy in the shadows of a fantasy-world turned fascist. It's a fantastic roleplaying game you should add to your collection!" - umbralAeronaut, author of hello, world
"Beneath the blood and soot Cardenfell is a place much like our world—and it is so much scarier for it. Don your mask, swear your oaths to whatever fae being you owe allegiance, and pry the blood sterling from their cold, dead hands." - Jason Brown, author of Our Queen Crumbles
"The dark, beautiful fantasy that Brinkwood offers is one of encountering your darkest self - then finding hope in its depths, together with the resolve to burn the world down in order to build a new one. This Forged in the Dark game pushes the boundaries of an already excellent system, and encourages players to explore what rebellion means for them. Oh, and you get to literally bathe in the blood of vampiric enemies. Always a plus." -Pam Punzalan, designer of Sundo: We, Once Mortal
"Brinkwood is like Robert Holdstock wrote a vampire fairytale, mixing in fae, mythic masks, and revolution. It's like a better Carnival Row. The implementation of Forged in the Dark is top notch - it's a blast to play to find out what happens to your brigands." - Wil Hutton, Game Designer
"Games let us tell stories. Sometimes those stories are about being damaged and marginalised outsiders using your bones and blood to tear down the machinery of the empire that seeks to end you." - Talen Lee, Invincible Ink
Ifig, The Deserter - Mohamed Saad
Rewards - Necessities for the Aspiring Brigand
Are you outside of the US? No worries! Check out the FAQ for details on how you can get ANY or ALL of these rewards delivered to you without breaking the bank!
Full Color PDF
We are expecting the finished PDF to clock in at approximately 200 full color pages, and will feature professional grade layout, PDF bookmarks, and built-in accessibility options.
Print-On-Demand
The Print-On-Demand version will include a coupon to buy an at-cost version of Brinkwood from DriveThruRPG. We expect the at-cost price (due at time of purchase to DriveThruRPG) to be between 10-25 dollars, depending on which options you choose, such as color, gray-scale, hardcover, softcover, and print quality.
Fulfilled by DriveThruRPG
Physical Copy
The Physical Copy will be a retail physical version of Brinkwood, printed with a full-color hardcover and satin-finish interior pages.
Printed Using Mixam - the smart way to print
Map Poster
The Map Poster will will be printed in full color with a satin finish. The map of Cardenfell is being developed by Brian Yaksha, and you can view a preview of it here.
Art Book
The Art Book will include full color illustrations of the art of Brinkwood, as well as behind-the-scenes development insight and design notes from our artists and monster designers.
Nom de Guerre
For the Nom de Guerre reward, a preferred name of your choice and its translation into the thematic "Orslaean" language will be included in a table of NPCs in the final version of Brinkwood. This is a bit like an "extra thank you" or "name in the credits" reward, except you're also immortalized as a heroic brigand who fought against tyranny and injustice.

Stretch Goals - Further Texts, Yet Unwritten
UNLOCKED GOALS
Our Kickstarter page has run out of room for stretch goals, so we'll be trimming the list of our funded goals periodically in order to free up space. To view a full list of the stretch goals that have already funded, visit this blog post here!
$16,000 - In the Face Of Our Despair 
In the Face of Our Despair - By Jamila R. Nedjadi of Sword Queen Games
This stretch goal will fund a extended edition of In the Face of Our Despair, a Brinkwood game by Jamila R. Nedjadi. In Despair, players take on the role of the ancient fae who appear in Brinkwood - The Blood of Tyrants as they make their retreat into the forests. You can purchase the original edition of In The Face Of Our Despair here.
This stretch goal will fund additional art, layout, and editing for In the Face of Our Despair, as well as a zine-style print run of the new, extended edition. Our backers will be the first to purchase this extended edition in physical and/or digital format. All proceeds from digital sales will go to Jamila, with a 70% / 30% split for physical copies after production costs. 
$20,000 - Monstrous Art
Steph Cheung
This stretch goal will fund additional monster art, produced by Steph Cheung and Myca Labelle. We look forward to them bringing more of the monstrous beauty of Brinkwood and its denizens to life!
Myca Labelle
$33,000 - Fellwood and Brigand's Dictionary
Alex (@roxasbuddy) maps out the Fellwood. A work of the deeper, twisted parts of the Brinkwood. Other, alien threats are talked of here in the sanctuary against the vampire nobility.
Josh (@joshtjordan) creates the Brigand's Dictionary, a glossary of slang, passwords, fae greetings, and other useful phrases in the dialect of the residents of Orslae. This dictionary designed for the Bloody Isles contains fictionalized versions of terms from Scots, Faroese, and Icelandic.
$36,000 - Brigand's Treatise and In Want of Blood
Olivia Hill (@machineiv) will give a Treatise on adaptability and guerrilla tactics. If your sword breaks, grab a pitchfork. If your pitchfork breaks, let's talk sharpened sticks. Warfare when you're out-numbered and out-gunned isn't hopeless—you just have to want the win more than your enemy does.
Siôn Rodriguez y Gibson (@Estuary_Witch) brings us the Austen-esque guide to playing Scions, In Want of Blood. “It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of blood.” When the scions of the blood-red order rebel it is often useful for them not to stray too far from the luxury of the nest. In order to unravel vampiric schemes and steal vital intelligence for their comrades, such rebellious children must still attend the balls and soirees and even accept marriage proposals from the leeches. In a mannered world you must hide rebellion behind pretty words and slip an ashwood stake into your petticoats.
$40,000 - Brinkwood Refuge
Brinkwood Refuge
This stretch goal will fund the completion of Brinkwood Refuge, a Belonging Outside Belonging role-playing game by Jamila R. Nedjadi. Refuge is can be played between regular sessions of Brinkwood, in order to explore the experience of revolutionary life from a different perspective. 
Refuge focuses on quiet moments, and can be played standalone or as part of an extended Brinkwood campaign. It's focus is on the people who are left behind during a foray, who quietly but dutifully build and sustain the rebellion. This game can be played between sessions of Brinkwood, making the Refuge feel real and truly alive.
View an actual play session of Brinkwood Refuge below:
This stretch goal will fund the completion of Brinkwood Refuge, and the finished version of Refuge will be bundled with Jammi's previous game, In the Face of our Despair, as an add-on to this campaign at a reduced cost to you, our backers. This stretch goal may fund a physical version of Refuge, if funding permits, which will also be made exclusively available to our backers via an add-on.

$43,000 - Colonia and Brinkwood Skirmish
Simon Moody (@LuchaLibris) brings colonial Mexico to Cardenfell. Become bandidos allied with outlawed gods to fight the vampire lords who’ve bled you dry since they came to your shores. Castlepunk meets Borderpunk in a bloody Mexican Western revenge story. ¡Viva la revolución!
Biscuit Fund Games (@plumtreechloe) musters Brinkwood: Armies of Blood and Silver, an expansion for the wallet-friendly war-game, Skirmish, that will let you pit Vampiric armies against one another as they carry out their ancient vendettas over blood-soaked soil.
$46,000 - The Scene is Dead and the Militant Faithful
Allie (@madpierrot) creates The Scene Is Dead, Long Live The Scene. Pop-punk used to be GarageBand and trundling vans. But times are changing and money flashes recklessly. Set against the backdrop of a Warped Tour that never was, your band must defend the scene from corporate vampires and make it to the end of the Distortion Tour.
V.J. Harris (@victhhe) expands on the beliefs and actions of the Prayers with the Militant Faithful. How they moved away from the Reformed Faithful and how some have taken it a step further and become the Militant Faithful, a sect that gets blood on their hands to liberate the people from their blood-sucking tyrants.
$50,000 - A Noble Lord and How We Live
Shannon Strucci (@plentyofalcoves) writes the short story A Noble Lord. Some who take the blood do so with the best of intentions: to guide, to lead, to improve the lives of the lesser commonfolk they rule. But the best intentions born into a system such as the Crimson Crown all too quickly go awry.
Adrianna Burton (@adriiadventures) writes How We Live, showcasing the minutiae of the rebellion through a vignette story with early, middle, and late campaign insert points. Various vignettes adopt the POV of diverse characters that grapple with the price of liberation as well as its benefits.
$55,000 - Brinkwood 2070, Cardenfell '65, Beneath the Mask and Lorebound
Dyer Rose (@BasiliskOnline)steps forward with Brinkwood 2070: Step into a Cardenfell of tomorrow, a cyberpunk dystopia where Vampires have driven the Brinkwood back and forced it to retreat into cyberspace, where ashwood is cultivated in secret and hunted endlessly, where technology allows the Corporate Vampire Lords to oppress and exploit on scales never before imagined, and wealth and luxury beyond reach are to be had.
That doesn’t stop you from masking up and spilling blood, though. Now, more than ever, is a time for rebellion. Now, more than ever, is time to act. Twist those same technologies and advancements to destroy the Vampires that rule from their spires of silver and glass.

Austin (@sailorsctaustin) writes Cardenfell '65: What if Cardenfell was a city/suburb/community in mid 60s America, growing in numbers it seeks to demolish the community nearby of Brinkwood for expansion reasons?

W.H. Arthur (@Aryl_Ether) writes the short story Beneath the Mask. The local gazette in Cardenfell would have you believe the duke as a benevolent ruler. Meanwhile, a brigand goes about their everyday life and sees the city as it truly is.

Ginger (@inkyginge) creates Lorebound. Make Brinkwood come alive with rumours, red herrings, strange mysteries and plot seeds. Lorebound are the Shadow of Man and a Glimmer of Fae, twisted by time and magic, they collect and tell the strange happenings of the forests throughout Orslae.
FINAL GOAL: $75,000 - DOUBLED Mutual Fund
We will double our contribution to the San Jenaro Mutual Fund. This fund will be used to jumpstart production of worker-owned tabletop RPGs, such as Brinkwood. With this stretch goal, we're paying forward our success. Our hope is that this will "seed" a mutual fund that will allow groups of creators to pay for art, layout, editing, and other "jumpstart" costs necessary to produce quality tabletop RPGs, without having to dip into their own pockets.
Funding - Allocations and Accountings Explained
Brinkwood was developed in a Co-Op model, meaning that all the business decisions involved in making this game were voted upon by all workers, including our funding and share structure.
The funds raised by this Kickstarter will be used as follows:
$2,200 - Artwork and Graphic Design Commissions
$600 - Consultant, Advertising, and Other Commissions
$2,800 - Production Costs
$2,400 - Shares
$1,000 - Kickstarter and Backerkit Fees
$500 - Charge-back Buffer
$500 - Additional Costs Buffer
The funds raised for "shares", as well as any additional profits raised by this Kickstarter or through other sales of Brinkwood, will be split according to a democratically approved shares model described below: 
The net profits of Brinkwood will be divided into "Share Pools", with 5% of the net profit going to the San Jenaro Co-Op Mutual Fund.
The remaining net profit will be split into "Share Pools" as follows:
Writer - 13%
Editor - 13%
Layout - 13%
Promotion - 20% 
Artist - 20%
Consultant - 20%
Share Pools - A pie chart illustrating the percentage shares of the different share pools.
Each worker will receive shares of these pools according to additional democratically-approved agreements. The Promotion, Artist, and Consultant pools will contain more workers, and are accordingly larger. Artists and Consultants are also receiving commissions, as described above. 
About Us - Of Your Humble Scribes and Artists
Brinkwood is a product of the San Jenaro Co-Op.
San Jenaro Co-Op
The San Jenaro Co-Op is a 100% creator owned and profit-shared group of workers who have come together to make kick-ass tabletop role-playing games by focusing on people first, equitable profit distribution, and creator ownership.
Brinkwood Team
Project Manager - Erik Bernhardt (@ErikTheBearik) is a game designer and project manager who has worked on previous Kickstarters Crone and Crown of Tines. He's a big fan of witches, revolutionary politics, and staking vampires through the goddamn heart.
Worldbuilder - Brian Yaksha (@goatmansgoblet)is a malnourished and absent-minded academic who specializes in random generators and other such villainy. Brian is notable for having written Rakehell and Spoils of the Gorgon Coast; as well as contributions to Best Left Buried: Deeper, Wormskin, Dolmenwood, and the Chromatic Soup zines. They were nominated for an ENnie. 
Faction Designer -Jón Gísli Björgvinsson (@Socratease2G) is overly concerned with silver and the fae. 
Monster Designer - O. Hybridity (@ShillSphinx) is the author of "8 Missed Calls," Shop Talk, Crisis Complex, PheVerin and the monster-a-day one-size-fits-all fantasy roleplay resource TERATOSCOPE.
Layout Designer - Francita (@byfrancita) is a graphic designer from Chile, who loves cute stuff. She is currently in-house graphic designer for Machine Age Productions, the creators of #iHunt.
Editor - Michelle B (@mizunotic)is an editor from California. She has two small dogs and hates paying her inflated rent.
Video Editor - Sinta Posadas (@diwataMANILA) is a game designer from the Philippines who loves writing games that focus on drawing power from within and exploring connections with the world with just a dash of magic realism.
Artists
Steph Cheung is a queer artist who loves long walks and collecting crow feathers. She lives in Seattle with her partner, an extremely large cat, Rexi and darling pet snake, Maru. 
Myca Labelle is your friendly neighborhood mushroom. Visual artist from Canada  working mainly in pen and ink, specializing in horror, monsters,  myths and mushrooms!
Olivia Rea is an illustrator with a love of all things fantasy and RPGs! she likes to create beautiful and dark moods in herwork, and really enjoys projects with a strong sense of story.
Mohamed Saad is an Egyptian artist working in the movie, video game and digital art industry.
Byron Swain does do 2-D art, writes adventures, and dabbles in game design.

Risks and challenges
By utilizing Print-On-Demand and local offset printing, we'll be able to ship locally-printed versions of the game directly to you, without going through lengthy import or international shipping woes.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Brinkwood is a long-term game, designed to be played over the course of months. It is also designed to be highly adaptable to setting changes or remixing, so it's a game you can enjoy, set aside, and come back to fresh again and again.
Sustainable materials
By using PDFs and print-on-demand as an optional production model, we'll be limiting production of physical goods.
Sustainable Distribution
By utilizing Print-On-Demand and local offset printing, we'll be able to ship locally-printed versions of the game directly to you, without going through lengthy import or international shipping woes.
