Brinkwood Manual 0.7.1

Hello brigands!

Thank you all for your support and contributions to Brinkwood thus far. As we wrap up the Kickstarter and move towards production and delivery, I wanted to let you know what our next steps will be.

campaign.story:
PLAY

OUT OF THE BASEMENT AND INTO THE STREETS!
Brothers and Sisters, the time is nigh!  As the maelstrom of the CURRENT STATE OF AFFAIRS continues its relentless attack on our companionship, creativity, and general well-being, YOU have been conscripted to FIGHT BACK!
Join the Darkest Dice ministry TODAY and spread the Good Word of Role Playing Games!
R.I.P. Black Leaf
I used to be an ice cream man.  One summer, a guy gave me a Jack Chick religious tract as a tip.  I was struck by its format and horrified by its message:  just by rolling the dice, I was opening the doorway to Satanic mind-control and dark magic.  Despite best efforts when rolling said dice, I received no special powers.  What I did get was a group of awesome friends sitting around a table weaving tales of adventure and camaraderie.  Every person deserves that experience- especially these days.
Darkest Dice is a project to spread the magic of role playing games and get people together as inclusive, supportive communities to roll dice, tell stories, and have good times.
Darkest Dice Art by Brad McDevitt
What is Darkest Dice?
Darkest Dice is a pocket -sized  basic RPG rule set based on the OGL.  It is designed in an aesthetic similar to those infamous (hateful) religious tracts that pop up everywhere (around 23 pages in a 5 x 2.75 in. format).  Four copies come in each order- 1 for you, and 3 to spread around the world!  Yes, you are buying something to give away. Anyone should be able to pick these rules up and begin a game.
We are sowing the seeds of fantastic fun to make the world just a bit cooler.
 REWARDS
Digital: PDFs will be distributed through DriveThruRPG.
Physical: Backers who pledge $10 or more receive 4 Darkest Dice booklets!  A single booklet will be about 23 pages in a 5 x 2.75 in. format.  It will be staple-bound and contain black and white art, with a single color cover. We will ship to the US through USPS. Shipping for US backers is included in your pledge. Shipping will be charged to non-US backers before fulfillment. International shipping for one set will be no more than $5.00!
 THE CREW 
Joey Royale- Creator and Writer
Rock and roll werewolf, dad, and educator. I love role playing games, vintage action figures, and playing the banjo. I write adventures and roll dice to blow off steam and create new worlds with awesome people. Lead writer of “One of Us: Sideshow Salvation in a Dystopian Dustbowl”, an official third-party DCC RPG zine coming out soon.
Brad McDevitt- Artist
Brad McDevitt, the artist for Darkest Dice, has been a fan of weird art since early childhood, when he discovered is older brothers’ collection of comics. He has been hooked ever since, and his skills as a young artist naturally led him to a career as a professional artist starting in the late 1980s.
Working in the gaming industry is very close to a dream come true. He gets to draw horribly mutilated corpses and nightmarish monsters on a regular basis and get paid for it, and has now been doing it in well over seven hundred books, magazines, card games, and countless T-shirt designs.  Besides his ongoing art duties, he also has a line of budget-priced stock art for use in the gaming industry, Clipart Critters, which at present is closing in on six hundred entries.
Brad lives in Northwest Ohio with Jessica, his wife on almost eighteen years. When not drawing, he likes to check out new musical styles, read, and watch genre and horror movies and TV. He would like to say he also likes to draw puppies, flowers, and fluffy bunnies, but his mommy told him never to tell a lie.
Brad loves to hear from his fans (assuming he has any) and may be reached at bkmcdevitt@yahoo.com. More of his work may be seen at www.bradleykmcdevitt.net , at Facebook  (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Bradley-K-McDevitt-Illustration), Tumblr (http://www.tumblr.com/blog/artmann100), and on Twitter (https://twitter.com/bkmcdevitt).
By Brad McDevitt

Patrick Regan- Layout Designer
Patrick Regan, the layout designer for Darkest Dice, is an illustrator, graphic and motion graphic designer from New London, Connecticut. Growing up heavily inspired by Star Wars, The Lord of the Rings, and Batman, he spent countless hours at his kitchen table drawing to help bring his imagination to life, and in doing so; he has created and destroyed hundreds of fictional characters and universes.
Ultimately, this led to Patrick’s enrollment at the Hartford Art School where he began to refine his skills. Since 2016, Patrick has worked full time as an in house motion graphic designer for Astor Place Inc, a video production and marketing company. He has also worked on hundreds of freelance illustration and design projects including beer can art, t-shirt designs, book cover art, album art, and more.
When not working on commissioned projects, Patrick is busy at work designing, illustrating, animating and bringing to life his own fantasy world projects, collecting comics and vinyl, at the beach or reading.
Patrick can be reached at patrick_regan@sbcglobal.net
His work can be viewed at pat123xyz.com and on Instagram @cemeterykiss
by Patrick Regan

campaign.story:
What is Shitty Werewolf?
Shitty Werewolf is a combination of lowbrow art, weird ideas, and high concept meta-commentary on the classic social party game Werewolf.  Unlike traditional Werewolf, the roles/powers in Shitty Werewolf frequently break not just the conventions of the genre but also the basic play loop of the game itself, all while exploring the social dynamics present in group game interactions.
Does It Play Just Like Werewolf but Shittier?
We think it actually plays better? One major change to the traditional rules is that the roles and their special rules aren’t tied to being a werewolf or villager. This means that we can have a lot more roles that are fun/interesting/stupid to play but become super obvious once you start interacting. For example, if you have to growl the whole time it becomes pretty clear who you are, but it’s not at all known if you are actually a werewolf or just a lunatic villager. It also keeps things fresher with the roles because the way you’ll interact with your powers/restrictions can vary quite a bit depending on what you’re trying to accomplish. The roles are also labeled as Stupid or Pretentious so you can easily play games with just the weirder fun stuff in the mix and skip the really out there arty vibes.
--
What Kinds of Weird Roles and Shitty Powers are in Shitty Werewolf?
With roles like the “Socially Awkward Friend Who Hates Werewolf but Didn’t Want to Make a Fuss About It” and the “Mansplainer” games can start to unravel around the all-too-real social conventions and conversational baggage we bring to the experience of playing Werewolf. But this high mindedness is coupled with roles like the “Swearwolf” and the “Raccoon” that make it clear that this is still mostly a game about being weird together, even if you might end up with some deep thoughts along the way.
Can I Use The Shitty Werewolf Cards to Play Regular Werewolf?
You can indeed just ignore all the role cards and play standard Werewolf with this beautifully illustrated deck!
 This is a really simple campaign with two reward levels…
The Game: 20 cards in a cute little envelope. Printed on 310gsm poker sized cards cause even shitty games should be built to last.
Custom Card & Art: I'll draw you or your dog (or whatever really) as a card in the game and send you the original art along with five (5) copies of the card itself. The original art will be black ink on a 3x5 card. The default role text will be something to the effect of “Capitalist Pig: At any time you may pay $10 to a player to force them to vote as you choose” but I’m open to changing that if you really prefer something else (within reason). You get a copy of the game too.
 OK, But How Do I Play Shitty Werewolf?
If you know how to play Werewolf you already know pretty well how to play Shitty Werewolf, but here’s a quick rundown of the core concept…
Everyone is secretly a villager or a werewolf. Over a series of night/day rounds, the werewolves will eat villagers on the DL at night, then the whole town will argue about who is a werewolf and execute someone every day. The villagers are trying to kill all the werewolves while the werewolves are trying to eat enough villagers to outnumber them before they are executed. The game requires a moderator to run things and with special powers can get really complicated, but the core is a very simple game based around arguing with each other over who is a filthy lying werewolf.
You can check out our full draft rules document to see how to play Werewolf as well as the changes we’ve made here: Shitty Werewolf Rules Draft  v0.9 
 Is This A Real Game or Just a Shitty Joke?
The project started 100% stupid to make me and my friends laugh, but as I started writing the actual roles, I ended up getting a little too pretentious, and now it’s still shitty, but also a meta-commentary on the game Werewolf, and social games in general. It was always meant to be a fully playable version of Werewolf but now it’s become a bit more than that. Though there are still plenty of just plain weird roles in the mix if you wanna be stupid.
 Who are you?
This particular project is pretty much 100% just me, Matt Fantastic. My day job is designing/developing games for other publishers, adjunct teaching game design, and owning a game shop/library so this is really totally only for fun. Cause like, why wouldn't my fun hobby just be a weirdo version of what I do for a living? I've been putting out weird little projects like this off and on for the last 7+ years with Prettiest Princess and killjoy, working with friends to make things we think are cool.
 If you’d like to learn a lot more about the origins of the original Werewolf (AKA Mafia), the Wikipedia page actually has a ton of great info on the history, theory, and evolution of the original game of Mafia by Dimitry Davidoff.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mafia_(party_game)
We’ll be charging shipping via BackerKit after the campaign closes. Since our garbage president has decided to try and destroy the US Postal Service I’m not comfortable committing to what it would cost right now to send it. But as of right now it’s about $2-3 to send it within the US.
International backers I kind of have no idea cause everything is bonkers around the world in 2020, but I mail them in small padded envelopes and they weigh about 6 ounces if you wanna make your own estimates. Usually I’d offer to bring them to Essen Spiel or UK Games, but I’m not super hopeful us US citizens will be allowed into the EU and/or Covid won’t cancel 2021 events so I’d rather not overpromise.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
It's 2020 and everything is terrible, so who the fuck knows, but this will be our 6th tiny envelope release so we feel pretty good about our process on them.

We're printing it in the US with a factory we've used before so that should be pretty chill, but if there is a Covid lockdown at some point in the next couple months that could slow things down. We'll be putting them together and shipping them out by hand here at the office, so as long as we have hands and an office we shouldn't have issue there.

We've frankly got a mixed record here on Kickstarter, with one supremely late project (that did fulfill) and a bunch of other projects we weren't in charge of the logistics on (just did creative) that did well. But this is super small and manageable, and we've got a lot more experience putting out little weird games like this.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey all, just wanted to check in since it's been a minute and say that things are still moving along as reasonably planned. But we're also not ahead of schedule. Turns out that drawing is hard and while I wouldn't say I regret it at all, it's tough to draw so much when it isn't something I otherwise ever spend much time doing! But then I remember that this is a "problem" because so many of you wanted to support this weird little thing and I'm just so thankful and humbled by it all. You're all the best!
-

Hey everyone, hopefully you've had a reasonably chill holiday and while 2021 got off to quite the wild start, it's been a pretty alright last few days. I don't have a ton to share but wanted to let everyone know we're still trucking along as expected.

If you haven't yet, check out the print & play and the feedback survey: https://forms.gle/78dL8rnQyq2orG6M8
I still wanna hear what you think of the final card list! It has been really helpful to hear feedback, even if some of you are so totally wrong...

Hey everyone, we got the money from KS so now it's just on us to keep working towards finalizing the exact language/art and work through the production details. Shocking no one, it isn't exactly the easiest thing to test a game for 15 people in the age of Covid. But things are trucking along as expected with no delays or anything.
--
I'm not planning to do scheduled updates for this campaign since it's not exactly complicated and when I have something worth sharing, I'll just share it. If you ever have questions or anything just send us a message or post a comment.

Thank you all so so much! This has been one of the brightest spots in an absolute dumpster fire of a year and your support means the world. 
What’s next? 
I’ve got some more drawing and editing to do to make sure everything is optimally shitty, then I’m prepping the files for printing. It should be pretty smooth sailing on all that since it’s not exactly a complicated process.

If you've just arrived, I'm so glad you're here! We are fully funded and have unlocked five Stretch Goals.  There are a ton of new things we'd like to design to add to this system. Will you help us unlock some more stretch goals? This campaign has no add-ons, so every piece you see is included in your pledge.

 Welcome One and All...

....to a new world of tabletop game accessories. The Pillars of Stone hexagon tile system has something for everyone. Whether you play cards, board games, or tabletop RPGs, this new interlocking system is bound to take your gaming to new levels.
 We've made it quite simple for this Campaign: if you pledge at "The Pillar" level you will get all the .STL files including stretch goals for personal use. If you pledge at "The Stone Merchant" level you will receive all the .STL files including stretch goals, and a 1 year commercial license to 3D print physical versions of the files, starting 1 week after the files are distributed.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 What do you get for backing the campaign? You get a 3D printable system for your tabletop needs. We've designed dice towers, bowls, coasters, name plates and letters, card holders, cell phone stands, Rock Slides and more. With your help we can expand this system to include even more awesome terrain and accessories for your tabletop games. The tiles will also be compatible with the openLOCK clip system.  

                   (Please note, designs are still subject to changes and modification)
 But let's not stop there...
With your help we can unlock even more tiles, terrain and fun 3D prints for your tabletop games! We've got a few more things in the works currently waiting to be unlocked. Tell us what other types of tiles, terrain and scatter pieces you'd like to see in the campaign comments.
 Even more ideas...
     I've been thinking about this system night and day and there are a ton of things that we could still add, here are more ideas that I'd love your feedback on.
Stair Step Paint Holders
Another Cell Phone Stand with more themed elements
More Dice Towers and Slides
More Genres (like steampunk, cyberpunk, sci-fi, etc)
Trenches
River Tiles
Stacking Bowls
Alternate, built-in clipping system
Walls that work with Hexagons
More Scatter Terrain
I want to hear your thoughts, what kind of tiles and pieces do you want for your games? With your help I can continue to design more pieces and add to this system.
Review Video
Check out Gaming Geek's review of Pillars of Stone. He painted them and everything! Be sure to check out his channel and subscribe, he posts awesome videos about gaming, 3D printing, and making stuff.
Download this free Obelisk tile to try it out!
Free Obelisk Sample Tile
Why the name "Pillars of Stone"?
   As I was designing the hexagon bases, I was reminded of the rock formations that grow in hexagons (polygons). Basalt formations can be seen all around the world and form these awesome pillars of stone. I thought it was a fitting name seeing as the pieces are hexagon shaped and all fit together.
How does it clip together?
 Instead of reinventing the wheel, we've decided to use the openLOCK system by printablescenery.com Since the 3D printing community is already using this clipping system, we wanted to make our hexagon tiles able to clip into it as well.  The edge of the hexagons is 3", and fits with the 3" tiles from openLOCK. 
OpenLOCK capitalising LOCK
 If you haven't used openLOCK before you, you will need to remove the built in supports with some pliers before clipping them together.
Cleaning up the built in supports
adding clips to the base
two tiles clipping together
Below you can see how the hexagons compare with other tile sizes.
 Do they need supports?
Using the openLock system, the bottom of the bases themselves need supports, but the actual designs above the tile base do not.  You can just set your slicer to supports "touching build plate." That way you only have to remove supports from the bottom cavity of the tiles as shown.
Removing supports from bottom cavity
 We've been working on test printing as we continue to design more pieces.  All of the files also go through a digital testing process to ensure that the meshes are "manifold" (have no holes) and that they can sliced.  Our FDM printer has been running around the clock test printing the tiles.
Test Prints
 FDM or RESIN?
    Think of these tiles more like terrain. The tiles are fairly large, and also are designed to print flat. They are designed to work with real life objects (playing cards, paint pots, sticky notes, etc.) and therefore need to accommodate their size. For that reason we recommend using an FDM printer because you will usually have a larger build area, and filament generally has a lower cost than resin. 
     If you do decide to print these in resin, you will need a larger build area than your typical bench top resin printer. The build volume will need to accommodate the tile base which measures approximately 152mm x 132mm, the height will vary from piece to piece.
How big does your printer need to be?
All models will have to option to print on a bed as small as 180mm x 180mm x 180mm (7in x 7in x 7in)
The base of the hexagon tiles measure approx: 152mm L x 132mm W and the height will vary from piece to piece. Any models that are over 180mm tall will come with both a solid version and a split version to print on printers with a shorter height allowance.
Tall pieces will be split so that no pieces are over 180mm tall
We recommend the following settings for FDM printing:
Layer Height: 0.2mm
Infill: 15-20%
Supports: Touching Build-plate only
You will need to have your printer tuned up and printing cleanly for these tiles. The bases have precise joints for clipping together with openLOCK clips. We recommend NOT printing any layers thicker than .2mm. 
   Be sure to minimize things like "elephant foot" and squished / blobby corners as these can affect how the tiles clip together. If you do have over extrusion on the bottom and corners, you may need to sand the edges slightly to allow the clips to fully come together.
When will I get the files?
   The files will be distributed shortly after the campaign has ended and all the pledges have been finalized.  The Starting Files should be available by the end of September 2020, and the stretch goals will be distributed as soon as they are ready, depending on the number of goals we unlock. Hopefully, I can get them all finished up in 6-8 weeks.
Meet the Designer
    My goal with this Kickstarter campaign is to provide you with some awesome and useful accessories for your tabletop games. I'd like to expand our 3D printable offerings for the tabletop 3D printing community and continue to make it grow. Design is my passion and I hope to become a valuable asset to this awesome community of gamers and makers.
      Thank you so much for your support on this project. The funds go directly to supporting my family and small business. Your support helps make it so that I can 1.) Design new things, 2.) Eat and pay bills, and 3.) Buy more materials and tools necessary for designing and testing new items.
Special Thanks to:
My beautiful and supportive wife Bekah, who loves me no matter what kind of crazy idea I come up with and encourages me to pursue them.
My awesome brother Steven for composing the musical score for the video.
Gaming Geek, for taking the time to make an awesome review video.
On-Board Gaming, our FLGS (friendly local game store), for helping spread the word.
Terms of Use
   If you back the project at "The Pillar" tier, the files are for personal use ONLY. You may NOT sell physical copies. The files may NOT be sold, modified, transferred or shared. They may NOT be edited and/or incorporated into other projects for any distribution, sharing or sale. Files may only be modified for personal, non-commercial use.
   If you wish to use the files commercially we will be providing an annual commercial printing license "The Stone Merchant" tier. This license grants the entity/ individual one year of Royalty Free use. You may only print physical, un-modified versions of the items for sale. All of the tiles have "designed by xykit.com" cut into the bottom, you must leave this as part of the design. You may NOT sell, share, transfer, modify or distribute any of the digital files, images, graphics, or media. The files may not be modified and/or incorporated into any other project in digital or physical form for sale or distribution. These files may NOT be used to make molds for casting.
     Xykit makes no warranties in respect to the use, sale, or manufacturing of the design. Product files are sold “As Is”. In no event will Xykit be responsible for the direct, indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages that are in any way related to the design. Xykit is in no way obligated to update or provide ongoing support for the digital product. By purchasing this product, you agree to these terms of use. 
Fulfillment 
   We've team up with Backerkit for pledge management and distribution after the campaign. More info to come.

campaign.story:
Eons ago, the sky shattered and something ate the moon and stars. We were left with only our sun, our small cluster of planets, and a new, twisted moon. Something, birthed from the sky-eater, fell to our planet and began to twist and warp it.
It was the end of our world before anyone living now can remember.
Many generations later, the remnants of our people wander the twisted land and fight the bioluminescent night-crawling creatures as they search the ruins of our castles and cities for ancient magic and technology to help us survive. The brave and hopeful of us work to keep our pocket-sized towns together and alive.
Now, so many years after our stars were devoured, you head into the world with a gun at your side.
I hope you find what you’re looking for.
With your friend, a gun, at your side...
GUN&SLINGER is an RPG about a weapon and a wanderer. A Maestro and two players (Gun and Slinger) set out into a dead planet mutated by a god's forgotten child and hunt strange bounties, investigate the world, and unlock hidden powers. During play, they seek to learn the nature of what’s hunting the Slinger, figure out why the Gun is sentient, and discover how the world died.
Key Features:
Tell the story of a post-magic world and the people working together to survive.
Explore the nature of a twisted reality and a force that hunts the players.
Use Two different playstyles for the Gun and the Slinger with unique capabilities and mechanics.
Answer Questions & Prompts at the table to establish a bespoke setting to adventure in.
You can be a magical, sentient gun.
 Rewards: 
 $12 gets you the final full-color PDF.
 $20 gets you the completed full-color paperback & a digital copy of the PDF.
 $100 gets you all of the above AND an exciting, secret note in your book.
 All backers get their names put in a Special Thanks section in the book.
 All physical tiers get a sticker included in their order!
book mockup, final cover may vary. cover art by Sadia Bies
 GUN&SLINGER in podcasts! 
I’ve had the absolute pleasure of guesting on a few awesome podcasts to talk about and play GUN&SLINGER! If you’re lookin’ for a fix of G&S, or some extra info on the design, then check these out!
 Party of One with Jeff Stormer
 Game Closet with Taylor LaBresh
 Rollin’ Bones with Ryan Howard
Give ‘em a listen and share with your friends!
In GUN&SLINGER, the player-characters are bound together by fate, promises, and magic. One of them fills the role of the Slinger, the other embodies the Gun.
A Slinger that’s hunted by evil
The Slinger is a wanderer, looking for something in this twisted world. They’ve been touched by the Twist and can pull on it for power. They must be careful, though- if they pull on the Twist too much, they’ll lose themselves in it.
Being marked, they are hunted by something- a strange, horrifying creature of the Twist’s design. During setup and through play, you decide as a table what this creature is and bring it into scenes using the Maestro’s moves.
A Gun that’s more than a Gun
The Gun may live in a shell of cold steel, but they were not always this way. During setup and through play, you learn about the Gun’s past and how they became trapped in this new body of violence.
The Gun may not have arms or legs, but that doesn’t make them unable to affect the world around them. The Gun can use their connection with the remaining elements of Magic in the world to, well, do magic! The runes engraved on their body shape the form of their connection and, in turn, their spells. They can also reach into an ethereal plane of magic that resides alongside the physical realm to move and manipulate things.
A sample of the Gun’s character sheet
Each player in GUN&SLINGER interacts with the mechanics differently, all the way down to their stats. Take a look at the section of the Gun’s sheet above. The three starting stats are intentionally a little bit vague for a couple of reasons.
 G&S encourages players to be flexible with stat definitions. The way you approach a situation should dictate what stat it uses, and vise-versa. The Gun could attempt to intimidate people with any of these stats, it’s just up to you to decide how that looks!
 G&S also allows players to, as they progress, create their own stats. In one playtest, a player gave their Slinger the Stat “The Bigger I Am” and used it as an opposite to “Light On My Toes”. Any time they did something bull-headed or with a physical presence, they’d use this new Stat and force their way through.
The way the stats are named in G&S gives you quite a bit of insight into the character they portray all while setting a tone and giving flexibility. You’ve got a 2 in “I've Been Around”. What’s that mean to you? Do you know about the local flora? Can you navigate easily to places you've never been to? That’s up to you, Slinger.
In GUN&SLINGER, all conflict is resolved using a deck of playing cards. When a player wants to do something under pressure or with an uncertain outcome, The Maestro presents them with how difficult it'll be to do, and the players need to figure out how best to overcome the challenge.
In order to solve the problems they face on their quest to help fix their broken world, they’ll need to tap into the cards they have (through imaginative game-mechanical twists on Go Fish and Blackjack), their stats, and any other tools they happen to have at their disposal.
As you venture through the world, tackle problems, and fight monsters, you’ll get to change your stats and rework the game into something that’s truly your own. 
GUN&SLINGER comes with a unique post-post apocalypse setting replete with room to be shaped into something special as your group plays through it. Elements are defined to a certain extent, then ways for you to create specifics or changes are outlined and some examples are given.
It’s a world of hope and struggle, mutated by the forgotten child of an unknowable god that ate the stars, leaving behind only your sun, some neighboring planets, and a new moon of strange energy that never leaves the sky. There are aesthetic elements and keystones provided in the book, and some facts about the nature of things like The Twist and Magic are established, then everyone playing is given some prompts and free reign over making this setting something all their own.
One playtest took place in a desert land with demons, industry, and gold being key aesthetics. Another was in rolling planes with a never-ending storm, strange new flora, and magic soaking into the planet through the rain.
A sample of these setting elements: The Twist is a force that mutates the planet for unknown reasons.
The Maestro controls the world and works with the players to bring it life. They create challenges, intrigue, and consequences for the players based on their actions. They have the use of a very unique and powerful threat in the form of two Joker cards that can bring an intense sense of pressure and immediacy to any situation. Finally, they also interact with the Go Fish and Pairs mechanics differently and have a unique list of Moves they can make whenever they’re able to afford the cost.
There are systems currently in the works to allow GUN&SLINGER to be played without a Maestro.
Calling The Thing That Hunts using Joker cards
The Maestro’s Face Moves
Why Kickstarter?
I want GUN&SLINGER to be the best thing it can be. I’ve spent a lot of time working on the game, and I want to turn it into a physical thing with a level of quality and production that I feel it deserves. I’m here on Kickstarter with this project to raise the money to pay a fantastic team the money they deserve so we can make something kick-ass.
Our goals & challenges
Our goal with this Kickstarter is to raise $4,350 to give the product a final physical form, complete with graphic design and art. The final product will be a 40+-page full-color paperback, with professionally-done layout and visceral artwork.
Here is our estimated budget for creating GUN&SLINGER.
 $1,450 for writing, game design, sensitivity consulting, and editing.
 $1,800 for layout and art (lots of art!)
 $300 for printing from Mixam Press.
 $350 as a just-in-case cash reserve.
 $450 for Kickstarter’s fees and credit card processing.
This brings us to $4,350 needed to make this book a reality.
The Team
Nevyn Holmes is a game designer based out of central Texas. He's best known for his work on Skel-IT-ons and User Is Typing//Message Sent. When he's not designing games, Nevyn loves to read & play ‘em! He also owns & operates the indie game analysis & review website, Indie Bytes! He can often be found shitposting on twitter dot com.
Emma Harvey is a traditional artist and comic book writer. She is excited to help bring the world of GUN&SLINGER to life and inspire players to forge their own paths through its scarred and twisted landscape.
Jamila R. Nedjadi is a game creator and Reiki-Shaman. If they were a magical and sentient weapon, they would scream charming obscenities to keep your spirits up and attack people with tapioca pearls. Jammi will be working on the layout for GUN&SLINGER!
Max Moctizuma is Los Angeles born and raised. Brought up in a traditional Chiricahua Ndé home with a background in Outdoor Nature Education and Fire Ecology for Los Angeles County and State. They are deeply involved in the public Indigenous community both locally and online through education, consulting, and staffing and organizational roles for events such as Eaton Canyon's Spring Awakening.
Fiona Maeve Geist resides in WXXT country with her cat where she writes fiction and nonfiction appearing in varied venues. She is primarily known for being a relentless editor and occasional writer of pen and paper roleplaying games—including being a developer and writer for the ENnie Award-winning Mothership: Sci-Fi Horror RPG. She is terrible at listing everything she works on and feels like she will hurt someone’s feelings by leaving them out. In a previous life, she was an academic.
Sadia Bies is an illustrator and game designer, who has been working professionally in both fields for 7 years. They design for Ratworm Games, The Wayfinder Experience, and individually on their itch.io page. Their hobbies include raising insects, yelling about fiction, and dressing up as weird creatures.
Ezra Rose is an illustrator, zinester & multi-disciplinary creator living on a small farm in Western Massachusetts with queer chosen family. Their art explores monsters, magic, queer/trans identity and Jewish culture, celebrating the marginal and connecting to the symbols and stories of both past and present. Ezra's work has appeared in tabletop games, comics anthologies, and other small/indie press. [Twitter]
Korben Dennis is an Animator and Game Designer fresh out of college, and rarin' to go! They chase themes of transhumanism, empathy toward monsters, and ethical entertainment. [Instagram]
Stretch Goals
At $6,350, Viditya Voleti will be writing a new playset, SWORD&BEARER, that will include a new setting, setup section, two new characters, and art by Nadhir Nor!
Here's the pitch:
SWORD&BEARER is set within a massive city that shares aesthetics with idealistic European and South-Asian architecture. In this world, magic is relatively commonplace and used in daily life. There’s been an industrial revolution, and many things are powered by a mix of coal and magical energy harnessed from the world. Patrols and the army make use of firearms, and artful melee weapons have become a thing of decoration.
The Twist in this setting has taken its place among the ruling classes of the city, driving them to control and capitalize on its people by making them just comfortable enough to be complacent. It is a caste-based capitalistic society where the upper echelons have been infiltrated and manipulated by Magic’s hungry and self-driven sibling, the Twist.
Viditya Voleti (Twitter, Itch). Viditya is a QPoC game designer and writer who loves exploring the medium in several avenues! A true goblin of the community, he wears different hats from making games, consulting, Twitter worldbuilding, streaming live design nights, reading and reviewing games, and really anything he decides will be fun! All of this gets collected on his Patreon.
Nadhir Nor is an illustrator from Malaysia. From folkloric visuals for musicians to cheesy queer romance tucked between his art books, he's very interested in seeing how the modern society can navigate between what's mundane and magical.
At $7,250, Adira Slattery will be writing an alternate character for the GUN, the DEMON, to be included in the final book, with fresh art by Josef Rahaman and a sigil by Ezra Rose!
Here's the pitch:
THE DEMON is an optional playbook replacing either the GUN or the SWORD as a companion. Instead of existing as an object, the Demon lives within the arm of the SLINGER or the BEARER. It only remembers how to cause pain, and it doesn't want to let go. 
Adira Slattery is a trans Jewish game designer, poet, and podcast human. Her work spans comedy, horror, and intimacy. Adira has designed a number of amazing projects, and her work in very thoughtful spaces of game design will be sure to make THE DEMON a powerhouse of a character option.
Josef Rahaman is a concept artist from Arizona with a major passion for games & the creativity that births them. Throughout attaining a degree in Digital Culture, he jumped at every opportunity to expand his expertise knowledge of creative processes.  He aims to imbue that spirit of ingenuity into everything he does with the hope that it will inspire joy and creativity in others. His work and flexibility of styles is a perfect fit to bring THE DEMON to life!
Ezra Rose is an illustrator, zinester & multi-disciplinary creator living on a small farm in Western Massachusetts with queer chosen family. Their art explores monsters, magic, queer/trans identity and Jewish culture, celebrating the marginal and connecting to the symbols and stories of both past and present. Ezra's work has appeared in tabletop games, comics anthologies, and other small/indie press. | ezra-rose.com / @magpietongue |
I will be writing & publishing a full GUN&SLINGER SRD (system reference document) on my website & in PDF form on Itch! It'll include everything from the way the math works out in the system, why decisions were made, and guidance on important aspects of the system.
This will not only make it easier for those interested to make things for or with the GUN&SLINGER framework, but it'll make the reasoning behind some design decisions plain & clear, so future designs will be built from a better understanding!
At $22,000 raised, Pam Punzalan will be writing MECH&PILOT with art by Gio Manning!
 Here's the pitch:
Play as a PILOT who has found that their survival now depends on the miraculous technology of a Mech. Play as a MECH excavated from the remnants of a strange past civilization, who reached for the PILOT in its desperation and now finds itself uncovering its memories through experiencing the world with the Pilot. 
Explore a fantasy-like world with fragments of highly advanced magitech societies born from space ships scattering its surface. Some large factions powered by these fragments exist and struggle to keep the rest of the world ignorant of the legacies they are meant to inherit. Mobile Aberrant Geoanimus, corrupted mecha obsessed with non-corrupted mecha and their pilots, wander the lands, corrupting everything they touch.
Pam Punzalan is a queer woman from the Philippines. Her works explore queerness, emotion, memories, violence, reclamation, rebellion, and identity. She's published her own work (Sundo, Asian Acceptance, a lot of micro RPGs), collaborated with others (Maharlika, several Zinequest 2020 entries) and is on a number of major projects (Sina Una, Ancestry & Culture, Five Torches Deep, Spire, Rookwood).
Misael "Gio" Manning is a Filipino Canadian concept artist and illustrator. He's obsessed with all things mechanical, military history, and exploring the Filipino and Filipino diasporic culture through art. Gio will be creating rad illustrations for the Mech and Pilot. Gio's currently working with other Filipino writers and artists to create a sci-fi RPG based on Filipino fantasy called "Maharlika RPG"
And if we get beyond this, we’ll be raising pay for everyone involved!

campaign.story:
This is a collaborative, storytelling RPG about a Chinese family making their living by running a restaurant in one of America’s Chinatowns, circa 1920. Despite societal backlash and anti-Chinese laws, they have turned a profit and their quality of life has recently improved.
Night, however, brings a new terror.
Players take on the roles of members of the Chinese family (mostly from Guangdong province), spanning three generations, who face threats of jiangshi (hopping vampires) at night and racism by day. It has players balancing the responsibility of maintaining their family business with protecting themselves and their community from the dreaded Jiangshi. This is primarily a game about storytelling. Combat is limited, but horror, drama and sometimes comedy are the primary vehicles for driving the game forward.
Jiangshi: Blood in the Banquet Hall is a tabletop roleplaying game which combines elements of RPGs with those of traditional board games. The game can be played as a "mini-series" or a one-shot.
Each game takes place over a number of days (usually five), alternating between day and night scenes where the roleplaying scenes take place.  Day and night have different threats - in the daytime, the restaurant may experience racism or gang violence, while in the night time, Jiangshi are seeking warm bodies. During the day characters complete assigned restaurant tasks in order to keep the family business running. 
Every morning, the Game Moderator deals out a tableau of Restaurant cards that the family will need to complete before diners start to arrive. Each Restaurant card needs from 1 hour to 3 hours to complete. Usually, the oldest member of the family takes charge and starts delegating the tasks to specific players. Each player uses their Resilience slots to complete tasks, indicated by the time and energy they have available to do it.
Once the tasks have been completed to the best of the family’s abilities, the GM takes any Restaurant cards that were left undone and places them on the central Restaurant board, rotating them such that the consequences face the players and cover the restaurant’s slots.
Restaurant Board
Prior to starting the morning scenes, the first thing each character must do is see how they’re feeling from the trials and tribulations of the previous day. Each player rolls 1D4 and receives that many Mung cards from the GM which represent the dreams and nightmares of the characters. 
Some of the Mung cards are in color which represent good dreams. Other Mung are in black and white, which represents bad dreams. When a player receives a bad Mung card, they place it in one of the card slots on their Character sheet, covering a trait (Item, Skill, Facet, etc.), in numerical order. While covered, a trait cannot be used. To rid themselves of a bad Mung, a character needs to talk about the bad Mung card with another player character during the afternoon or evening scenes. Once they’ve talked about it, they can discard the card.
Artwork by Sadia Bies
After receiving their Mung cards, players take turns explaining their dreams to each other and the GM. 
Describe the dream or nightmare based on the image on the cards
What are these visions like and what do they mean, if anything?
On subsequent mornings, any remaining Mung cards from previous rounds are kept as recurring nightmares that continue to plague the player character. They will roll the 1D4 as usual for more Mung cards, but instead of adding that number of cards to their character sheet, the result indicates the maximum number of Mung cards that the player character has to deal with this day.
Character Sheet
The Character Sheet has several details about the player character that a player can fill out. During the game, Resilience slots may get covered up by Mung cards or Jiangshi cards. A character takes a Jiangshi card when they take stress or physical damage. When a Resilience slot gets covered by a Jiangshi card or a Mung card, that detail about the PC gets removed from play until they are healed. If a PC gets a Jiangshi card on a slot that already has a Mung card, they will remove the Mung card and replace it with the new Jiangshi card.
Once they have all 8 slots filled with Jiangshi cards, the player will then become a Jiangshi and they would flip over all the Jiangshi cards to reveal their new Skills. Though this fate can be terrifying, these cards can be healed and removed through game play. 
Artwork by Steven Wu
Players can create Spirit Papers by taking a slip of paper and writing a short phrase or sentence on it that captures how the family of characters stays strong and together. Spirit Papers can only be used once during the night time phases.
The GM must count to ten in secret while the family is thinking of their word or sentence. If the time expires and the family has not yet agreed upon what to write on the Spirit Paper, the Spirit Paper will not work.
If the Spirit Paper works (i.e. a meaningful phrase or sentence was written with the 10-second time limit), the Jiangshi has been immobilized and players can move onto healing their family member or evading the Jiangshi they’re faced with.
The whole group of non-GM players starts with a Family pool of six eight-sided dice (6D8) on the first day. As they progress through the days, player characters start feeling the stress the hauntings levy on the family, reducing their pool of dice available. These dice are used to overcome challenges, or to help council and care for the emotional health of the family, removing Mung cards from their character sheets.
When a player is determining the outcome of a challenge they are engaged with, they roll all the dice in the Family pool at once and take the highest single value from one of the dice that they rolled as their outcome. Once per scene, a character can use one of their skills to reroll the dice pool to try to achieve a better result. 
To determine the highest single value from a roll, complete the following steps:
 Clean house! Check for 4’s in the pool: For every die that is showing a 4 in the pool, cancel out a die from the pool that is showing the highest value in the pool along with the die showing the 4, placing them back on the Day/Night Tracker.
   Check for highest valued D8 in pool: The higher the die roll, the better the outcome.
Ming is rolling the Family pool to cook a feast for visiting dignitaries on Day 1. Ming’s first roll results in the following: 1 2 2 3 4 4 - their highest result is a 2 as the two 4s cancel out the 3 and one of the 2s, respectively! Wanting to impress their guests, Ming uses their Cooking Skill and rerolls the Family pool, ending up with the following result: 1 3 3 4 7 8. Their highest result is 7 because the 8 is cancelled out by the 4. Wiping their brow, Ming's character breathes a sigh of relief and serves a gorgeous noodle dish to the members of the San Francisco city council.
Artwork by Steven Wu

This game rewards player characters for failing, because it makes for a more interesting story! When a failure happens, the player who rolled receives an Individual die. The GM will also give player characters a die towards their Individual Pool when something occurs that makes their character happy or hopeful towards their Hopes and Dreams (labeled on their character sheet).
While the main use of Individual dice is to assist other players, a player character may add any number of their Individual dice to their own Challenge rolls. If they do this, ALL of the dice they use in this way are returned to the GM once the Challenge roll is resolved.
Playing a Chinese Character
This game isn’t just for Asian-Americans - this game can be played by anyone! Just remember that the topics deal with some very real history and politics (Jiangshi aside).

Here are some tips on how to play:
Avoid using accents
Avoid exoticizing the culture - mysticism sometimes paints a culture in a very flat and two-dimensional way, so try to stay away from fortune cookies
Treating the characters with respect is very important, so try to stay away from stereotypes. Not every Asian knows kung-fu, for example. In fact, Martial Arts is a Skill that only some player characters might have chosen for their character sheet.
Do a little bit of research before playing. You don’t have to have a degree in Asian studies, but just know what you’re getting into. We provide some setting information that makes for a great start!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Q: Can Wet Ink Games handle this project?
A: This is our sixth Kickstarter, after five previous successful projects. With each one we have learned more about the industry and best practices. We are entering this project with the project almost completely designed, and developed, with only our final quantities left to nail down before sending to production. With the things we learned from previous projects, we are confident we can handle this project. Game and a Curry brings a wealth of knowledge to this partnership as well, and we know we'll be able to make this project as good as it can possibly be.

Q: How much of the books are already finished?
A: The game is pretty much complete and ready to send to production. The text potentially added by stretch goals is not written yet, but the writers will be able to complete their portions quickly. Many of these adventure stretch goals are to be digital goals, potentially collected into another volume later, and will have no impact on the delivery of the main product.

Q: Have you produced all these items before?
A: Between Wet Ink Games, Game and a Curry, and our production partners, all of these components have been made before and are well within our capabilities to produce using industry best practices.

Q: What if shipping costs increase?
A: Shipping costs are well beyond our control. We’ve made our best projections and those shipping fees will be collected through Backer Kit. Once that money is in hand, we’ll send the items, even it we end up eating a cost increase. Though we can make no promises about international shipping, we will always try our best to do right by our backers.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Jiangshi Blank Proof/Digital Color Proof Unboxing
updates.update_content: Hey all! We have some really cool proofs to show off. Watch the video and check it out!

Quick update for you all today. We received the proofs from the printers, looked them over, and approved them. That means everything is ready to move on to the next stage of production. Here's a couple images of what the proofs look like.

The attacks and murders in Atlanta, GA are simultaneously disgusting, reprehensible, terrifying, and saddening. 
Though they've continuously been present in western history, the attitudes and beliefs that only serve to bolster and reinforce these destructive actions against the Asian communities have been on the rise in recent years, especially during this pandemic. We at Wet Ink Games, and those on our design team for Jiangshi want to unreservedly renounce those actions, and hope that with understanding and education these views will become a thing of the past. We can't move into the future without engaging our history and the struggles that community deals with daily.

Moving forward
Hey everyone! We've been spending the last few weeks going back ad forth with our factory and making slight adjustments to the physical component assets. We got work that we should have the eProofs today or tomorrow, and we're REALLY excited. We're obviously going to want to share some of that process with you in a more in depth update, but we also know that we're going to be even more excited when physical proofing starts.

We just wanted to drop you a quick line to share the excitement we're feeling over here. ALL MATERIALS FOR SUBMISSION TO THE FACTORY ARE COMPLETE!!!
This is great news since it means we can start the physical proofing of the game components and move to full scale printing.
What should you expect next?

Hey everyone! We wanted to just take a moment to let you all know that the the scenario book has been added to DriveThruRPG and added to the Jiangshi Bundle. You all should have already received your download links for the original material, and also should have received a notification about a couple of updates to the core book. We added some content, but we're done tweaking it. HERE is the link to the scenario book! Our next steps will be to get all the material to the printer. In the meantime please have a safe and fun New Year celebration.

campaign.story:
Hello, we make the nerdy-fantasy sex-comedy webcomic Oglaf.
It features swords, sorcery, monsters, masonry, and cartoon dicks.
Kickstarter aren’t comfortable with the cartoon dicks, though,
so for this campaign we’re replacing them with pictures of ducks.
There are few if any duck pics in the books.
DO NOT GO INTO THIS EXPECTING DUCKS IN THE FINAL BOOKS.
We’ll be collecting strips into an attractive softcover book that will add class and refinement to your bookshelf.
We assume. 
Use your own judgement, don’t be buying it if you think it’ll ruin your bookshelf.
208 pages plus covers, re-printing strips from oglaf.com
 But we’re not just offering books. No way.
We’re also making religious tracts. 
You know those little comic booklets zealots used to leave in public toilets?
No? Do a search on "Jack Chick tracts”  They’re horrible and amazing.
Anyhow, imagine a fictional parody religion got hold of a printing press and a stapler,
made short, creepy comics about a god who hates everything.
That’s what these are.  Religious propaganda from a church that isn’t that into its faith.
Little 16-page black and white comic booklets.
Because who doesn’t like stickers?
People who have to clean them off statues, perhaps. 
People who thought they were getting a tattoo. 
Apart from those idiots, though,  everyone loves stickers.
We’re making a sheet of some nice die-cut ones. 
 Trudy has drawn five pictures specially for this Kickstarter.
If you buy into the original art slot, you’ll get an original drawing chosen at random, in glorious black and white.
 You’ll also get prints of all of them, in actually-much-better colour.
Or you could get just the prints, if owning original art seems creepy to you.
Oh, and the finished versions won’t look like they were coloured by a drunken toddler.  Those are just temporary versions we’re  displaying ‘til the toddler sobers up.  
 so here’s the tiers in handy tiny-picture form-

 Want to mix-and-match? Add another book / PDF / whatever? We'll be doing a backerkit when the campaign ends, so you'll be able to add on extras.
 those stretch goals are included with all the physical-object tiers

Shipping is included inside the USA, rest of the world will have to pay $10 extra for one book, $15 for three.
Sorry, about that, rest of the world- we feel you- we're making this comic from Australia.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re publishing already-existing comics with the help of Make That Thing, a company who do this kind of thing every single day. 
Make That Thing is a division of TopatoCo, and they've done print-runs of two books for us in the past and they worked out real nice.
Relax, Poe, is what we’re saying. We’ve got this.

Oh, also, we're totally behind Kickstarter's workers right to unionise. We're happy they were able to do that this year.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Fellow Oglaf-heads!
This will be the last update here for a while. We've shipped every package for which we have addresses and they're either en route, delivered, or in an abandoned truck out in a field somewhere. In the case of the abandoned truck thing, just let us know, and we'll make sure you're taken care of. If your package/tracking is still stuck, please give them a little bit longer. USPS is still clearing things up, and things that were shipped in early December are still arriving currently.

updates.update_userinfo: Oglaf 3 Shipping and Tracking Problems, December 18
updates.update_content:
Hello from Make That Thing!
If you are in the United States and have submitted your address to us, your package has almost definitely been gathered by USPS. Unfortunately, what happens after that is out of our hands, and USPS is having Problems. Most of you have received tracking emails, and very few of those have been updating. If you haven't received a tracking email yet, it's because our system sends those out when a package hits the mailstream – which (as far as computers are concerned) only occurs if the package is scanned by someone at USPS. In many cases that is not happening now – they're just being loaded onto trucks in bulk.

Greetings Again from Make That Thing!
Just an update where we are with Oglaf 3 shipping. Currently about 99% of US packages are en route, and International packages are packed and ready to be picked up.
For US orders, we have had several of reports of tracking not updating. At this time there is no reason to believe those packages are just sitting in a warehouse somewhere -- they are almost assuredly moving through the system, but slowly. The most likely scenario is that a tired, local USPS employee didn’t scan the individual package and just put it into a truck.  Media Mail is slow anyway and USPS is reporting unprecedented volume and limited employees due to the impacts of COVID-19 – they've even got a little warning bar that we've never seen before, and we've been doing this for like 15 years. In the event packages do get lost, we will arrange for reships.

Greeting From the Cardboard Kingdom at Make That Thing!
Just a quick update because many of you are waiting with your breath all bated. We get it!
We're deep in the throes of shipping and currently about 1/3 of US orders are on their way. We had a little bit of a slowdown over the last couple weeks due to a COVID exposure, and we had to keep our helper elves away until tests came back negative, which just happened this morning (December 6). We hope to have all the US orders shipped by Wednesday or Thursday (December 9-10).

Hey hello! Make That Thing here with an update on the shipping side! Everything is almost here and we should be able to begin shipping mid-to-late next week!
Surveys to collect shipping addresses were sent out a few days ago for physical rewards shipping. If you haven't received yours, please check your junk or promotions mail. You have until the end of day Sunday, November 22 to return your survey to us, at which time we'll lock it down and start importing data into our system. If you don't do your survey before then you will become what is known as a "straggler" and you will need to send your address info to us at .

If you have backed a tier that includes all three books and pdfs, that update doesn't apply to you and you don't have to do anything. PDFs for Kickstarters will be sent when books start shipping later this month.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Role playing games are powerful empathy generators – creating spaces for genuine intimate friendship, adventure, inspiration, and collaboration. Whether you’re an avid tabletop RPG player, creator, streamer, or curious newcomer – we want to share in your passion and help it grow.
We believe in the power of authentic narrative play. With Role, we're bringing that power to a new generation of online creators & communities. With all the world’s advances in technology & entertainment, there is still nothing quite like a great RPG. So we set out to build the ultimate collection of high-quality social, marketplace, and online play tools for veteran players and newcomers alike.
Check out our live gameplay demos!
PLAY

Character Sheets, Dice, Assets, & Video!
PLAY

Tokens & Whiteboarding!
Today’s role playing community is larger and more vibrant than ever. Diverse voices from around the globe are creating new games every day. We want to be the place where everyone can play, meet new people, and get their games into more players’ hands. In simplest terms, we really just want to answer one question for every person in our community: What’s missing from your table today?
We try to answer that question in 3 major ways: intuitive & seamless online video play, a creator-driven marketplace, and robust player matching services.
Our online play interface is called "The Table", and is meant to recreate that intimate feeling of playing face-to-face with a tight group of players. 
Crisp high quality video chat puts the best part of the game front-and-center: the people. Show critical information through screen sharing. Upload visual aids to enhance your game via your Asset Tray. Text chat as a group or privately, allowing you to communicate however is most effective for your game.
Roll any combination of dice by selecting them quickly from your Dice Tray. Add stat modifiers from your character sheet, track critical successes & failures, and add up your totals automatically. Draw cards from any deck of your choosing, including standard 52 card decks, tarot, and custom decks from your favorite games. Show your results live to the entire Table, or set them to Private for discreet gameplay.
Fully modular character sheet tools ensure you have what you need to play any game, even homebrew content or custom systems. We've designed our character sheet system from a standardized set of form fields, stat trackers, pools, tokens, note sections, and more - everything you need to play any RPG system. Character sheets are automatically indexed, with a Table of Contents generated for easy navigation. Everything is drag-and-drop - no code required! 
Match with players who share your interests, based on information listed in your Profile. Use advanced filters to find exactly who you need based on desired complexity level, specific game experience, and location. You can even use Role to find experienced Game Masters to run your Table! 
Role is a people-first role playing community, and that means you’ll always have tools to meet new players that align with your interests. Browse until you find someone you want to match with. If they match back, you’ll be able to chat and set up your next game together!
Real names & location data are always optional – you only have to share what you’re comfortable sharing.
We’re designing a premium marketplace that puts creators first, making it easier for players to discover, learn, and purchase new games from diverse voices in the role playing community. Basic game info such as complexity, player count, and time commitment is always easy to find & search by. Creators can upload a free teaser of their game to help players quickly understand the basics, sample the world, and get excited to play more.
Say goodbye to review bombs & trolling. Instead of a traditional review score system, Role uses a recommendation engine. Players recommend what they love, not trash what they hate.
Players never have to worry about buying new games without people to enjoy them with. Every game is directly linked to our Player Matching tools, ensuring that every new player can find people and play together.
Backers of this campaign will be the first to join the Role private Early Access program, where they can play with each other and help shape our tools before we launch to the rest of the world! In addition, we're offering a slate of rewards that include premium features, game supplements, and exclusive items only available via this campaign.
All of our backers will be able to play in our Early Access program, and will receive a shout-out on our "Thank You" page! Additional rewards are available as follows:
We're FUNDED! Every dollar raised from here goes towards unlocking our STRETCH GOALS:
Our first Stretch Goal has been unlocked! 
Role will launch as a free platform for everyone, with an open marketplace & play tools to support any game. For those that want to take their adventures further, we're offering a subscription tier called Role Master Edition. This subscription includes everything from the basic tier, plus extras that ensure players, creators, and game masters alike have all the tools they need to run the very best game sessions.
Beyond our default look & feel, the Table interface will support a growing library of custom skins inspired by various popular fiction genres. Maximize your group's immersion in the story by wrapping your experience in a skin that's right for you. 
Backers of this campaign will receive 3 Kickstarter-exclusive skins that will never be available again: our first Fantasy skin, a retro Arcade skin, and our Cyberpunk skin. 
Of course, the heart of the Role platform is great games. Backers of this campaign will be able to receive one or more of our 6 Creators Program supplements as they release over the course of our first year.
PLAY

We believe in supporting the RPG creator community on Day 1, and that's why we've launched the Role Creators Program - a funding initiative to help independent designers and publishers get more of their work out into the world. As part of this Kickstarter campaign, we're funding a fresh batch of RPG game supplements from 6 different creators. These digital supplements will be exclusive to the Role platform, and available first to backers of this campaign!
First, we're extremely excited to reveal Lancer: Battlegroup, the official expansion from Massif Press!
Lancer: Battlegroup is a new, standalone rules system for the Lancer setting, designed for use at your tabletop and in digital, grid-free play. Blending Lancer’s deep unit customization and imbued story with tactical-narrative action, Battlegroup casts the players as pilots and officers in a battlegroup deployed to the front line; as the first tremors of interstellar war test Union’s integrity, you and your party members will face the enemy with new weapons and old tactics, thrown into combat with only one goal: survive, and return home.
As big OSR fans, we're very pleased to bring everyone Isle of Ixx from Swedish designer, Skullfungus!
The Isle of Ixx is both a light OSR-style ruleset and a sandbox adventure in one. The rules are based on "Into the Odd" by Chris McDowall, and have been chosen for their simplicity and ease of use, so that the focus can lie on adventuring and discovering the island. The system itself is also easy to adapt to any style of OSR-ruleset you might have in mind, should you prefer that instead!
The setting text will be written in an open-ended way, often asking the players questions about their characters and surroundings. This way, they'll be a big part of the setting and will get to influence much of what goes on in the story!
There will be roughly 16 key locations on the map for players to explore, ranging from cities, villages, lairs, and dungeons. There will also be tools for the game master to create their own content, in the form of generators and sample maps they can use for their own dungeon adventures!
 We're also proud to be partnering with Swordsfall to launch The Fifth Ebon Expedition, the newest expansion to this massive Afropunk universe!
The Fifth Ebon Expedition is a 4+ player campaign set in a unique Mission style. Your group will be part of the larger expedition, fighting to establish forward camps, and with it a railway for a future supply line. If your expedition is successful, then the question is... can you defend it?
From popular Filipino creator, Sword Queen Games, we're bringing Voidwalkers - a tarot-powered game that combines mysticism with deep space exploration for an experience unlike any other!
Voidwalkers will be a complete stand-alone science fiction TTRPG where mysticism and space-magic guide creative and intuitive stories. In this Powered by the Apocalypse game, characters must learn how to harness and balance the wild space-magic, the VOID, within themselves, while navigating and staying clear of its wild manifestations in the physical world. You must rely on creativity, luck, and relationships in order to succeed and thrive out in the Void. Players will use a tarot deck as a way to generate intuitive stories and resolve challenges. A unique tarot deck will be created for this game, but any tarot deck may be used!
Indie designer Steven Medeiros, in collaboration with the Role team, is developing Astra - a unique blend of classic OSR and cooperative action where players pool their dice rolls and act together as a group.
Astra is a rules light 3-6 player OSR-style tabletop role playing game with a focus on cooperative group dice pool mechanics that allow players to work together and overcome obstacles. It explores heavy themes of interpersonal connections, self exploration, and building community. Suitable for one-shot or campaign-style play, it features quick & easy character creation and narrative driven gameplay.
Last - but certainly not least - we're working with Magpie Games to bring players a brand-new supplement for Masks! Cataclysm at the Metajunction will bring new levels of superhero action to this popular superhero RPG.
Cataclysm at the Metajunction is a playset for Masks: A New Generation, a Powered by the Apocalypse game of teen superheroics. This playset will give you everything you need to play through superheroic tales in the endangered Metajunction, along with two new costumes, or playbook variants, for you to use with existing Masks characters. Ever wanted to play a version of your character from another reality? Cataclysm at the Metajunction provides the support for doing just that!
This playset includes: a 32 page full-color, illustrated playset, including custom moves and villains. And 2 new playbook supplements (costumes) that expand existing Masks playbooks.
All 6 of these awesome supplements will release exclusively on Role, as part of Year 1 of our platform launch!
 From all of us here at Role, thank you so much for joining us on this adventure. We can't wait to share in the worlds, characters, and stories you create. The world is a better place when we imagine together.
This is your game table. This is Role. 
Welcome home! <3
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating a new software platform is always a daunting task. Even with our years of experience, there are always unanticipated hiccups along the way. Our development team is dedicated to launching and supporting Role for many years to come, and we're extremely grateful to our community for supporting us along the way.

updates.update_content:
Hello Role Players!
We know April was a quiet month, but rest assured we've been hard at work preparing to bring big things to all of you! We're gearing up for a busy summer, and will have lots to announce very soon.

Guest Account Boost

Hello friends,
Our most recent major update to Role saw the debut of one our most important and anticipated features: safety tools.
From the outset, we knew that safety tools would be a vitally important part of Role, and as our user base has continued to grow, the need to implement these tools became more urgent. Our hope is that as our users are creating, playing, and imagining on Role, they will be able to do so within a safe and supportive environment.
We developed our safety tools in partnership with Kienna Shaw and Lauren Bryant-Monk, the creators of the Their experience and perspectives have been invaluable throughout this process. With their help, we created 3 official safety templates that are automatically placed in everyone’s account:

Hello Role Players!
We want to once again thank our entire community for your continued support, enthusiasm, and feedback as we keep building Role. We've come a long way since Early Access started last fall, and that's all thanks to you! With every play session, every comment, every story we hear from you - we refine Role into what you need it to be.

updates.update_userinfo: Year 1: A Note From Our Team <3
updates.update_content:
Hello Role Players,
Wow. What a year this has been. As we reflect back on everything we've accomplished together, we want to extend our deepest heartfelt "Thank You!" to every player, game creator, and storyteller who has made the Role community a success so far. We're here, playing together & telling stories online, all because of you. We know we say this a lot, but:

Hey Everyone! Yesterday our first small batch of Early Access invites went out. As expected, we found a few bugs and issues that need our attention right away. More invites are coming, but first we want to focus on squashing these bugs!

campaign.story:
This is the first of its kind and nothing like you’ve ever seen before. Under the popular MPC Impressions playing cards series, which has seen huge success on our previous decks, we bring to you yet another astounding and ground-breaking deck of playing cards which we are calling it the AQUA deck.
AQUA playing cards by MPC
TECHNOLOGY
 The AQUA playing cards really is the closest thing to an invisible deck of cards which you can still physically hold. It is the latest addition to our popular Impressions playing card series by MakePlayingCards.com (MPC), a branded playing cards and card games manufacturer with over 35 years history.
Clear print
The AQUA deck is made using a very smart arrangement of state of the art printing and production machinery which together, can produce amazing results. We use premium transparent plastic card stock which we then apply high-gloss transparent print with pinpoint accuracy, to certain areas of the playing cards to produce a sleek raised gloss embossed effect. The cards are then completed with a finishing that enables the cards to glide seamlessly for fans and springs and perform as you’d expect a high quality deck of playing cards to perform. Cutting the cards is no problem either as we use our MPC state of the art cutter to ensure the edges are angled for cutting into. The thickness of the deck is pretty much like a standard deck of cards.
Ace of spades
The finishing used on this deck is unique. Most plastic playing cannot perform like a normal deck of cards in that they stick together in clumps. Not the Aqua deck as it was designed for performing with so you can make beautiful fans easily.

 THE TUCK BOX
Aqua tuck box
We designed the deck of cards to be completely transparent so what’s better than a matching transparent plastic tuck box? We tried several different types of tuck boxes as we wanted the packaging to complement these beautiful and very unique playing cards. We decided on using a frosted transparent plastic box material and applied different densities of high gloss printing to it. The result was stunning. There is no other word for it.
The invisible deck
transparent tuck box

 WHAT CAN YOU DO WITH AQUA
The Aqua deck is a very versatile deck of cards which was conceptualized a few years back. Aesthetically, it is absolutely stunning and mesmerizing so it’s first off a collectors deck and it’s going to amaze anyone who sets their eyes on them. It can definitely be played with. Play any card games with the Aqua deck like you would do with any other deck of playing cards albeit with a fun see-through twist to it. 
AQUA deck fan
EASY FANNING
Easy fanning
The Aqua deck was designed and specially developed to be used for shuffling, springing, faroing, fanning, cutting etc so they can be used seamlessly for performing with such as magic tricks in close up card magic. Transparent cards are used quite often now to bring a new dimension into card magic. Now with the Aqua deck, you can design more card tricks to wow your friends, family or audience.
Card spread
BEND IT
Yes, the Aqua deck is made from premium quality transparent plastic card material with flexible high gloss printing so it can be bent without any issues whatsoever.
Easy flex
 COMPLETELY WATERPROOF
Yes, since this deck of cards is made from plastic, even the box, you can dump the complete deck into a tank of water, drop it in the toilet, throw a drink at it, throw the entire deck into a swimming pool or a pond, and it will still be fine.
Waterproof plastic playing cards

campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
As the cards are made from plastic, they are much longer lasting than an ordinary deck of paper made playing cards. They can last a lifetime.
Reusability and recyclability
These cards are made from plastic material so they can be recycled.
Sustainable materials
Soy-based printing and water-based finishing.
Environmentally friendly factories
We are using our own factory which is very environmentally friendly and holds many accreditation which can be found here https://www.makeplayingcards.com/certified-quality.aspx. We use FSC materials as well as water-based finishing on printed materials to protect artwork. Our ink are also soy-based.
Sustainable Distribution
We have created 11 successful projects already on Kickstarter using our own efficient and very fast logistics network which serves worldwide. Due to the amount of shipments we do per year, we have continuously refined the process so that any single point of failure will not affect our network and commitment to our customers and backers.

Dear Backers

Thank you for supporting us
First and foremost, thank you all so much for supporting us. The vast majority of you now have received your AQUA decks which has really become a very popular deck on the market and high on demand. Unfortunately, due to the current pandemic, it has somewhat seriously disrupted shipping items to countries in around Asia which means if you haven't got the items that you have pledge for yet, they are definitely still on its way to you. We just don't know where exactly nor when they will actually reach you. I know that's not great news but please be rest assured that we are doing all that we can do try get those remaining pledges out there to you, our backers.

Dear Backers
As scheduled
We're happy to let everyone know that as scheduled, we have started shipping out the AQUA deck in batches to backers. It will take a couple of weeks to shift them all out which we hope to have done by the end of next week. Some backers will get them very quickly and some not so quickly but please do bare with us as this pandemic really has changed shipping across the world as we knew it before. We can guarantee that they will eventually get to you.
