campaign.story:
Thousands of years ago, the ashes of nuclear fire changed the world. The weapons of mass destruction ceased to work as the laws of physics altered. In their wake came elementals and demons, creatures from the darkest dreams and nightmares of mankind. Magic returned to the world. Humankind arose from the ashes and rebuilt society, just as the vile Empire of the East wielded the demonic powers of Orcus to sweep across the globe. Now it falls to a small group of resistance fighters to reclaim freedom for humanity!
The Empire of the East Sourcebook for DCC RPG
Welcome to the Empire of the East role-playing game sourcebook, designed for the Dungeon Crawl Classics rules set, and also compatible with Mutant Crawl Classics. Herein you’ll find information regarding Fred Saberhagen’s seminal trilogy of novels, which set the stage for his rich fantasy world and were among Gary Gygax's stated Appendix N inspirations for Dungeons & Dragons.
Officially licensed by the estate of Fred Saberhagen, this hardcover sourcebook offers everything you need to play DCC RPG campaigns in the world of the Empire of the East. Lead designer Jason Vey has adapted the world in a simple, clean style that is easy to integrate into your DCC game, and Harley Stroh provides one of the introductory adventures included inside. Presented with stunning cover art by Ian Miller, you will find inside:
Rules for magic tailored to the post-apocalyptic fantasy setting of the Changeling Earth, including new spells and summonings to enrich any DCC campaign
Character options for adventuring in this world
A discussion of demons, elementals, and monsters, including stats for creatures compatible with any DCC and MCC campaign
Lost technology of the Golden Age of Man, and its effect on the Changeling Earth
Statistics for all of the major characters from the trilogy, also usable as NPCs in any DCC or MCC campaign
Two short low-level adventures to start your campaign
And more!
Using this sourcebook requires the DCC RPG core rulebook. While this sourcebook contains all you need to play a campaign, Saberhagen’s novels are an invaluable resource in understanding the setting.  We highly recommend you also read the Saberhagen Empire of the East series, available as a modern compilation or in the original three individual volumes, titled The Broken Lands, The Black Mountains, and Ardneh’s World (or Changeling Earth). 
Take up your sword, gather your spells, and stand with Ardneh’s armies against John Ominor and his forces of darkness!
Physical format. This book is offered in PDF form, as well as hardcover print format. Final page count is estimated at 80-90 pages.
Do I need to own the DCC rules? Yes. This is a sourcebook for DCC RPG. You can buy the DCC RPG core rulebook at the Goodman Games online store.
Do I need to read Fred Saberhgagen's Empire of the East novels? You don't have to, but we strongly recommend it. They are great books and will expand your gaming experience considerably!
Inside the DCC Sourcebook
DCC: The Empire of the East has been in development for years. Adapted by lead designer Jason Vey, the sourcebook takes you to the Empire of the East and gives you just enough information to create your own adventures there - while also leaving you room to design your own campaigns.
As with all DCC products from Goodman Games, the book is lavishly illustrated.
Chapter one covers adapting the existing character classes. 
Chapter two covers magic, including new rules for spell enervation which can be substituted for corruption to capture the aesthetic of Empire of the East. Eighteen new spells are presented, including several related to the summoning or control of demons, djinnis and elementals as discussed in Fred Saberhagen's novels. There are two new patron AIs presented, capturing the role of Ardneh and Orcus from the original novels.
Some readers may be asking, why is Empire of the East presented as compatible with DCC instead of Mutant Crawl Classics? This hardcover can be used easily in either system, but due to the high presence of magic we're presenting it as a DCC "base." 
Chapter three presents monsters. There are seven creatures, as well as new rules for demons, djinns and elementals.
Chapter four presents personalities of the Changeling Earth. These 16 NPCs from the stories can be used as allies or enemies in your campaign.
Chapter five is science, technology and magic. Those of you who have read the novels know that "the Elephant" plays a mighty part in the plot. We do not burden you with detailed stats for the super-science of the Changeling Earth but instead give general guidelines for inserting these items into your game.
Chapter seven presents two new adventures set in the Changeling Earth: Invaders, a level 0-1 adventure by Jason Vey, and The Demon Key, a level 0-1 adventure by Harley Stroh. 
The Empire of the East Novels
In the distant future, society has crumbled. Dark forces now rule the land, keeping all humans under their oppressive thumbs.
In the darkness of the shadows and whispered on the winds, there is talk of a rebellion. In the swamps, a small band has formed. Determined to regain their freedom, the rebellion, heavily outnumbered, plans to overthrow an army of thousands . . . with the help of one incredible weapon.
It is only a legend, a story left over from the Old World before magic and the wizards came to the land. A weapon of technology. It is the mystical Elephant, and whoever masters it holds the key to freedom, or defeat.
One young man, determined to avenge the death of his family, sets out to join the rebellion and find Elephant. What he discovers will change everything.
The Empire of the East novels are still in print decades after their original publication. You can find vintage editions online. The author's estate has recently released updated e-book editions, which are available in Kindle format on Amazon. You can find them here:
Empire of the East Book I: The Broken Lands
Empire of the East Book II: The Black Mountains
Empire of the East Book III: Ardneh's World 
What is DCC RPG?
The Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game is a modern RPG that reflects D&D’s origin-point concepts with decades-later rules editions. From the company that was publishing old-school modules before the OSR ever existed, DCC RPG is not an old-school clone, but a re-imagining of what D&D could have been, utilizing the game’s primary sources of inspiration. To quote from the back cover:
You’re no hero.
You're an adventurer: a reaver, a cutpurse, a heathen-slayer, a tight-lipped warlock guarding long-dead secrets. You seek gold and glory, winning it with sword and spell, caked in the blood and filth of the weak, the dark, the demons, and the vanquished. There are treasures to be won deep underneath, and you shall have them.
Return to the glory days of fantasy with the Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure as 1974 intended you to, with modern rules grounded in the origins of sword & sorcery. Fast play, cryptic secrets, and a mysterious past await you: turn the page…
You can learn more from this prior Kickstarter for the game's 4th printing. You can buy the 7th printing here.
 What is MCC RPG?
Triumph & Technology Won by Mutants & Magic!
You’re no zero.
You’re a wasteland wanderer: a mutant, a seeker, a robot-killer, a stoic shaman guarding forgotten ancient sciences. You seek triumph and technology, winning it with mutations and magic, soaked in the radiation and quantum fields of the mutated, the savage, the semi-sentient, and the artificially intelligent. There are treasures to be won in the taboo lands and ruins, and you shall have them.
Return to the glory days of science fiction gaming with the Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game. Adventure like it’s 1978 again, with modern rules grounded in the origins of post-apocalyptic role-playing. Fast play, a mysterious future, and 100% compatibility with the DCC RPG system await you — just activate your artifact…
Mutant Crawl Classics is a stand-alone post-apocalyptic RPG compatible with DCC RPG. It is a good complement to the Empire of the East sourcebook. You can buy the MCC RPG core rulebook here.
What? No Stretch Goals?
No stretch goals. In this current age of uncertainty, we simply want to print, ship and deliver this book in a timely manner. We invite you to appreciate this beautiful hardcover for what it is - and run some great games using this book!
Shipping & Handling
Shipping and handling costs are not included in the pledge levels. At the end of the Kickstarter, shipping and handling charges will be invoiced via a pledge manager. If you are unsure how expensive international shipping can be, please ask us for an estimate.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Goodman Games has run many Kickstarters. We are sometimes late due to adding too many stretch goals. For this project, however, we are not offering stretch goals, so we believe there are few risks.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Fireball RPG is a fantasy role-playing mobile app.
Are you familiar with tabletop RPGs such as Dungeons & Dragons or Pathfinder? The concept of Fireball is pretty similar, it will only make role-playing much easier and even more enjoyable. All rules will be automated and you will be able to play with your friends the whole day long. All that just a few taps away on your phone. 📱
Not familiar with role-playing? It's simple, just imagine five people narrating a story together. 💬 The Game Master will outline the situation and surroundings: “You, four heroes, finally opened the door, the room is on fire, smoke is everywhere.” One of the players responds: “Uh! I hold my nose and slowly proceed into the building. What do I see?” And it might go on and on.
The most important thing? You will experience unforgettable adventures and have fun, both with your friends. Let's be real here, friends who slay a dragon together, stay together, no doubt about that! 🐉
Too long didn’t read:
What: Mobile role-playing app
Key things: Automized rules, non-stop gaming, new friendships made
Early Access: Summer 2020
Release: By the end of 2020
Platforms: iOS & Android
The Game Master is the narrator and referee, players role-play their hero characters by describing what they do and say. Sometimes you might need to roll a dice 🎲 to see the outcome of your action, other times you might even fight in a battle or resolve a riddle.
Our goal is to create the best role-playing tool possible. If you’re a player, we’ll ensure you’re being entertained in a campaign for months or even years. If you take on a majestic role of a Game Master, we’ll do everything to make your job easier. 
Character Builder Pass (CBP) Subscription
Get exclusive access to the premium content for your heroes. Special appearances, more playable races (and subraces) and new backgrounds. What you get:
 Appearances - You are able to customize a lot of stuff on your character like face, hairstyle, hair color, eye color, clothes, scars, war paints, pedestals, and other accessories... And you get a lot of them, for free. But with CBP, you will get even more and much fancier options to tweak your character.
 Races - We are planning to launch our app with the 9 base races from 5e OGC DnD. These will be free. And we plan to release a DLC from time to time, introducing a new lands and with them, new races. For example, if you unlock the 5th tier of social goals, you get a Demonic race. Pure blooded demons with (for starters) 3 subraces. From those 2 would be free and 1 premium. So with each content update, you get a bunch of free stuff, but also some premium. The premium stuff will be available to those with CBP.
 Classes - For classes in CBP applies the same as for races.
 Backgrounds - With CBP you get a few new backgrounds, which will get special attention and be perfected to the last line.
World Builder Pass (WBP) Subscription
Access exclusive terrains and map objects for your adventure. Create epic battles with premium monsters that have special skills and prepare more entertaining situations with more specialized items (like an expanded fishing set, etc.). What you get: 
 World Map - You get more exclusive tiles, like winter versions of some classic tiles or an exotic wildwood with buildings of some ancient civilization. Stuff that you don't use every day, but will make your campaign stand out
 Location Map - The same as on the world map. Except there is more to work with. For example, when building dwarven tunnels, WBP will include stuff like cart rails or beautiful lamps for the walls
 Monsters - You will get premium versions of some monsters. Like ancient skeletons in magical armor or some brand new creatures that our artists will come up with a tweak to the last detail
 Ready-made adventures - Yes, there will be free adventures, but the really well worked out (and that will be most of them) will usually have free beginning only  (so that you can try them out), but the rest you'll have to buy. With WBP you have access to all of them.
 Items - Well this is a section with a loooot of content. Premium items will be for example some magical sets of armor or weapons. But also quite normal things like more tools for fishing, more kinds of fishes or stuff like that. Things that you don't need for running an adventure, but you need them to run YOUR epic adventure.
 Discord Role: FANatic • You get a unique role on our Discord server that is available only to Kickstarter backers.
Exclusive Kickstarter badge for your in-game characters • Honorable distinction exclusively for our backers. Add Kickstarter badge to your character, so that any player will recognize you as the one who helped with bringing Fireball to life.
Your name immortalized in our Tavern guest book • In our in-game capital, you will find our little Fireball Tavern. Be sure to stop by for a free meal and look for your name in the guest book.
Your name and painting in a guest book inside our Tavern • In our in-game capital, you will find our little Fireball Tavern. Be sure to stop by for a free meal and look for your name in the guest book. You can send us a picture of yourself (or something, you would love to have there) and our artists will create a drawing of it for the guest book.
Early Access - By September 2020 • You get access to our app even before it is released on the AppStore and Google Play Store. Not all features will be available (yet!) and there might (probably will) be bugs, but with your feedback, it will be much easier for us to fix them. Together we can tweak the app to perfection!
Character Builder Pass • Role-play with more than 2 characters at the same time and get exclusive access to the premium content for your heroes. Special appearances, more playable races (and subraces) and new backgrounds.
World Builder Pass • Manage more than 3 adventures at the same time. Access exclusive terrains and map objects for your adventure. Create epic battles with premium monsters that have special skills and prepare more entertaining situations with more specialized items (like an expanded fishing set, etc.).
Digital Map and Art Book • On release, we will send you a digital version of our world map (including all the realms), that will be currently available in-game.  We bring role-playing to mobile gaming! 

     We believe that the joy of imagination beats the numbness of popping balloons, flapping birds, and crushing candies. Friendships and memories built through role-playing are more than any casual game will ever be able to give you. 🔥    
Collaborative story-telling with your friends is like reading a book, but the next chapter isn’t written until you decide what you wanna do. And you can do anything. 🌌
We are going to bring this experience to phones. Not only as a new app to download but as a completely new thing that wasn’t here before. We believe that thanks to automized rules and a worldwide game-player matching will even more people find the beauty of role-playing.
 No startup plan is ever perfect, so this is subject to change, but we will do our best to stay the course. 
 There are so many amazing people in our community 👨 - and you can join them right now. 
We’re Fireball Studios, a mobile gaming studio based in Prague. Our operations started in the summer of 2019 and since then we’ve been working hard on Fireball RPG, the mobile role-playing app. 📱

Our expertise ranges from iOS & Android development to game design, UX design and art direction. 🎨

     All team members are passionate gamers. Sometimes we spend a whole evening playing the old-school Heroes of Might and Magic III. We also play Dark Souls, Borderlands, or even World of Warcraft.

     We love tabletop roleplaying games too! Our favorite is D&D (5th Edition), but we also like Pathfinder, Shadowrun, or Fate. We have a 4 hour-long session every Monday.
We just wanna prove to the world that mobile gaming that goes beyond neverending candies crushing can not only succeed but even create new friendships and communities. 💙

      We believe role-playing can beat casual games and there is a demand for a mobile role-playing platform. We want to prove this with a  successful Kickstarter campaign.
The best games are created by the best teams. We plan to use your money to scale our studio. Having more people working full time on this will accelerate the development and it will enable us to produce even better art in larger quantities. Long story short, we’d like Fireball to reach its full potential. 🚀

We’ve already spent over $100,000 developing this app. If you enable us to blow up here, we will have an easier time approaching new investors and publishers.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No one has tried to automize complicated role-playing rules to the mobile platform before. We’ve been working on this since summer 2019 and we think we understand it well, but creating a completely new platform with reworked game mechanics might bring challenges, we’re not aware of yet and those might slow down development. We’ve tried to mitigate this by assembling a strong team with experience in shipping AAA mobile apps used by millions every day. 👨

We have private investors, who can support us for a long time allowing us to develop the platform and put it on app stores. The only real risk is that we’ll ship the product late. In that case, we’ll consider releasing sooner without non-critical features and we’ll add them in later updates. However, we’ll do everything we can to prevent this and give you the ultimate role-playing experience by the end of a year. 💯

updates.update_userinfo: Early Access Delayed, 🕒 Feature List & New Content 📦
updates.update_content:
Hi! It's been a while since our last update. The Fireball team has been going through a few changes - we’ve gained new information, onboarded new people, and switched to a new production tool so we have stronger project management and, more importantly, better estimates. After analyzing our new data, we decided that the early access release needs to be pushed back a little. 🕰️
Our goal was to release early access on September 30th at the latest. But as things sometimes go with creative projects, we underestimated the scale of some tasks. We wanted to avoid big issues that could arise from rushing things, so instead of putting more pressure on our developers (who are already working super hard), we shifted our priorities. It will take more time to complete all the features needed for a good early-access experience.

https://buttonshygames.com/products/skulls-of-sedlec
Sedlec Ossuary, 16th Century AD.
The Black Plague and Hussite Wars have overcrowded the graveyard. Help the Bone Collector, a half-blind monk, by exhuming graves and arranging the skulls inside the crypt.
You are novice monks, competing to create the best arrangement of skulls. Dig up graves from the graveyard to reveal cards, take cards into your hand to collect skulls, and arrange the cards from your hand into a stack. Whoever better honors the deceased’s last wishes will score more points. The Bone Collector will then declare one player's stack as the most exceptional.
Skulls of Sedlec is a 2-3 player game (with expansions supporting 1 and 4 players), designed by Dustin Dobson with art by Marty Cobb. It was a runner up in Button Shy's 18 Card Challenge to design a game based on a real-life location.
For a complete gameplay overview, check out Dustin's video below: 
To try the game for yourself, the preview PNP (low color, unedited rules) is available now at PNPArcade.com. A small solo preview is there as well. Check it out here: https://www.pnparcade.com/products/skulls-of-sedlec-preview
And if you haven't heard of us before, here are a few quick notes about Button Shy:
We're a small, family based company, with a few helping hands and a great group of designers and artists.
We release a new wallet game every month. This is game #61!
Our wallet games are packaged in a small vinyl wallet for maximum portability.
Each game is hand assembled and mailed from our little workspace in New Jersey.

So no worries on whether we'll hit it or not, you are getting bonus content if you pledge here. The free expansion for this campaign is the Monstrance expansion. This expansion adds solo play to the game and will retail for $4 after the campaign. 
The Bone Monstrance is one of the ornate sculptures that decorate the inside of the Sedlec Ossuary. As a monk, you will toil away at exhuming graves and arranging skulls into stacks. As an artist though, you will need to be very creative to sculpt a truly original piece that will please the royal family!

This solo expansion celebrates these works of art by allowing you to create six unique features alongside a standard, pyramid-shaped stack of skulls. Each play session adds a condition that will make this undertaking a challenge for even the sharpest skull-stacker!  
Before we look at the rewards, here's a quick introduction to Skulls of Sedlec: Executioners. It's a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.
In life, the Executioner's duty was to protect society by by delivering the death sentence of the condemned. In death, Executioners wish to be surrounded by their handiwork, the abundant skulls of Criminals that they undid. 
This 6-card expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: The deadly Executioner. Punish your opponents and score big by attaching Executioners to groups of Criminals.  Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play. 
And now onto the rewards!

We have a whole bunch of games in our library. 
If you want to add more games to your order, you can do one of two things:
US Backers only - to order games that ship now - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0320impatient" to get 15% off  of your order. Your website order will ship now, as long as you don't order any pre-order items, otherwise the entire order will ship as soon as  everything comes in. As always, if you reach $25.00, you will also receive free shipping.
US Backers only - to order games that ship along with your rewards - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0320us" to get free shipping  on your extra games. These games will all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
International Backers only - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and  place an order using the coupon code "0320international" to get free shipping on your extra game(s). Note: The limit on this offer is 3 wallet games (and up to 3 expansions) total, including anything that you order at Kickstarter. Anything above 3 wallet games (and 3 expansions) will end up bumping into the next shipping tier, which can be as much as $10 on international orders. These games will all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
A few notable games available in our library are Tussie Mussie, Sprawlopolis and Circle The Wagons.
Dustin Dobson has been fascinated with games for as long as he can remember. As a designer, he’s passionate about crafting fun and memorable experiences that connect people, art, and interactive stories together. With a longtime career as a video game artist and producer, he’s proud to have shipped over a dozen titles, including 2018’s game of the year, God of War.
We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames,   promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts.... every  month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY WALLET GAME THAT WE MAKE. (See the $1 level, that's where the members back the projects).
Our 2020 $5 packages include an episode of Personal Space, a solo game that has multiplayer interactions. It's part roll and write, part campaign, part digital, part real life, part fantasy. There are stickers and everyone receives some unique cards and unique combinations of cards. It's launching very soon, and it's our most ambitious project yet and it will emerge throughout the year.
It also includes Trolling For Trouble by Mike Mullins. In your first month you'll get the 6 card starter kit and then each month after you'll receive a card to expand the game. Trolling For Trouble is a 3+ player bluffing and negotiation game where you play the monsters luring the heroes into battle.
Our $10 packages include all of the above and something extra. Generally it's a tiny game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion / promo cards for our existing games. We have a Sprawlopolis expansion coming in the next few months, and we're working on many more.
And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice). The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns (like the solo expansion here).

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 
It's time for one of those boring updates - the "things are going as planned, but we have nothing here to show yet" update. It's not my least favorite style though, that's the "things are running late" update. This one is slightly better than that. There's just not much to say! :)
The cards and wallets have been sent off to the printer and we're currently working on the rules. We're also already working on some expansion stuff. This will come out a few months after the game, to give everyone some time to play through and be ready for a new twist. We have more skull types planned, more solo cards planned, and if all goes well, you'll get to see a whole bunch of it.

Hey everyone! It's been a few days since the campaign ended, but I finally had a moment to move on the surveys. Keep an eye on your inboxes as they'll probably show up today. I assume I'm not the only one in this scenario, but being home with the kids is sometimes great, sometimes rough, and sometimes like this week... just straight madness. 
But while I have a moment of quiet (I should probably make sure everything is ok, haha), I wanted to say thanks to everyone. Thanks for supporting another Button Shy game, but thanks for also supporting in a time of such uncertainty. All is well with our production and our sources, but everything is just a little slower. Instead of going to the post office each day, we're going 1-2 times a week. Our local staff is safe at home so my immediate family is helping out a little more than normal.

@Ben Stanley: Unfortunately almost no creators I know of fulfill orders by amount of money spent, just like they don't fulfill orders in backer number order. The standard process I've seen for shipping is to send out as many rewards as possible as quickly as possible, and that makes sense. It's not exactly fun being at the end of the line and seeing others get and play their games before you, no. But you will get your stuff the same as everyone else. And when you have an order that's not customized, and you're only getting one copy of the game, you'll be near the front of the line. campaign.story:
The thunder of the pyro... the roar of the crowd... the ring of the bell... it's time for World Wide Wrestling!
The World Wide Wrestling RPG was originally published in 2015, and it’s been amazing to hear all of the exciting stories from players as they’ve clashed in the ring, played out incredible feuds and delighted fans from right here in your town to the farthest reaches of Parts Unknown. The time has come to put all of these lessons learned to good use! World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition combines all of the material from:
The original World Wide Wrestling RPG 
The International Incident supplement
The digital supplements, including The Road and the Extended Universe Gimmicks
and more!
... into one streamlined, updated game that supports both quickly getting to the action and long-term dynamic exploration of the promotion around the wrestlers.
Campaign Updates: 
3/21: Artist Yewon Kwon will be creating custom maneuver sequence play aids, as well as signature illustrations as a new reward level. See Update #2 for details.
3/30: The book will be printed in color! Thanks to your support, the interior of the book will match the vibrancy of the artwork and be able to use more visual design techniques to aid in learning and referencing the rules. This applies to all books at all reward levels. Also, artist JB Roe returns!  See Update #3 for details.  
What Is World Wide Wrestling?
World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition has the same mission statement as ever: to enable you to create your own professional wrestling promotion through play, showcasing satisfying and surprising storylines. It’s about feuds, championships, betrayal, and righteous victory. It’s about the clash of good and evil on the grandest stage. It’s about whether you’ve got what it takes. And, in the end, it’s about what the audience thinks of your efforts.
In World Wide Wrestling, you play wrestlers competing in the ring for both the adulation of the crowd and to improve your standing in the promotion. This game is about wrestling as a performance with pre-determined endings, telling stories of larger-than-life primordial conflict to the viewing audience. Your character is a professional who has a wrestling personae they play up for the crowd; in the ring, you have partners and rivals among the other wrestlers, but when the cameras are off, you may have very different conflicts and relationships with your coworkers.
Click here to download the playtest PDFs!
You do not need to have a deep knowledge of professional wrestling to play and enjoy this game! It gives you the tools, you just bring the enthusiasm. And if you are a big wrestling fan, you'll be able to get right to what makes you the most excited about wrestling and play out all the drama you ever wanted to see in the ring!
Some Commentary on World Wide Wrestling:
Polygon (1/2018) "By the end of the game’s opening hour, we had all the makings of a primetime soap opera, and enough bitter rivalries to last an entire campaign... It was glorious, and made all the better by television-style commentary from the other characters at the table and a live audience holding up signs around the table."
Shut Up and Sit Down (9/2016) "What is perhaps World Wide Wrestling’s greatest triumph as a game is that not only does it resoundingly succeed in teaching you how to play, it puts you in a gentle, nurturing headlock that forces the appeal of wrestling deep into your eye sockets like a screwdriver during a hardcore match. And, you know what? I don’t think more than one person has to have read the book to play. That is not something I say a lot." (Watch SU&SD play the game!)
Critical Hits (9/2014) "This game is packed so full of wrestleicious flavor that it’s ridiculous."
A ton of people have played the game for their podcasts and actual play streams - you can find some links at the game page, or seach your platform of choice for the World Wide Wrestling RPG!
What's New?
World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition is an evolution of the first edition. It's familiar to current fans of the game, but updated and re-imagined to address common sticking points and bring in new insights based on years of play. 
The Basic Moves have been re-designed around the principle of smoothing out the Momentum economy so it works more evenly for everyone regardless of their play-style. 
A new Basic Move has been added, to address backstage confrontations: Play Politics.
The core roster of Gimmicks has been expanded from the original 10 to 15 by surveying and consolidating all of the published Gimmicks.
The Gimmicks have been redesigned to sharpen their Moves and play options. This includes a reconception of the +Power stat into +Body, to create a more inclusive way to talk about strong wrestlers, as well as the addition of Wants, a new option to help direct your characterization of your wrestler in play.
The rules for treating the Promotion as its own character, and how that changes over time in long-term play, have been brought in and revised from International Incident into a core part of the game.
The rules for playing out what wrestlers do in between events, from local media promotion to seeing the family, will be brought in and revised from the On The Road digital supplement as an option for play.
And so much more!
Image of the Second Edition Gimmicks - Click here to download the playtest PDF!
Check out the redesigned Gimmick sheets in the playtest download here!
In addition to all of that, two new essays will be added to those being republished from the original game and International Incident. As wrestling has grown over the years, so have the ways in which it intersects with roleplaying:
 Anna Anthropy is writing about the power of imagining and experimenting with personal identity through wrestling. 
Anna Anthropy is a game designer, educator and 30-something teen witch. She is the author of seven books and too many games, and teaches game design as DePaul University's Game Designer in Residence. She lives in Chicago with her familiar, a little black cat named Encyclopedia Frown. Check out her work at w.itch.io.
 Jeff Stormer is writing about the overlap of pro wrestling and LARP, and what they can (and do!) learn from each other.
Jeff Stormer is the host of the Party of One Podcast, an actual-play podcast focused on two-player roleplaying experiences. His hobbies include game design, pro wrestling, superheroes and craft beer. Check out Party of One at partyofonepodcast.com.
What's the Same?
World Wide Wrestling continues, of course, to be Powered by the Apocalypse.
The basic structure of the game remains unchanged - pick a Gimmick, make some choices about your wrestler and get right to the action! Creative (the GM role) builds each Episode around what they think will be the dramatic and fun for your imaginary viewing audience to see - but the players will always end up swerving "the plan." You all work together, through your feuds, promos and altercations, to make it seem like that was what was intended all along!
The Narrative Action of Wrestling Matches
While the Moves have been slightly revised, the way that wrestling works is unchanged. One player in the match has narrative control, and describes what their wrestler is doing and how they're shaping the story between the ropes. This is a sequence of maneuvers and moments that leads up to a big spot, when you really showcase your wrestler or their abilities - that's when you roll dice to see how well everything goes over with the audience! The dice will also tell you whether you retain control, or your opponent counters and takes the narrative over, and so on. Creative tells you when the match should come to a climax, and whoever's booked to win finds out how the audience reacts to their big moment!
There's a lot more to it, of course - other wrestlers may run in to spoil your moment, the Announcer for the match (one of the other players who's wrestler isn't competing) may put over an underwhelming move to help you out in the eyes of the audience, or you may decide to swerve the booking and go into business for yourself! Each match unfolds differently as your wrestlers jostle for position on the card and try to get their Wants, all in the context of the overall development of your Promotion.
This Second Edition includes more resources for how to think about wrestling matches, what "telling a story in the ring" means in practice, and pointers on incorporating wrestling psychology into matches in your games.
The Rewards
This campaign is about getting the new edition finished and out into the world, so the rewards are pretty simple:
 The Digital Bundle: This bundle includes the book text in PDF and ebook formats, along with all of the home-printer ready Gimmick and reference sheets and play aids.
 The Book: The book is being redesigned from the ground up to incorporate all of the material from previous publications. It is currently estimated to be a graphic novel size (6.625x10.25) softcover of around 200 pages. Depending on how the campaign goes, there may be some printing upgrades made to the book - all rewards will get all upgrades as they become possible! UPDATE 3/30: The book will be printed in color! Thanks to your support, the interior of the book will match the vibrancy of the artwork and be able to use more visual design techniques to aid in learning and referencing the rules. 
 The Cards: The Move Deck has been reconceived as a general-use play aid. This is currently a 40-card deck containing all of the Basic, Wrestling and Role Moves, designed with an eye towards helping players sort through their options and quickly get to the good stuff in play. Depending on how the campaign goes, there may be some printing upgrades made to the cards - all rewards will get all upgrades as they become possible!
 The Shirt: The shirt will be a lovingly screen-printed, comfortable garment produced by the good people at LVAC. They are going to be printed to order for this campaign with very little overstock - no reprints! 
  Agent - Add a Maneuver: Shape the matches of the World Wide Wrestling Universe with your favorite wrestling move! You submit the name and description of the move, and play aid artist Yewon Kwon will produce a multiple-stage illustration (up to 3) of how its done, to be included in the book (see an example of what these will look like below!) Submissions will be vetted for appropriateness (no slurs or hate speech in the name of the move).  
 General Manager - Pitch a Promotion: Join the action by contributing your fantasy wrestling promotion to be included in the book! You pitch a concept, what makes this promotion distinct, and any wrestlers or staff key to the company, and it will be built out using the Second Edition Promotion rules. Pitches will be vetted for appropriateness (no nazis, no hate speech/hateful ideologies as part of the concept). 
 Title Belts: Join the ranks of previous World Wide Wrestling Champions! There are two title belts of equal prestige: the NEW (New Era World) Champion, and the RAD (Regional Athletic Division) Champion. 
Mockup Images - the Book and the Move Cards
Mockup Images - Title Belts and Shirt
About Shipping: Unfortunately, international shipping outside of the US is very expensive! The book and Move Cards will be available to game store retail after backer rewards ship, so if you want to wait for the general release, you will still be able to get the game. I'm also happy to say that the good people at Indie RPG Bookshelf in Austrialia will be helping out to get books to Austalian backers, enabling a more reasonable cost for pledges shipping to Australia.
About the COMMUNITY SPECIAL DIGITAL BUNDLE: This reward is exactly the same as the $15 Digital Bundle, but at a discount for two groups of backers. This pledge level is for:
anyone who has recently purchased the $8 digital bundle of the first edition + International Incident, to say thank you for checking out the original game while the new edition is cooking.
anyone who is experiencing financial hardship who still wants to support the campaign. 
Please only pledge to this level if you fit one of those profiles! This is on the honor system, so please be respectful of who it's for. Thanks! 
Play Aids
The only materials you need to play World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition are the rules, printouts, pencils and two 6-sided dice - but there's more! The Move Cards are play aids that break up the many options for players into bite-sized chunks, keeping things moving and giving weight to that big character moment as you slap down the card corresponding to the Move.
The Move Cards are currently a 40-card deck with 2 copies of each of the Basic and Wrestling Moves, along with enough double-sided Role Cards (Babyface/Heel) for up to 8 players at a time. In playtesting it's been fun to use the Wrestling Move Cards as a "hand," and to play each Move out of it as you narrate your wrestlers maneuvers. The rules are the same as playing from the book, but the cards help players get used to their various options as they learn the ropes!
Also, the maneuver illustrations are being redone to showcase how the narrative of the match covers sequences of moves leading up to the moment you roll dice to see how it all goes over. These new illustrations are by artist and publisher Yewon Kwon. Yewon will also be illustrating the custom maneuvers for backers at the Agent level!
Play Aid Illustration by Yewon Kwon
This concept includes notation for the "1, 2, 3" method introduced in the playtest materials. As you narrate what your wrestler does in the match, pick up one die at a time, with a break between for details or transitions, or give your opponent space to help fill in their responses to your moves. Once you have both dice in hand, "3" is rolling them for the Wrestling Move so you see how your big spot goes over with the audience! This mnemonic should help guide players into the rhythm of a wrestling match, and the illustrations show you the basics of what chains together to create the back-and-forth drama! We will be providing at least 6 of these 5-6 stage sequences, to pick from and embellish or to use as examples as you get used to the game.
Closeup - Move Illustrations by Yewon Kwon
Print-and-play cards and print-ready maneuver example sheets will be included in the Digital Bundle.
Hailing From World Wide Wrestling
Wrestling contains multitudes! While World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition is meant to be flexible and cover whatever wild direction your group takes it, it specifically looks at wrestling as a performance art with separation between on-camera and backstage characters, performance for an audience, and character movement up and down the card based on popularity with the crowd.
But what if you want to do something else?
Hailing From World Wide Wrestling is an open license and set of resources for you to use to make your own game that builds on, subverts or is descended from World Wide Wrestling. It will be released alongside the second edition, and is meant to give everyone who wants to use World Wide Wrestling as a launching pad for their own game project a solid starting place.
Hailing From World Wide Wrestling Logo
Who Are You?
I'm Nathan D. Paoletta, a game designer, independent publisher and graphic artist hailing from Chicago, IL. I designed, wrote and published World Wide Wrestling and International Incident, as well as a slew of other games. Last year I made the RPG Design Zine and published Imp of the Perverse (among other projects) - you can see all of my work at my website. This year I want to make World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition a reality. 
I'm working with talented friends I've worked with before as well as bringing in new voices to add fresh perspectives to the book! The second edition will include the incredible artwork and essays already published, as well as brand new work. I'm proud to include writing, artwork and design contributions in the second edition from: Ian Williams, Epidiah Ravachol, The Black Cat, Gregor Hutton, Tim Rodriguez, Adam Ultraberg, Anna Anthropy, Jeff Stormer, Yewon Kwon, Eric Quigley, Ramon Villalobos, JB Roe and Punkrockbigmouth. And maybe more!
Special Thanks to Indie RPG Bookshelf in Australia for helping get the game to Australian backers!
Australian Fulfillment by Indie RPG Bookshelf
Thank you for checking out World Wide Wrestling: Second Edition. See you in the ring!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this project is my main one for the year, I do have other projects in various stages of fulfillment as well. It's always possible that issues with one project have a ripple effect of delays, since I'm the point person for each of my games.

The bulk of the game text is written and the core mechanical changes have been in playtesting since early 2019. This campaign is funding the time and care needed to pull everything into a new standalone book (as well as pay contributors and create the rewards), but if that process reveals unforeseen gaps in the writing or the design, addressing those creative issues could push the final release back.

If this campaign hits certain levels of success I will need to go overseas for printing. Right now, the spread of the COVID-19 Coronavirus is globally impacting shipping and manufacturing. Hopefully, by the time this is ready to go to print, there will be more predictable timelines for manufacturing than I can guarantee right now. I will do my best to account for the manufacturing/shipping uncertainty, but as it's an evolving situation, I may have to be flexible with how I approach getting these books printed.

Any delays or effects of these issues on this campaign will be conveyed to backers - I am committed to transparency and open communication in all of my projects, and this one is no different!

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone,
This is just a quick update to let you know where I'm currently at. The layout situation is pretty good - I have all of the material in place, and am happy with the overall look and feel. I have a few more passes to smooth out the rough edges and pull everything together nicely, but the bulk of the work is done! I am confident in saying that the PDF will be out to backers by the end of November, which means that the print process will begin as well.

Hi everyone,
A short and sweet one for now: I got the manuscript back from editing a few weeks ago, and started layout on the book! All of the illustrations have been completed, and I have the Promotion submissions in hand as well, so all the pieces are in place and I'm seeing how they fit together as I work out the visual language of this new edition.
A few thoughts on this part of the process. This isn't simply banging the text into the original template and calling it good. It's a larger-format book than the original, and (thanks to your support!) in full color, so I have a lot of new opportunities to make this physical artifact really sing. As that starts coming together, I learn more about how the text organization can be improved and where little nips and tucks or slight expansions on certain topics will improve the flow of everything. It's a bit alchemical, and sometimes two steps forward and one step back, so I don't have a hard "done by X" date. But there aren't any particular obstacles that I currently see other than the overall friction of "getting things done this year has been harder than usual."

campaign.story:
We are Cæsar ink, and we spend most of our time working on RPG projects such as Tails of Equestria and Jim Henson's Labyrinth: the Adventure game. For the past year we have also been running Dungeons and Designs, a show where we design dungeons live on twitch (Mondays at 8pm GMT) using suggestions from fans in chat, you should join us!
Although all of the adventures are and always will be available as PDFs for free, we know that many GMs prefer physical zines and maps to work from. This kickstarter allows us to take the time to edit each of our PDF adventures into a black and white A5 zine with a full-colour postcard map, perfect for sharing with players.
Oh, one more thing! If you are interested in being a part of the creative process, you should join us at the start and end of this Kickstarter over on twitch where we will be designing a brand new adventure "The Inn-Between"to be released to all kickstarter backers. 
If you drop a suggestion in the suggestion box, we will also be creating the most upvoted suggestion live on stream after the kickstarter is complete.
 We are Jack and Chris Cæsar, and Cæsar ink is our way of filling the world with a little bit more adventure. 
We would like to thank Morgan Finley, Sarah Jack (@sarahJackC), Lance Wilson (@Lancorz), Ross Connell (@moregamespls), and our Twitch community for helping us get to 20 dungeons!

updates.update_content:
Hello everybody!
As I am sure you are all aware, the world is still somewhat in disarray, but it seems that things are slowly starting to pick up. The adventures are written and laid out, and just need proofreading and printing before they can head out to all of our lovely backers!
This is mostly just an update so you know that we haven't fallen off the face of the earth, and are still working towards getting your goodies into your hands as soon as possible after it is safe to do so.
Jack Cæsar

Hello all, as I am sure you are all aware, the Covid-19 situation is affecting everyone's lives in unprecedented ways. 
Here at Dungeons and Designs, we are lucky enough that most of the project can be completed remotely, but we are expecting delays once we get to the printing stage. Once we have the PDFs up and running we will be sharing those for free, but right now we can't be certain when physical copies will be able to be sent out.

campaign.story:
The Ollustria Field Guides introduce you to a fantasy world created and illustrated by 12 year old artist/designer, Cassandra Neville. They are a collection of three different pamphlet-style zines which unfold into a large, 11" x 17", hand-illustrated map of each imaginative land.  
Three different Ollustria Field Guides will be made:
The Kingdom of Astivel
The Haunted Wastes of Everil 
The Mystical Islands of Khan Zaar
The guides are system agnostic and designed with both the player and story-teller in mind. You can use The Ollustria Field Guides to kick off a new adventure or extend the world of your current campaign. 
The Ollustria Field Guides are a father/daughter collaboration to make three pocketable travel guides to different lands in the mystical world of Ollustria. 
Each guide features a range of information including landmarks, major cities, notable characters, legends, songs and other cultural aspects. The guides are written 'in-world' as if they are travel guides given to adventurers at information kiosks when they travel to a new land.
Close-up from the map of the Kingdom of Astivel
For people running a campaign, the guides provide inspiration for adventures and a great physical prop for players. The guides provide enough detail to inspire story-tellers, but are mysterious enough to be spoiler free for the party. 
For players, they provide a high-level overview of each kingdom in Ollustria. The guides tease at potential mysteries, hint at great adventures and let the players see where they are in the world.
The maps are hand-drawn, hand-lettered and painted with water colors for a classical medieval fantasy look and feel. 
The first guide: The Kingdom of Astivel is complete and ready to be printed and the other two guides will be finished if the Kickstarter campaign is successful.
The two additional Field Guides will feature:
 The Frozen Haunted Wastes of Everil 
 The Mystical Tropical Islands of Khan Zaar 
 The Ollustria Field Guides are part of Kickstarter's  #ZineQuest2 initiative.

Each Field Guide features:
11" x 17" fold out map
Lore and Legends
Places and people of note
Songs, poems and other cultural insights
Colorful Risograph printing
The World of Ollustria is a medieval fantasy setting which combines elements of high-fantasy and classical fairy tales. It is a land where ghosts haunt the frozen lands of the north, unspeakable horrors roam The Forbidden Lands and the mountains and forests of the Kingdom of Astivel promise treasures untold. 

Close-up from the map of the Kingdom of Astivel
Risograph printers are situated somewhere between screen-printing and laser printing. Individual colors are laid onto the paper through a screened overlay at varying opacity.  This gives each Risograph print a unique texture and the potential for unique color combinations when combined with colored paper. All of the zines will be printed at a local Vancouver-base printer who specializes in zines and indie projects.
Three Ollustria Field Guide PDF's
Includes a downloadable PDF of each Field Guide: The Kingdom of Astivel, The Haunted Wastes of Everil  and The Tropical Islands of Khan Zaar.  The PDFs will be provided in two formats, one set up for printing and folding and another laid out for reading digitally.
Three Ollustria Field Guide Printed Zines
You get a printed and folded copy of each Field Guide zine: The Kingdom of Astivel, The Haunted Wastes of Everil  and The Tropical Islands of Khan Zaar. The guides are Risograph printed and each guide will be printed in a different paper/ink color combination. Each guide unfolds into a ~11"x17" map.

Field Guides unfold into a 11" x 17" map
Unfolded Risograph prints of each map
Receive a 11"x17" Risograph print of each map. These are printed on one side and are unfolded so that they are suitable for display, or if you would like to give players a map without the world information (and perhaps roll it up into a scroll). These will be shipped in mailing tubes.
An extra unfolded map of each kingdom for display or handing out to players
All Digital and Physical Stretch Goals
If the campaign is successful, we have many ideas for how to extend the world of Ollustria. Everyone who backs at the Digital Tier will receive all non-physical stretch goal rewards and everyone who backs at any zine tier will receive any additional physical stretch goal rewards that are made.
The Generous Dungeon Master
For the story-teller who loves to give their players physical props (or for the party that has problems sharing). This includes three complete sets of each printed Field Guide zine as well as a set of unfolded maps.
Name a landmark
You can name a landmark in the world on one of the maps. Perhaps you want to name a city after yourself, or name a forest after a player's favorite character who died tragically in a previous campaign. It's up to you. All name submissions are subject to approval and we ask that you keep it all-ages and on-theme. If you're worried about approval, please get in touch.
Original water colored map art
You will receive the original ink and water color art used for the map. These are done on professional quality water color paper with professional Qor brand water colors. Each map will be painted in a different color. All materials used are lightfast and archival quality.  This reward will be shipped in a flat box and shipping is limited to US and Canada. The map of Astivel is complete, but the other maps still need to be made. Buying original art, sight-unseen, is truly adventurous.
Original water color map detail

Goal #1: Water Color Covers - ACHIEVED!
If we reach $2000 in funding, each Field Guide will get an original hand-illustrated water color cover by Cassandra. The illustration will feature a landmark from that land and will help give the guides a more traditional, hand-made look and feel. 
Goal #2: A Fourth Field Guide -The Forbidden Lands
If we raise $4000, we will create a whole new guide to cover The Mysterious Forbidden Lands, bringing the total number of guides for four.
The Forbidden Lands Field Guide will be included in all tiers that receive awards. The Digital Package tier will receive the PDFs and all other tiers will receive the additional physical Field Guide and map for their tier.
About The Forbidden Lands:
The terrors of The Forbidden Lands have plagued Astivel for centuries. Raiding parties and roaming monsters are held at bay by the brave soldiers and wizards of Stonehold Keep. The ruins of Stillwater are a constant reminder for the kingdom to stay vigilant as the once-great city was lost in a single night to the monstrosities of The Forbidden Lands.
The Ollustria Field Guides are made by a father/daughter team to help bring Cassandra's imaginative worlds to life.
Cassandra Neville is a 12 year old cartographer, artist and Dungeon Master. She has a deep passion for fantastic worlds and map making. Cassandra is illustrating the maps and building the lore of Ollustria. This is her first published project.
Shane Neville is a 20+ year game industry veteran (Company of Heroes, Need for Speed, Shellrazer and Bunker Punks) who loves all aspects of making games, physical and digital. Shane made his first zine in the late 80's and been collecting and making zines ever since. Shane is responsible for production, map lettering and additional art for The Ollustria Field Guides. He is also Cassandra's dad.
When we first heard about Zine Quest 2, we thought it would be a great opportunity to make something fun together and put it out into the world. 
If the Kickstarter is successful, it'll cover printing costs for the Field Guides as well as cover the cost for creating the guides. Proceeds from the project will go towards Cassandra's education; both on-going arts education as well as saving for post-secondary. 
Video background music credits:
A Room And A Fire by A Shell in the Pit
Listen on Spotify
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a few low-risk challenges we expect through production:
- The map-making process is time consuming and if an accident (ie: spilling ink on the map) occurs late in the process of map-making, days or weeks of work can be lost. We've given ourselves lots of time in our schedule so that we can absorb a few mishaps.
- Risograph printing can be a bit haphazard and the printers can eat up paper. We'll order paper with this in mind, but it's possible that the printers will chew through our paper supply and we'll need to order more, which can create a small delay.

campaign.story:
Welcome to The Great Ball.
You are wealthy and well-connected citizens of The Regency, a decadently aristocratic society that thrives on ambition, ingenuity and most importantly the power of who you know. As players, you will go through tonight with the express aim of furthering your place in society and achieving what your chosen character truly and deeply desires. These are tracked by your Social Standing, and your Heart’s Desires. At some points these overlap, at other points, you might have to make a choice between public appearance and getting your happily ever after.
You are not alone in this desperate search for approval, for some present at The Great Ball is seeking a darker source of endorsement, their monarchs not the rightful Imperial Majesties of the Regency, but older, eldritch beings of unknowable horror who dwell in the dark between the stars.
It is up to you, the guests at this Great Ball to not only secure your future, but also the continuation of the Regency and any mortal life on this world. Good luck and chose your dances well.
As ever, I remain your humble servant,
The Dance Master
Seance and Sensibility is a TTRPG in zine format where players take the roles of attendees at a grand event set in a fictionalised Regency Era world. It is designed to be played in a One-Shot format and will include rules for running the game as a more typical “Guided” RPG with a Dance Master (DM) running the world around the players, and a “Collaborative” mode with no designated DM. It will be produced as a 24-page A5 booklet fully printed in black and white.
Stretch Goals: 
£600: Commissioned artwork. The Zine will feature several character illustrations and concept pieces throughout, giving life to the narrative and visual inspiration to the players and DM.
£700: Six extra pages of content detailing DM content, mechanics to construct different worlds and vary the setting, as well as tools for changing the game from a One­-Shot to a longer-form campaign.
£1300: Three extra pages of content detailing a new play mode "Solo", which includes tools for generating random encounters, enemies, allies and the Cult you are working against. This will operate like a choose your own adventure within the game system.
The Setting:
The Grand Ball is the main event on anyone in high society’s calendar. Once a year the greatest minds, richest wallets, proudest generals and other influential members of The Regency attend this magnificent and decadent night to further their varied ambitions.
However, there are darker designs at work than the political machinations of rival dynasties and merchant dukes. There are things that hunger beyond the stars, and some within the Regency have heeded their maddening call. These servants of the Eldritch powers seek to perform a series of rituals during the celebrations, ghastly and innocuous in order to bring about the end of days and allow their unknowable masters to feast upon the world.
The players act as varied guests in The Grand Ball, each touched by the Eldritch in some way and each with their own goals to increase Social Standing and secretly to pursue their Heart’s Desire.
Will the players succeed in saving this reality from the unspeakable horrors that lurking the shadows or will they bring it about all the quicker? Whatever happens, it will be a night to remember.
The Game:
Seance and Sensibility is a complete Role-Playing game based on the Powered by The Apocalypse system.  It uses specific “playbooks” which include character archetypes such as The Thief, The Soldier, The Merchant and The Debutante. Each playbook has different interpretations and playstyles included, so no two characters need to be the same. Over the course of The Grand Ball the players will become aware of the terrible machinations in the shadows and will have the chance to foil or further these goals.
Each player will have a secret Heart’s Desire, these are objectives they are encouraged to go for throughout the session. Examples include The Cad who is encouraged to engage in social scandals, The Hopeful Romantic who chooses another character and protect them at all costs, The Meddler who attempts to ensure certain characters end the session either together or not, chosen at the start of the game. However at least one of the players might be a member of the very Cult trying to bring about the apocalypse, in which case, during the game they can sway others to their cause or even see the error of their ways.
Seance and Sensibility is designed to played in a group of 3-6 players with or without a Dance Master. Guidance for both methods of play will be included in the Zine, with the “Collaborative” mode being slightly more focussed on the player character interactions with each other and focussed on a “Drawing Room” level of play as opposed to the larger narrative scope of “Guided” play.
The Zine:
Seance and Sensibility will be a 24 page A5 booklet, fully black and white. Printing will be handled in the UK by Inky Little Fingers. A PDF version will be available as soon as it is ready to be printed.
Worldwide shipping is included in the cost of the Social Debutante level and above.
The Creator:
Finn Cresswell is an archaeologist, writer, actor and long time TTRPG player born in the US to British parents and now living in the south of England.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first project on Kickstarter and I am the only person involved unless the art stretch goal is unlocked, in which case a local artist has agreed to provide several pieces of art for the Zine. I have used and adapted several different game systems for campaigns I have run privately and professionally and have done my research to identify which elements of the project will take more time than initially thought or might prove more challenging. This is built into the August release date, giving me the time to work out any problems that may arise.
Much of the writing for Seance and Sensibility is complete, but it requires further playtesting. Formatting and licensing artwork is the main next step, which is what much of the funding will go towards. I will keep backers updated as to the progress of this as it unfolds.

updates.update_content:
Hello all, 

Firstly, thank you all for your patience. The last year was full of hardships and delays, with the second lockdown in the UK (and now subsequent third) it has been impossible to get the physical copies of the zine printed at the scale and rate previously hoped for as many printing companies were not taking any new orders until January 2021 at the earliest.

Hello everyone!
I apologise for the lack of updates recently. There have been several unfortunate issues and unforeseen circumstances that have affected the production of Seance and Sensibility. To this end, I will need to delay the delivery of the RPG to you all by three weeks, so instead of the end of August, the PDf copies will be released on the 20th of September and the print copies should be following soon after. It is still on its way and I am working my hardest to make sure it is the best it can be for you all. I can only apologise for these delays. 

Below is a brief overview of the playbooks and hints to the horrific cults that players will be opposing.

Hello everyone, 
Thank you for all of your patience in this trying time. With the pandemic still being dealt with in the UK and the most recent turmoil across the world, it has been hard to finalize and work creatively, as well as source what is needed for completing this project early. We are still working to schedule though!  
That being said, there has been more testing and development done on the RPG and I have found some key elements that needed to be reworked. These have been worked on and I am closer than ever to finishing the document.

Hello again everyone! 
Tomorrow I will be providing a preview of the Heart's Desires mechanic present in the game. This has slightly been delayed due to health issues stemming from the COVID-19 pandemic. But fear not, it will be posted on here very shortly. 
In addition, soon, you’ll receive an email with a special link to your BackerKit survey. It’s important to respond to your survey as quickly as you can since I need this information to fulfill your rewards.

Hello everyone!
Welcome to the start of the Gazeteer Updates! Once every two weeks I will be posting an update (hopefully with some new art next time!) on the progress of the Zine and asking what you would like to see covered next.
The first major update for you all is the obvious, we are fully funded! We have also completely demolished the first two stretch goals I set for this project and reached the £1300 final stretch goal, I am just absolutely floored by the response from you all. I am grateful for all of your support and am working on getting more previews out as soon as I can.

Thank you all for your kind support. Seance and Sensibility has reached its first funding goal! I am just astounded by the interest you all have shown in this project of mine. 
I can't wait to share more about the Zine in upcoming weeks as I work through the layout and editing process. I look forward to talking through some of the playbooks next week, watch this space!
And once again, thank you all so very much.
