campaign.story:
The conclusion is already in place: You have failed. The Queen is dead.
Our Queen Crumbles is a collaborative storytelling game for 2-4 players about revenge, inevitable death, and saying goodbye to those you love. It is set in the weird-fantasy land of Halloway, where the dead whisper to those who listen and the fundamental forces of nature can be bent to your will. The game is meant to be played in a single sitting, and is focused on developing interesting and dynamic characters over the course of a few hours—no matter your roleplaying experience.
You will take on the role of The Knight of Whispers, The Gravity Witch, The Hangman Golem, and The Bloody Historian, the four most loyal retainers of a once great Queen. Go on an epic fantasy road trip as you pursue the Queen’s killer to the Tree Under the Mountain, and use what time you have left to say farewell.
The Gravity Witch
The Queen of Halloway was once revered and feared in equal measure. She ruled over a vast and wild land at the edge of the world, home to human, fey, and magickal creature alike. The land itself defied all taming—deserts bloomed with crystalline roses, boiling rivers ran through the forests, and towering prisms gathered on the plains like the eggs of some great beast—yet still the people of Halloway made their own place there.
On the far coast, the Lonely City presided over the Queendom. It was here that the Queen held court, brokering peace and passing judgement as she saw fit. She felt safe behind impenetrable stone walls, guarded by her army of living statues. 
Then the Assassin came, and the Queen's peace was shattered. By the time the Queen's retainers arrived, she lay dead in a crimson pool at the foot of her throne.
The Queen's closest friend, the Gravity Witch, moved first. She gathered from the throne room a pile of broken statue shards. With quick motions and practiced sounds she spun the fundamental forces around her will, and formed from the shattered stone an amalgam body from the disparate parts. And with a groan, she threw gravity into chaos, and drew the soul of the dead Queen back from wherever it meant to go—into the amalgam body.
Yet this is only a temporary solution. The reforged statue is not fit to hold a human soul for long. She will soon crumble.
There is, therefore, only one thing remaining to the Queen: Revenge.
The Hangman Golem
Our Queen Crumbles uses a new GM-less storytelling system centered on progressive character revelation—though you start the game with only a vague idea of who your characters are, each scene lets you dive into their history and personality a bit more. Players build scenes around a collection of character traits and story elements, allowing you to do on-the-fly worldbuilding alongside your friends.
Each player will choose a playbook from the available character archetypes, The Knight of Whispers, The Gravity Witch, The Hangman Golem, and The Bloody Historian. The players will also share two table playbooks, The Queen, and The Assassin. Playbooks contain an assortment of character traits, items, and abilities for the players to choose from as they travel on their journey. Instead of character advancement that makes you more powerful, Our Queen Crumbles features character advancement that makes you more interesting—every box you mark on your sheet drives the story forward, giving you a better picture of the character you play.
Character Sheet Mockup
Who is the Little Stone God? Why does the Knight of Whispers carry the Salt and Iron crowns? What is the Tree Under the Mountain? Only you can decide.
The game trusts players to come up with conflict, intrigue, and answers to the questions they have.
Our Queen Crumbles is a supremely hackable system, and I already have plans for additions to the zine. Backers who support the game at the Gilded Vessel tier will get to come up with their own character archetypes, which I will turn into additional character sheets. These sheets will be collected and released to all backers as the Our Queen Crumbles: Retainers expansion.
The zine will be a 24-page printed booklet with a beautiful two-color cover illustrated and designed by Lonely Egg Studio. Internal illustrations by Al Lukehart will show off the fantastical setting throughout the text. The zine will contain everything you need to play a game of Our Queen Crumbles in a single sitting, including character sheets for each of the 4 playable characters, rules for setting scenes along your journey, and a map of Halloway depicting the path from the Lonely City to the Tree Under the Mountain.
Zine Mockup
 Crumbling Vessel ($5) - The complete digital collection of Our Queen Crumbles. This tier will get you everything you need to play the game, along with the Retainers expansion.
 Cracked Vessel ($10) - The physical version of Our Queen Crumbles. This tier will get you the beautiful zine, as well as the complete digital collection.
 Pristine Vessel ($20) - The signed physical version of Our Queen Crumbles, plus some extra physical goodies. This tier will get you the zine, pre-printed character sheets for your first game, and a stack of my postcard-sized hack of Our Queen Crumbles, The Golems of Claypit.
 Gilded Vessel ($60) - The storyteller's version of Our Queen Crumbles. Along with all the physical and digital rewards, I will create a custom character sheet for an archetype chosen by you. These character sheets will be compiled into Our Queen Crumbles' first expansion, Retainers, and you will be credited as the creator of your character.
Our Queen Crumbles was originally written in June of 2019 for the annual Game Chef RPG competition, and was one of the five English-language finalists.  I received some really encouraging feedback during the jam, and decided to refine the game and bring it to print as my first fully produced RPG.
In October 2019, I co-wrote a party-game hack of Our Queen Crumbles with Adam Vass, which we called The Golems of Claypit. The "Golem Game", as it came to be known, was a hit at Big Bad Con 2019 in Walnut Creek, CA. I got to play the game with a lot of my favorite RPG designers, and I was convinced that the system of character development was really fun to engage with.
By early January I had assembled a crack team of creatives to make this zine a reality, including Adam, Al Lukehart, Jessica Fong, and Sal V Cloak. Budgets were drafted, art was drawn, and marketing was dumped everywhere I could find.
The next chapter of this game's history is up to you.
The Bloody Historian
Jason Brown (he/him) is the lead designer for Our Queen Crumbles, and is solely to blame for the strange things hidden inside this zine. Beside writing games, Jason writes about games as the Indie RPG journalist for the Ennie-nominated blog Cannibal Halfling Gaming. Follow his game design and journalism here.
Adam Vass (he/him) is the production consultant and graphic designer for Our Queen Crumbles, as well as the co-designer of The Golems of Claypit. He has created many small-press RPG's as World Champ Game Co, including last year's amazing Zinequest project: Tome & Wish You Were Here. He is also currently running his own Kickstarter for Cobwebs, a neo-noir RPG.  Follow him here.
Al Lukehart (they/them) is the lead illustrator for Our Queen Crumbles. They have done art for such illustrious RPG's as: Ben Robbins' Follow, Justin Ford's Saviors of Hogtown, and Eli Kurtz's Errant Deeds: Tall Tales in the Blackwood. They are also getting ready to release a serial webcomic, PARSLEY, later this year. Check out their work here.
Lonely Egg Studio is the cover illustrator and designer for Our Queen Crumbles. Jessica Fong is the illustrator responsible for the amazing cover art, and Sal V Cloak was in charge of the graphic design and textual elements. They are also in the process of developing a surreal adventure video game called In the Keeper's Shadow, as well as running their own Zinequest Kickstarter for Invoccultas.
The Our Queen Crumbles team stands with Kickstarter United OPEIU 153.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The biggest risks to Our Queen Crumbles are delays associated with my lack of experience publishing physical versions of my games—namely printing and shipping. To keep this process smooth, I've hired Adam Vass of World Champ Game Co as a consultant for the campaign. He has a ton of experience fulfilling RPG projects, including multiple Kickstarter campaigns last year.

The game text itself is already written and just requires a bit of updating and polish. Most of the post-Kickstarter work is going to be art, layout, printing, and shipping—all of which I am confident I will be able to get done without major issues.

campaign.story:
Dragoon GOLD EDITION Base Game
Dragoon was originally funded on Kickstarter in 2015 with 1,295 backers (who are awesome). Dragoon: The Rogue and Barbarian Expansion was then funded in 2017 with 3,627 backers (who were also awesome people). New to Dragoon? There are a number of videos in the VIDEOS section below that explain the game!
In Dragoon take on the role of fire breathing gold hoarding dragons, dominating and destroying the stupid humans that keep showing up on your island with their precious gold. The Rogue & Barbarian Expansion adds 2 asymmetric characters with their own unique ways of traversing the island and amassing gold. Since then we have expanded the Dragoon story with our latest game Life Siphon, where humans flee the uninhabitable surface in hopes of a curse-free lifestyle in the undoubtedly cursed depths of the mined island. In Might and Magma, exploit the folly of humans that brought about the destruction of the surface and the disturbance of an ancient power that had lain dormant, until now.
Oddly satisfying...

Since the first iteration of Dragoon, we've wanted to do a new map. There have been talks off and on for the past few years, but we are now finally doing it! Introducing The Liquid Gold Map!
Nick Nazzaro really built in some amazing detail in this piece. At 26" x 16" with gold ink and heavy canvas, this is going to be the ultimate Dragoon combination of art and quality.
In order to make this map truly something special, we are working closely with a friend from inside the board game industry, Ross Cowman. We saw his work on The Fall of Magic and knew he was the perfect person to collaborate with.
Images of Ross's game The Fall of Magic. And his face!
Ross is currently working out the best method for our map that will work smoothly with Nick Nazzaro's design. As samples are made, he will provide us with images and video of the process.
All of our games and merch will be available in BackerKit after the campaign ends. Below are all the Dragoon items being offered.
Please check our website before committing to add-ons. You may be able to order the items there and get them now! But if you want to bundle shipping, this Kickstarter is the way to go.
It turns out that the humans mining the cursed depths of impending peril in search of more gold was somehow not a good idea.
As volcanic activity shakes the land, something far worse seems to have awoken amidst the chaos. Now the island’s already most tyrannical are granted strange new powers from an unseen source beneath the island.
THE VOLCANOS
These lava spewing mountains loom with the threat of destruction and the promise of unearthing gold mines.
1. Setup: Place the 2 volcanoes and 2 fault lines in predetermined locations on the map. Shuffle the Lava Flow deck and reveal the top card.
2. Activation: While standing on a dormant volcano or fault line, a free action will activate it and send you home or off the map. This volcano will explode at the end of the round!
3. Destruction: After Tribute, any active volcanoes erupt by placing lava tiles on the map according to the face up lava flow card. Villages and cities covered in lava create gold mines!
4. Gold Mines: Unlike lava that only lasts one round, gold mines stick around until they are mined by a player. Each action spent yields 3 gold with no limit, and are immediately removed after being mined. Make ‘em count!
THE POWER DECK
Every character gains access to this potent source of new abilities.
1. SETUP: Shuffle the power deck and then just let it be, emanating power.
2. Gain power: At the start of your turn draw a power card if you don’t have one already. If you do, then don’t touch it!
3. Use power: Each Power Card costs 1 action to play and results in a range of undisputedly awesome things. All power cards can only be used during your own turn.
The best prices we've ever offered
No Stretch Goals
No Kickstarter Exclusives
No FOMO
What does COMPLETE AT LAUNCH mean? We are offering you the best game at the best price possible from the start. All gameplay elements and anything else that would have been a stretch goal is simply included in the game from day one. Kickstarter Exclusives do not exist on this campaign.
But what if we think of something awesome mid campaign? Or backers make a sweet suggestion? Then we will just give it to you if possible. No stretch goals to reach it. You'll just get an update that says you are getting a cool thing.
But what about sweet Kickstarter Exclusives? We want everyone to enjoy the products we create, and it feels like a punishment for someone to miss out just because they weren't on Kickstarter at the right time. While we might have limited amounts of items, nothing will be available only on Kickstarter.
Lay Waste Games was built by backers and will always be here to serve our customers, regardless of when they found out about us. Pledges and purchases on Kickstarter are a representation of a person's faith in a product and team, and for that, we want to give you the best product always.
Want a quick breakdown of Dragoon? Check out this video of Lay Waste's Jon Ritter on The Dice Tower.
Lay Waste's Jake Given does a great job at breaking down The Rogue and Barbarian Expansion of BoardGameGeek.
For a great overview with some detailed video, Games Off The Shelf did a great job for Dragoon and The Rogue and Barbarian Expansion, including the Box of Holding!
For a longer play video, you should check out theMCGuiRE review's always energetic content.

campaign.story:
UPDATES
we hit the first stretch goal! check out the blog post reward, and let's get to $2,000!
shipping options added for Canada and UK. I got the cheapest option I could that would allow me to ship with cardboard to keep the zine from being bent or damage.
There's nothing there. Not in the shadows beyond the campfire, and not in the closet behind you, and certainly not growing on the ceiling above your head. And even if there was, you wouldn't know what it is, because you have never looked at it.
You can't know what it is. 
DON'T LOOK is a scary-storytelling game where fear keeps you alive. It's a larp for new larpers, a TTRPG off the table, and it's not real. It's just a game. You and your friends are stalked by a malicious entity, and the only way to stay safe is to be afraid—of anything but it. So you tell each other scary stories, and whatever you do, DON'T LOOK.
Here's why you should play this game.
Game Design Experience. Quinn Milton is a larp designer with 9 years of professional game design and facilitation experience. They sit on The Wayfinder Experience's Story Board and co-founded and own Event Horizon LLC. They know good games. 
Approachability. With simple mechanics you can read in 1 minute, this game is ready to be picked-up and played by anyone regardless of experience. Some of the stories come with more guidance, for the teller who wants more structure, and others are simple for those who are comfortable making it up on the fly.
Variety. This game can be played with any horror stories, and is meant to be replayed whenever you have the itch to scare. Down the line, Quinn will release more playable short-stories on itch.io.  
Horror. Being scared is seriously fun, and this game will seriously freak you out. Quinn once wrote an essay on the haunted cinematography of The Haunting (1963) so clearly they are a spook expert.
Safety. This game features a section on consensual play with simple tools to get spooked safely. The Guardian page at the back of the book re-contextualizes fear to help you come down from the experience.
A gorgeous zine.
Quinn is a zinester whose work includes THE POPE IS TRANS, SLUDGE ZINE, and SAD GAY VAMPIRE POEMS. They have shown at NYC Feminist Zine Fest, Bluestockings Comic Fest, and Flame Con, and their works frequently haunt the shelves of Bluestockings Bookstore NYC. 
They're a graphic designer and artist, and know good printing. They have already gotten their bad zine printing out of the way and this one is going to be beautiful. 
B+W pages with spooky text-image manipulation
Haunting art (check out Quinn's art)
Quality design (or their design)
Home-printed and hand-glued cover
The gameplay.
This is a GM-less game that can be played as yourself or optionally as a made-up character. The majority of gameplay is telling short horror stories as improvised adventures, much the way a GM runs a TTRPG. There are no hard mechanics provided for telling the story, but there are suggestions and random tables in case you get stuck.
As your group takes turns telling stories, you are also playing a dangerous game of survival. The rules are simple:
Don't look at the place where it is manifesting, or it will GET YOU.
If you accidentally look, HIDE by covering your eyes and being entirely still and quiet until it stops sniffing at your neck.
If you can't resist looking, there is one way to look that might be safe: look through a mirror, but only for a moment.
If you see anything in the mirror, HIDE.
If you suspect that it has GOTTEN one of your friends, don't look too closely in their eyes, or you might see it there too.
Production
This zine is estimated at 24 pages, but for pricing I've gone with 32 pages in case I go over. Ideally I will print 100 copies, a total production cost of $4.48 / book, but I can also manage 50 copies at $6.25 / book. 
Interior: 32 weight, b+w, 1/2 letter page
Exterior: 65lbs cardstock
Stretch Goal $1,000: art and text-image REACHED!
thanks everyone! check out the stretch goal blog post: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/quinnhpm/dont-look-a-short-horror-rpg/posts/2762583
Stretch Goal $2,000: game design sneak peek
I will show some of the game mechanics and at least one of the four short stories included in the book. see how I break down horror stories into their ingredients and make a map for rules-light storytelling.
Stretch Goal $4,000: three more stories
if we hit $4,000 I'm going to design three more stories to tell, which will be included in the digital PDF for all backers.
at $8,000: I will have to come up with another stretch goal idea, I mean, that's more than 13x my funding goal, it's a shot in the dark........ UNLESS?

hi everyone!
to be honest, pandemic-adjustment has tanked my productivity time, so I have less done than I'd hoped. I hope that's understandable. still, I've got a draft of two of the tales and have run one play test, so we're still moving along.
partially through a project I usually have a time where I doubt the decisions I've made and the direction I'm going, which in this case has been the design challenge of making a game that is easy to pick-up-and-play, but also has that interactive storytelling aspect we love from ttrpgs. "are people even going to be able to play this?" "what if this isn't the perfect mangnum opus that all my works need to be" and other such nonsense has gotten in the way.

hi everyone,
it's been a weird few weeks. I hope everyone is staying healthy and making responsible decisions to socially distance and quarantine as able. 
I'm bunkered down in my new house and finally ready to return to this project. I am still anticipating that zines (and short story) will be sent out in May, but the PDF version of the game will not be available until late April earliest. -cracks knuckles- time to wrestle this draft!

it's perfectly safe to open your eyes, and you're definitely not cursed!
...at least until you have the game in your hands. then, you might want to be more careful.
I'm so grateful for all of the support for this horror game-zine. thank you for pledging and sharing, it really means a lot to me. I've been sick the past week but once I'm in fighting form I'm excited to finish the text and get to production. I'll be quiet for at least a few weeks, as I'm moving across the city, and it's also my birthday in march (on the 15th); an all around busy month.

alright cursed ones—you have forced my hand into creating this stretch goal content and now you better enjoy it! (seriously, thank you everyone for backing and sharing this project!) this post is fairly self-indulgent, so if you're not in the mood for that just enjoy the strange images!
the core of DON’T LOOK is trying not to see, or think, about the danger in the room. so I knew immediately that the game would involve strikethrough or damaged text, which should not be read aloud.

you funded DON'T LOOK in 7 hours.
thank you all so much for helping me bring this zine to reality! I created a reasonable funding goal, so I was fairly confident we could reach it, but I never expected us to get there so quickly. thank you, thank you, thank you.

campaign.story:
The Evils of Illmire: A Mini-Mega Hexcrawl Adventure Zine is a 68-page dark fantasy adventure for 4-6 player characters level 1-3. Built for OSR Systems. Bonus compatibility for Dungeon World, 5E, and SS&SS!
Spellsword is now on YouTube! Subscribe now to get sneak previews of the creation and progress of The Evils of Illmire.
My favorite types of adventure modules have always been the ones that provide not just a central plot, but also robust peripheral content to surround it. Adventurers will probably get involved in the main quest, but there are a lot of other things to keep them busy in the nearby areas too. Interesting creatures, locales, dungeons, and treasures abound in these types of modules. PCs are free to explore and meddle in a sandbox environment with many interactive parts. This is an attempt to capture that and mash it down into a digestible zine format that is actually useful and inspires the Game Master.
Project Roots: The core concept and bulk of the ideas come from a classic 2nd Edition campaign I ran in the summer of 1997. I've since then revisited the content and added a number of other points of interest to create an adventure region stocked with dungeons, monsters, and treasures, all with an underlying sandbox plot that doesn't railroad. Traps are vicious and brutal. Adventurers will find classic +1 swords alongside a myriad of weird and interesting artifacts hidden in dangerous spots around the map. They'll clash with and flee from familiar monsters and a bunch of new creepy things.
Art © Stinky Goblin Emporium 2020
Adventure Synopsis: A cult has begun to infiltrate to town of Illmire, spreading paranoia and terrorizing the locals with fear-mongering in order to feed their demonic idol. The cult worships an extra dimensional demon they found in some ruins in the nearby swamp. Lured by mysterious rumors of treasure out in the wilds, adventurers face an uphill battle against organized and fanatical zealots lead by vile, sorcerous clerics. They'll stop at nothing to further their diabolical schemes, and the people of Illmire will be crushed beneath their boot as they launch a campaign of torment and terror that will spread far beyond Illmire unless put to a stop.
Art © Stinky Goblin Emporium 2020
Product Features: This will be a 64-page zine, A5 format (5.5x8.5). It will contain a small hexcrawl with 19 distinct hexes, each with details and a wandering monster table. There is a map of the town of Illmire, as well as 15 detailed, one-page locations/dungeons. In addition, there is a bestiary for the adventure featuring some new monsters for adventurers to fight or run from. There is a simple weather system (so easy you'll actually want to use it!) to determine which hexes are experiencing rain, thunderstorms, floods, mudslides, blizzards, etc. There's awesome black & white artwork to help inspire terror. It's laid out in professional, clear, concise format meant to be quick and easy to use on game night.
Artwork: The pages are graced with evocative artwork from Jack Badashski and Heather Shinn (Stinky Goblin Emporium). There is wicked cover art and a custom hex map that will be provided by Patrik Olsson. The dungeon cartography is by legendary mapper Dyson Logos. We've also brought on the illustrator known as HodagRPG as a spot artist for the character sheet, player handouts, and other neat little visual things that come with all pledge levels.
Cover art not finalized and may change
Shipping
Shipping is not included. You'll pay for shipping separately later. When the zine is ready to start shipping (estimated mid-April), we'll provide a coupon code for 100% off when you place your order, so you'll only pay for the shipping at that time. 
Estimated shipping costs:
US: $4.00
Canada: $12.00
Everywhere Else: $16.00+

STRETCH GOALS
We've hit our funding goal and went right on past it! Let's make this thing even more awesome! 
 We hit $1000 in funding! We will have the hex map re-drawn by a talented artist to give it even more life and personality.
 We hit $1200 in funding! The booklet will gain a high quality, heavy stock cover with some truly wicked artwork that will make it look great in your zine stack.
 We hit $1400 in funding! The product will include a printable, hand-drawn OSR character sheet PDF to use with your Evils of Illmire campaign.
 We hit $1600 in funding! Evils of Illmire now includes a digital PDF guidebook you can print out to hand to your players as an introduction to Illmire. This'll be great for on-boarding adventurers and getting them in the right mindset (excited and terrified at the same time). 
 We hit $1800! I'll add an optional second set of 4-panels to go inside of the Adventure's Guide, making it a total of 8 panels.
 We hit $2000! I'll add Module Reference GM Screen panels! The digital package will contain PDF files to print for use as inserts in the DriveThruRPG customizable GM screen. If you don't have one of these screens, no worries; just paper-clip the printed panels to an existing GM screen. 
 We hit $2200! I'll add a second side to the custom character sheet to include extra space for notes and tracking conditions for your poor, poor adventurers.
 We hit $2500! I'll now add 4 additional pages to the 64-page zine; this means it'll be a 68-page zine. Three of these pages will be added to the Gazeteer of Illmire and will cover unique flora and fauna of the region; a few may be dangerous enough to warrant combat stats, but most will be either interesting to encounter or useful in some way. The final page will be a guide to crafting items using ingredients harvested from said flora and fauna.
 We hit $3000! Amazing! We'll now include pre-made characters so you can hop right into a game or hand them out as quick replacements for fallen adventurers. Prefer to make your own characters? Me too; use these guys as possible hirelings or a rival adventuring party!
 We $3500! The module will gain a separate expansion PDF that adds an Underdark area, including another dungeon! 
 We hit $4000! I'll keep adding more art to make this zine gorgeous!
NEW STRETCH GOAL! Subscribe to the new Spellsword YouTube channel to unlock Sharp Swords & Sinister Spells, plus an interview with Diogo "Old Skull" Nogueira! We need 100 subscribers to become an 'official' YouTube channel.
Want some treasure? Art © Stinky Goblin Emporium 2020
 CONTENTS AND PROGRESS
 Introduction: A general explanation of the adventure background, state of affairs, and guide to how PCs can fight against the cult. Completed. 
 Hex Map of Illmire: A hexmap featuring 19 distinct hexes, each with a brief description. Also includes simple weather system and hexcrawl suggestions. Hex map to be recreated as stretch goal, otherwise completed. 
 Gazetteer of Illmire: Detailed descriptions of the geography and features of each of area of the map.
 Town Map: A map of the town of Illmire, including a key describing the inhabitants of the town and their current status regarding cult operations, plus suggestions of what might happen if the cult is not stopped. Completed. 
 Inn of the Weary Wagoner: An old caravan way-stop that's been infiltrated and taken over by the cult. Includes a map of both floors and the cellars, with keyed locations and details. Completed. 
 Defiled Temple of the Luminal Star: What should be a holy temple dedicated to the lawful gods of humankind has been secretly ransacked and desecrated by the nightmare cult. Map with keyed locations. Completed. 
 Rancidius the Fearmonger and the Fearspawn: Detailed descriptions and images of one of the cult's wicked leaders, and the boss monster of the Defiled Temple. Completed. 
 Gecko Pit and the Buried Bastion: One of the side-content dungeons. Adventurers may be lured here by rumors of a castle lost below the swamp containing treasures. Also home to lots of hungry giant geckos. Map and key. Completed. 
 The Webbed Hollows: Another side dungeon, this one filled with giant arachnids, huge flying insects, an intelligent spider gone crazy, and sneaky ettercaps that hide in orb-weaver sacks. Map and key. Completed. 
 Abandoned Copperclaw Mines: Adventurers investigating the cult may find themselves checking out the local mines. What they find is another terrible echo of the cult's influence. Here they've slain the miners and have begun to build a small army of zombies. Map and key. Partially completed. 
 Illmire Bandit Stronghold: What started as a minor clan of highwaymen has grown stronger and more bold now that they are taking orders from the cult. They are tasked with kidnapping travelers to be used as sacrifice victims. Map and key. Completed. 
 Mound of the Mantis Men: Out on the bogs is a huge mound built by a swarm of vicious praying mantis people. They march over the swamps, hunting geckos, froglings, stirges, and the occasional trapper who didn't watch their back. Map and key. Completed. 
 Gribblet Village and the Froglings: Where the Illmire Bogs meet the Redthorn Forest, a village of treefrog people have built a hidden home in the canopies of the great wood. They harbor a potential ally for adventurers, but struggle with attacks from the neighboring mantis mound. Description and artwork. Partially complete. 
 Forgotten Crypt of the Worm Eaters: Hidden in the woods are a series of burial mounds built by a long forgotten people who inhabited the forest. One such mound is still accessible but lousy with undead. Map and key. Incomplete. 
 Sunken Grottoes of the Fish Folk: Under the murky waters of Misty Lake, a reclusive group of fish men lair inside underwater caves. Something has been driving them to attack the local logging camp. Map and key. Partially complete. 
 Prison Vault of the Demon Warlords: Legend says that centuries ago a pair of evil demons who ravaged these lands were imprisoned in a magical vault at the peak of the Klepperhorn, a giant and iconic mountain peak that looms over the King's Highway. Map and key. Completed. 
 Ezrikaar and Eshraea: These two otherworldly fighters were summoned by a terrible sorcereress long ago to fight her enemies. The forces aligned against her used powerful magics to ensnare them and hold them in a remote vault. There they've waited for hundreds of years to be released. Artwork and descriptions. Completed. 
 Crystalline Palace of the Mountain King: A boisterous mountain giant and his harem of hill giant slaves live in a grand castle built into the mountainside, complete with gardens of massive gypsum crystals. He's way more interested in challenging the adventurers with riddles and quests to test their heroism than he is with fighting. Map and key. Completed. 
 The Fungal Caverns: These caverns are full of myconids and shrieker mushrooms. The cultists have built a small workshop here where they produce potions of fear from juice rung from slain shriekers. Map and key.  Partially complete. 
 Cursed Fortress of the Lava Dwarfs: Once a great stronghold of dwarfs built into the mountain, their king became insane and obsessed with controlling the lava. He summoned a fire elemental he couldn't control. It turned him and his dwarf citizens into lava elementals as a punishment. Map and key. Partially complete. 
 Lava Dwarfs and The Lava Lord: Descriptions of the lava dwarfs and their special qualities, as well as the Lava Lord. Artwork and descriptions. Completed. 
 The Observer's Tower: A grand tower of ashen alabaster bursts through the trees and stretches high above the canopy. It's topped with a strange ocular apparatus. It is the legendary home of a mysterious sorcerer. There is more here than meets the eye... Map and key. Incomplete. 
 The Observer, Silent Watchers, and Chimera Goblins: These creatures will be found in The Observer's Tower. Adventurers will soon find that the famed sorcerer may not even be human as assumed! Also details about his loyal servants, as well as the deformed, mutant results of experimental dabbling with goblins. Artwork and descriptions. Partially complete. 
 Lair of the Nightmare Cult: The cultists of Illmire make their hidden den here. In a pool blackened by the blood of sacrifices, the fearmother lurks and feeds. This is a dire enemy; adventurers will need to bolster their strength before attempting an assault. Map and key. Completed. 
 Virica the Vile and the Fearmother: Twin sister to Rancidius, Virica is the other half of leadership for the cult. She personally tends to the wicked fearmother. Descriptions and artwork. Completed. 
 Compendium: Several pages at the back are dedicated to the bestiary, treasure descriptions, rumors (some true, some false), ominous fortune-teller sayings, and other neat random tables. Now includes Dungeon World and D&D 5th Edition monsters and stats. Partially complete. 
 Compatibility Guide: We've added support for Dungeon World and D&D 5th Edition. There will be some tips and guidelines for running the adventure in those systems. Incomplete. 
 Player Handouts: Various imagery, descriptive elements, in-game paper props, and other useful ephemera to hand out to your players. Partially complete.
Whew! That's a lot of bullet points!
Future sushi, care of adventurers. Art © Stinky Goblin Emporium 2020

campaign.story: Thank you for your interest in the first ever SECOND issue of WIZARD FUNK.  You see, there once was a bunch of games published by a small company in Lake Geneva, WI.   Those games were freaking awesome.  Nothing ever needed to be changed about them.  However, time passed.  High level business-folk became bored with not making more money.  So they encouraged role play game players to cast off the old and spend their bucks on the new.  Time passed again.  People went off to college, married, and/or got careers and stuff.  Then they had mouths to feed and bills to pay.  Then a few of us started getting old and pulled those old games out and started playing them again.  That's my story and I'm sticking with it.  If you buy this fanzine from me, then thanks for your dollars and I hope you like all 34 pages of good times.  Sincerely, the Dice Bro.

campaign.story:
It’s the end of the world. It always rains. Rain beats against the walls. It seeps through the shutters. It pours off the mossy backs of the gargoyles. It turns streets into streams and rivers.
Teetering, damp towers lean against rotting townhouses thrown together in the ruins of a once gleaming city. Servants dash through storms on petty errands. Fireplaces sputter weakly, and spellbooks filled with moldy spells rot in spite of the protections lavished on them for their precious contents.
A VISITOR'S GUIDE TO THE RAINY CITY is a system-agnostic RPG zine offering a complete setting playset and toolkit for GMs and players alike to mine for your own games and campaign settings or drop into a campaign as is. Spice up your roleplaying with the weirdness, whimsy, and wickedness of the Rainy City - a doomed fantasy metropolis at the end of the world - where the wizards jealously guard their rotting magical tomes, the gargoyles are always watching, the thieves are on the prowl, and the rains never stop.
As a GM Playset & Toolkit
The VISITOR'S GUIDE is designed for busy GMs to mine for your own games and campaigns. Need a flavorful but dour neighborhood to drop into a city you're prepping? Then use the paranoid and cult-infested Levee Town. Need a strange NPC wizard for players to sell their ill-gotten loot to? Oculam the Oracular is your wizard; he already saw you coming! Need a weird urban location to toss in front of your players? Then look no further because Vengus Ult's Mushroom Library has just sprouted up in Old Town. Need a colorful folktale to flesh out your local village? Then Ware the Winder Man, who comes every Mid-Winder Night to enter your home and steal your breath. 
Break the VISITOR'S GUIDE down, mine it for gems, and use them as your own.  
As a Whole Setting
GMs can also use the VISITOR’S GUIDE as a complete, interconnected setting. The Rainy City can be dropped into the oceans of nearly any fantasy world, be found on the edges of the Elemental Plane of Water, or used as we use it -- as the last city left, where everyone and everything eventually washes up as world after world is destroyed by flood. Maybe it’s a place your regular characters pass through on their adventures. Maybe it’s a sort of Bermuda Triangle where they get stuck, for a while. Maybe it’s a pocket universe, maybe a dream, or even some sort of hell. If you can think of a use for a magic rich, rain-soaked city with an Age of Sail flavor that could house any sort of fantasy, you can drop the Rainy City into your campaign.
Take it, pair it with your favorite game, and make it your own. 
The Wizards of the Rainy City - sometimes mysterious, often menacing, but always weird!
Influences and Look
The Rainy City is the brainchild of Rich Forest, who has been thinking about, developing, and running game sessions in the Rainy City for more than fifteen years now. This is a passion project for Rich, and it shows in the vibrant and evocative details inherent in the Rainy City as a setting and playset.
The setting's influences are varied. The influence of Jack Vance’s Dying Earth books is obvious in the wizards, and we hope some of Pratchett’s warmth and good humor can be found as well. Many touches inspired by folklore (especially folklore of the sea), the history of great cities (especially London, which has a lot written about it in English), and history and fiction about piracy and the Age of Sail have informed the place. Every game system it has been used with has left its mark, from Big Eyes, Small Mouth, to classic D&D, The Fantasy Trip, Castle Falkenstein, Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay, Mythras, and 5th edition.  
The look of the zine evokes the style of an early modern European pamphlet. As such, we're using Fell Type fonts throughout, and the interior art by Bill Spytma is in a style he's developed that emulates the kind of woodcut art you can see in those old pamphlets. 
For a doomed city at the end of the world, the Rainy City is a vibrant, alive, and, well, weird place.
What's in the Zine?
What’s included in the zine? Detailed descriptions, notable NPCs, evocative locations, and capsule adventure hooks for:
 The Eight Main Districts of the City: Vagabond Bay, Old Town, Levee Town, The Sump, The Mids, Embassy Row, The Headlands, and The Tower Cliffs (with Maps!)
   The Peoples of the Rainy City, detailing some of the more exotic denizens of the city, such as Gargoyles, Ghouls, Gulls, Larvae, Mine Goblins, Mermaids, Ratkins, and Sump Boggies
   The Pirates of the Rainy City, including their floating pirate haven of Rickety
   The Guilds of the Rainy City, including spotlight focus on The Alchemists Guild, The Society of Thatch, and The Molten Men
   The Four Seasons of the Rainy City: The Rainy Season, The Windy Season, The Quiet, and Firelight, plus the traditions, customs, and holidays associated with each.
   The Wizards & Witches of the Rainy City, spotlighting such notables as Iambic Pentacular, whose watery double haunts the city; Antigone Graves, the VVitch of VVending Street; Hyperion the Hated; Oculam the Oracular; the Kandive, Agar Yaminnu; and the ever-changing and unchanging Sandestin.
   The Patrons of the Rainy City, powerful and notable people in the city who need something and need divers, adventurers, and renovator to get it for them
   The Gangs of the Rainy City, who prowl the flooded streets of the city carousing and causing trouble
And much more! 
Bonus Stretch Goal — Reached!!
The campaign also now includes a single stretch goal (the only one we will have). Upon reaching the $2000 funding level (which we did!), we will include for free a 11x17, quarter-folded poster of the Rainy City map for all backers at the Citizen reward tier! So not only will you get a map in the center of the zine, but if we reach this goal, we'll give you another one double the size to gaze at lovingly and plot out your Rainy City fun.
Map of the Rainy City - which will be the centerfold of the zine!
The finished zine will be a 56-page, 5 ½ x 8 ½, saddle-stitched booklet, printed w/ black ink. Interior pages will be on a beautiful ivory color (Cougar Natural), while the cover will be a heavyweight stock (in Haviland Blue). As writing and layout finishes up, the final page count could change. 
Haviland Blue Print Test - Not Final, but getting there
Cougar Natural Print Test - Not Final
Cougar Natural Print Test - Not Final
If you'd like to see a sample of the zine's content, we have posted sample previews on our website of Vagabond Bay and Tower Cliffs. Go check them out!
Physical copies will be mailed in a sufficiently-rigid cardboard mailer through the USPS for US residents only (shipping is free). Digital fulfillment will be through DriveThruRPG. If there is sufficient international interest, we can certainly explore print on demand through DriveThruRPG as well. 
Back Cover Mock Up - Not Final
Once we have successfully funded, we will push forward with completing the project on the following schedule:
 March/April: Finish Writing & Development, Final Art Pieces
   May/June: Finish Editing, Proofreading, and Layout
   July: Printing & Shipping
  The Writer
Rich Forest really likes roleplaying games. He likes other things, too (stouts and porters, whisky, grilling, trail running, very snowy winters, and very rainy days), but, come on, roleplaying games! He spent much of his twenties and early thirties living outside the US (Germany, Japan, Hong Kong, and England), but he’s settled in back home in mid-Michigan now with the love of his life and four children, a dog, and a rabbit. In his spare time, he’s an English professor at Central Michigan University, where he mostly teaches linguistics. This one time, he wrote a whole book just about nouns.
The Artist
Bill Spytma is an illustrator, writer, painter, sculpter, carver and crafter. He’s also an amateur folklorist chasing after Black Dogs and an armchair historian staying up late at night gazing into Odin’s one good eye. He enjoys roleplaying games, funny costumes, sword fighting, and cold, snowy weather.
The Mapmaker and Editor
Andrew Devenney’s first exposure to roleplaying games was the Moldvay Basic D&D set, which he used to make an elf named Luke (after Skywalker, of course) when he was the ripe old age of six years old. To say he was hooked after that is a bit of an understatement. Married with spawn that looks eerily just like him at their ages, he currently resides in scintillating Mount Pleasant, Michigan, where he occasionally teaches students about stuff at Central Michigan University. Because he doesn’t have enough to do, Andrew also co-writes and produces historical documentaries through his company, Stratigraphic Productions. He wears many hats. What’s one more?
The Company
We founded Superhero Necromancer Games so that we could produce the kinds of games and settings we enjoy playing. And A VISITOR'S GUIDE TO THE RAINY CITY is the first step in a whole slate of rpg books we'd love to make for you all. For updates on anything else we plan in the future, sign up for our mailing list. Or follow us on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the first Kickstarter for us as a company (and the first for each of us individually as well), but we have researched RPG Kickstarters of varying sorts over the years, noting best practices and listening to advice from more experienced hands at crowdfunding campaigns.

We have also made a number of choices with this project that should help minimize any delays or difficulties with fulfillment:

1) All work for the VISITOR’S GUIDE is being done in house by us (that means, writing, editing, layout, and art), so there are no potential delays due to external collaborators;

2) Work on the zine is in progress right now, with several sections already written, edited, and in early layout, cartography finished, and many art assets completed;

3) We have kept the project simple, with no stretch goals (well, one stretch goal!) and only three basic reward tiers. The funding goal of the campaign is basically needed to cover the cost of printing a small print run of the zines and mailing out physical copies to backers; and

4) We are working with a local printer, so that any quality control or delivery issues can be quickly managed and costs kept as low as possible.

Life can come at you fast, but we feel that, with the limited scope of the project, the work already finished, and the steps we’ve taken not to bloat the project beyond our capabilities, we have done what we need to do to mitigate the effect of any unforeseen delays.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Ah, the humble street food vendor. 
How often you play a key role in our hearts (and arteries) and yet how rarely we really get to know you beyond exchanged coin and dipping meat juices. The likes of Cut Me Own Throat Dibbler of Discworld, Turkey and Goosehead of The God of Cookery, Mr. Kim from Fifth Element, Rao Tsur of Gone Away World, The White Dragon Noodle Bar from Bladerunner, and the myriad stinking stalls that populate the streets of Throne in Kill Six Billion Demon. These places and people immediately add personality, possibility and food poisoning to any scenario. Be it a one eyed hunchback selling questionable sausages or be it a manic cleaver twirling woman making “Assorted Noodles,” these are the people who know the pulse and stomachs of the locals best and any wise adventurer knows that sometimes it is worth risking a tapeworm (or two) to get to know these people.
Gourmet Street is a setting that can be plopped directly into any world or adventure and serves up an extra side of gonzo fantasy. Populated with street vendors serving every possible food you can conceive as well as a fascinating accoutrement of  culinary artifacts, edible monsters, and bizarre dishes.
However, under the greasy facade of delectable dishes, a war is brewing.  Food-factions wage secret war in the smokey shadows and slippery alleys, vying for power and struggling to make their own culinary manifestos the main dish of Gourmet Street.
 A New Setting! - Gourmet Street, a collection of scattered and bizarrely connected alleyways, it seems to pop up in any settlement large enough to begin thinking of itself as a city. Stacked high in wood carts, laid out on intricate rugs, swimming in a myriad of sauces, food is the name of the game on Gourmet Street.
 ONE MILLION Food Vendors and Menus! - Never eat the same thing twice! Generate from 8,000 possible unique food vendors and LITERALLY ONE MILLION possible dishes; ranging from Soft-shelled Crabman Sandwiches with Tzatziki sauce and Egg Coffee, to Myconid Zapiekanka in Pesto with a shot of Absinthe! 
 Food Factions! - From the hyper-radical (and slightly deranged) Neuvo Gastro-Alchemists, to the fanatical and militant Vinegar Knights, the food factions each come with their own wants, goals, and boons, IF you choose to serve them...
 A One-Page Adventure: ESCAPE FROM GOURMET STREET! Help a pair (or trio) of star-crossed lovers escape from Gourmet Street in a Snake-and-Ladders inspired chase! Fend off rival lovers, food cart brawls and escaped dishes as you dash through the alleys of Gourmet Street!
 And More! Monsters, magic items, and cookbooks for both Players and GMs to use and abuse!


Hello all! My name is John Gregory, better known among y'all as TheLawfulNeutral of the UnlawfulGames blog. I have a keen and driving interest to bring weird and wonderful inspirations from the world around me to the RPG world. From tables galore to creatures aplenty, I try to create an air of delightful whimsy to everything I do. Last year I brought you inspirations from my childhood home with Lowcountry Crawl. For my inaugural Zinequest project, I am happy to present Gourmet Street, fueled by my long time love of cooking, culture, and the characters who make it real.  
 Heyo! Name's Charlie Ferguson-Avery, an illustrator based out of rural Pennsylvania. I'm a lover of food and cooking, especially cheap and accessible street food. Currently I'm the lead artist for World War Occult and creator of Into the Wyrd and Wild. While I'm currently operating under the label: "that guy who does all of the sad and scary illustrations," I'm very much a fan of gonzo, whimsy and levity; especially in role-playing games. With any luck, I'll get to do some more whimsical and fun art (in addition to my scary-sad stuff)!

campaign.story:
Dirty Town is a cooperative diceless RPG about the corny adventures of Pigeons. Get ready to negotiate with your fellow sparrows, deal with nasty rats, angry cats, evil seagulls and face many more dangers in Dirty Town !
Have you ever wondered what your favourite movie's storyline would be like if the main characters were Pigeons? Of course not, but don't be corny about it. Imagine you could transform The Lords of the Rings into The Feathership of the Wing and play as a Flock of Pigeons travelling throughout Birdgard (which is actually Dirty Town) to destroy The Feather. AMAIZEing, right!?
Dirty Town was born as part of a challenge to create 5 roleplaying games that use unusual objects, instead of dice. This is our first game of the challenge and we are eager to share it with you as a zine! 
Dirty Town Zine
Dirty Town Zine mock-up


 Corny Adventures Zine
Corny Adventures Zine mock-up

Like most of our games, Dirty Town is minimalistic in its essence. Instead of dice you will be playing with corn kernels. 
It uses the Corny System which can be explained in three simple steps:
The Dovecote Master (DM) describes the challenge and players describe what their Pigeon Characters (PCs) do. The DM sets the Adversity Cup (AC) according to the Difficulty Table. The difficulty depends on what actions the PCs choose to take. 
Players make hidden bets using the corn kernels from their stash. This is where the mind-games start as there are always consequences for the PC of the lowest bidder, and rewards for the highest one. The players' corn kernel are a limited resource and thus, the PCs must spend them wisely. 
All bets are revealed at the same time. The corn kernels are summed and the DM reveals the AC. If the corn kernel sum is equal or higher than the AC, the challenge is overcome. Otherwise, consequences are due - either Cornditions are applied or toes are lost forever. 
The game also has abilities and items which add a new layer of mechanics and interactions. For example, the Pherlock Croomes ability lets a single player see the Adversity Cup but must keep that precious information to themselves, Glass Eye item removes the pierced eye condition from a PC, etc.
Prototypes of some Abilities, design not final
 The Character Sheet 
A5 Character sheet prototype
 Name: Your PC name.
 Flock: The group's name.
 A standard pigeon illustration:  Where you can draw an aMAIZEing feature.
 Cornditions: Conditions that have their own narrative and mechanical effects. 
 4 Toes: Simply speaking, these are your Hit Points. 
 Bonds: To define your relationship with other PCs.
 Ability & Item slots: To tune up your Pigeon, croom, croom!

The Adventure Template
Adventure Template prototype
Dirty Town is designed to work better as a one-shot adventure game, but it also prepared to fit a campaign-style gameplay.
The adventures are built based on movie storylines. For that we created an Adventure Template with a challenge structure inspired on the Hero's Journey story arch. You will be able to create your own adventures in Dirty Town.
Every backer, regardless of the value they contribute with, will get our crootitude and have their name written, in the digital version of the zine, as a member of the flock. There are 5 pledge levels to choose from:
 £1 Croo Crew: Our thanks for supporting the campaign


 £4 PDF Only: Get the digital version of Dirty Town.


 £10 Print + PDF Bundle: Get the print and digital versions of Dirty Town along with the digital version of Corny Adventures as well as any unlocked digital stretch goal. 


 £25 Doveluxe Edition: Get the print and digital versions of both Dirty Town and Corny Adventures, along with 1 Feather (which indicates who's the first player to bet), 5 Dirty Town cups and around 100 handmade corn kernel tokens as well as any unlocked digital and physical stretch goals. 


 £75 Cooricature Yourself: Everything from the pledge tier above along with a custom A6 pigeon portrait of yourself as well as any unlocked digital and physical stretch goals. 


Handmade corn kernel tokens in polymer clay
Dirty Town Cup mock-up
So you want to make your pledge cornier? Here are some add-ons you can add to your pledge:
 £4 Corny Adventures volume 1 & 2 PDF
 £2 Cereal Killerz PDF (if unlocked) 
 £6 Dirty Town in Print
 £6 Corny Adventures volume 1 & 2 in Print
 £2 DM Screen + Dirty Town Map in Print (UNLOCKED!) 
 £3 Cereal Killerz in Print (if unlocked)  
 £15 A set of physical components (handmade corn kernel tokens, dirty town cups, feather) 
You just need to add the amount to your pledge and you'll be able to select the rewards in Backerkit after the campaign ends. For example, if you want to a Digital Only pledge, just add £4 to add Corny Adventures volume 1 & 2 PDF to your PDF Only pledge tier. If you want a Print Bundle, add £6 to add Corny Adventures volume 1 & 2 in Print to your Print + PDF Bundle, and so on.
Please consider that shipping might be higher - We'll do our best to keep the shipping cost within the estimated.
We've got some really dirty stretch goals for this project! Since this is our first project we've opted for simple yet realistic goals to make sure we are able to deliver everything on time without overburdening ourselves. 
Dirty Town is Funded, in both print and PDF forms! At this stage, most of the profits from the Kickstarter go towards paying for our writing and illustrating and to pay for the handmade corn kernel tokens and Dirty Town cups.
We will create a 3rd ZINE. The Corny Adventures volume 2 will add 10 new experiences. As a member of the flock you will be able to vote on your favorite ones.
This second goal ensures that every adventure will have its own corny illustration. We'll also produce a Dirty Town main theme track in digital format.
What's a game without a Dovecote Master Screen? We'll be making a trifold A4 DM Screen with useful information and a folded A4 Map of Dirty Town filled awesome locations. 
Reaching this goal gives us the opportunity to produce a full Soundtrack in digital format, for your Dirty Town games. This soundtrack will include 4 more tracks with the following themes: Action, Adventure, Horror and Mystery. 
A FLOCKING 4th ZINE? Yes, you read it right. We'll be making the "Cereal Killerz" Zine with the same specifications as Dirty Town. It will contain extra corny information for the creatures of Dirty Town, new items, examples of notorious enemies and new consequences/rewards for Pigeon Characters.
You really think we'll be reaching this? Ok...IN CASE we SOMEHOW reach this IMPOSSIBLE starch goal, we will record a Dirty Town liveplay with local RPG designers and make one video of us trying to actually catch Pigeons*. Until this goal is met, the additional funding will go towards making the whole product as inKERNELible as possible. 
*No Pigeons will be harmed in the making of this video. As for ourselves, we are not so sure...
We are two portuguese bestfriends (and their loved ones) that met and bonded playing the beautiful Fall of Magic roleplaying game and decided to work together doing what we love. We create give others the opportunity to gather and develop friendships, like ours <3
Maré Baixa (Low Tide) was created in memory of our Fall of Magic characters River and Piccolo. Together they sacrificed themselves to save the magic of the world. Check our games over at Itch.io.
GAME DESIGN & WRITTING: André Tavares is a 3D character animator. He's a producer and content creator at the Rola Iniciativa platform, being his most notorious show being Roll for Diplomacy where André has interviewed RPG designers such as Adam Koebel, Luke Crane, John Harper and the Bakers. André is also the founder of Rolisboa, the Portuguese RPG convention, and ultimately he gives the best hugs. Check his twitter for some RPG love.
GAME DESIGN & ILLUSTRATION: Carlos Martins is a father of a beautiful young boy, a member of CES board-gamers club and a talented illustrator that works very close to Portuguese RPG designers. He is responsible for the illustrations in all of Maré Baixa's games as well as the Major Icons in Terra Adentro, the Portuguese Dungeon World, and the illustrations of many monsters for the D&D Portuguese Bestiary supplement still in the making. Check out his art at Artstation.
HANDMADE: Vanessa Góis is a pigeon lover and the number 1 fan of Dirty Town (even before the game had been given its name). She's a teacher and handmade artisan working on polymer clay sculpting. With her help we'll be able to create high quality handmade tokens. 
FULFILLMENT: Bárbara Crespo is a delivery service Manager and handmade Artisan. She has been running her own business Artifanhas on Etsy for over 5 years where she creates Handmade Nursery, Home & Party decor. With her help we'll make sure that the packaging and shipping process runs smoothly.
Shipping
Shipping fees are not included as part of your Kickstarter pledge. Shipping will be calculated and collected via BackerKit after the campaign ends.
Package prototype
We will be shipping the rewards as cheap as it can get. The doveluxe and cooricature pledge tiers will be shipped by Registered Mail with insurance.

For the cooricature or dovecote edition: €6-8
Estimated shipping outside the EU:
For a single print copy: $3-4 USD
For the cooricature or dovecote edition: $8-10

 Thank you for reading and have a nice day! Croo croo!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter, but not our first time designing a game. We'll do our best to mitigate as many risks as possible and we are confident in our ability to make this happen. 

We work very closely with our local community and the game is already being extensively playtested to find the magic numbers so it all works out perfectly. 

We've worked with national printers before and they've always delivered to specification and on time. We are also working with Bárbara, she is very experienced in packing & posting the rewards, as she regularly sends items every week. We'll make sure to get some extra copies printed in case any get lost in the mail.

We've set the estimated delivery date to October due to this being our first campaign. We're optimistic that we can finish it quite sooner than that.

All backers will receive regular updates and be notified if any difficulties or delays arise over the course of production, although the only real risks to this project are unforeseen personal events affecting both of us. That's why working in a team is so awesome. 

Thank you for reading. 
Hugs <3

campaign.story:
Before Starting:
Kickstarter's employees are currently in an ongoing fight for unionization. Kickstarter United has not called for any direct action or boycotting of Kickstarter's services as of now. It is important to put their cause front and center and acknowledge their efforts to receive recognition from the company.
This campaign stands with Kickstarter United's ongoing fight for unionization. For more info, head to their website or follow them on twitter.
 You are all Goblins, congratulations! 
You are also all barreling through space in a ship made of junk and scrap, how lucky! Your goal: to make it to Junktopia, the rogue planet in the middle of space, a utopia for the Goblins, with your ship intact and as much Junk as you can to further its beauty!
Space Goblins! is a HIGH CHAOS AND TRULY OUTRAGEOUS RPG meant for 2-5 players with rotating referee play and an emphasis on wild Goblin-created mayhem!
The Game!
Using Nate Treme's Tunnel Goons as a base, Space Goblins! has a simple and easy character creation and resolution mechanic for "anything goes, describe and roll" storytelling and gameplay! A uniquely designed-by-me rotating referee and clearly defined phases of play make for an easy game to pick up and learn-through-play as well as a great way to get everyone involved! From goblins new to RPGs, new to being a referee, or veterans of all types, Space Goblins! is a great place to mess around and share a good time with others! It's also great for children!
Space Goblins! is encouraged and compatible with Legos or any other interlocking plastic building block collection as your Junk collection, collaboratively and physically building up and breaking down your Junk Ship as you play! Each session have fun creating a unique ship which you can hold in your hands and play with! Break it down after you're done or keep it as a reminder of your amazing and wonderful journey to Junktopia! Other amazing features include:
Create Goblins that embody the most Goblin of stats: Scrapper, Tinkerer, Rascal, and Rude! 
Collaboratively create your Junkship that embodies the most Goblin of design elements: Rough, Tough, Scoot, and Shoot! 
Roll an unnecessary amount of d8s together to figure out what ship you crash into when looking for Junk!
 Set Game Length of 3-5-8 rounds allows you to play a short campaign of Space Goblins! sessions, troupe style play throughout several journeys to Juntktopia, or a very quick and fun one shot!
Why Kickstart?
I'm choosing to take Space Goblins! to Kickstarter so that I can properly finish up this game and polish it to a state I'm proud of. Space Goblins! as a game has been done since I released it last year, and it has received many playtests and small QOL updates. 
The $1800 I am asking for with this campaign is to bring Space Goblins! to print as well as to hire other collaborators to illustrate, layout, and edit my words that are currently just text in a PDF. Most of the budget is going towards paying all involved in the project (seen below) fair wages. The rest is going towards the print run and shipping. I'm giving my collaborators a lot of freedom with what they do with the game in terms of illustrations and layout, so the budget is slightly inflated to assure they will not be underpaid for their work. Any extra profit that is made after calculating printing + shipping + fees, and paying collaborators for their work, will be split evenly amongst all members of this project.

The Goblins Who Made This!
Viditya Voleti - Prolific Game Designer! - Viditya Voleti (me) has been called by many titles, but most important of them is A True Goblin. He has been designing games forever and even got a degree in Interactive Arts. Viditya has made many games, including the profound Space Between Stars, the incredible VOLUME (an accompanying zine to Adam Vass's TOME), the life-changing The Fire Flickers Between You, and of course the world-shattering Space Goblins! His passion is to allow people a chance to tell fun stories through play and to make each play experience unique not only in narrative but also tactility, gameplay, and goblin-ness. You can find his work at vidityavoleti.itch.io and their social media at @vidityavoleti!
Glo Wan - Illustrator! - Glo is an incredible illustrator and designer who has already brought Space Goblins! to life with the cover! Their style is unmatched and is the pinnacle of Goblin, which is why they are perfect for the job and will be contributing a few more spot illustrations within the zine itself! Glo's work can be found in the following place! Website: glowanart.com/ Twitter: twitter.com/glooblin  Instagram: instagram.com/glooblin/
Jamila R. Nedjadi - Layout Artist! - Jamila R. Nedjadi may be a professional tarot reader and prolific game creator, but in their heart of hearts Jammi is a space goblin. The kind that swings around a space sword and sings space songs in space! Until the next life, where goblin glory awaits, you can find their games of magic, story, and emotional connection at Sword Queen Games (link: https://temporalhiccup.itch.io)
Tyler Crumrine - Editor! - Tyler Crumrine previously edited Viditya's fantasy zine VOLUME as well several RPG products for World Champ Game Co. and Apollyon Press. He's also the designer of Beak, Feather, & Bone: A Map-Labeling RPG. As editor, Tyler will be making sure everything in SPACE GOBLINS! reads well and is easy to use at the table. Find more about his work at www.crumrine.info

Reward Tiers
Space Goblins! is a project I want to keep pretty simple and straight forward! The reward tiers offered are designed to make getting the game into your hands (digital or physical) as easy as possible AND also affordable for the work being done by the wonderful team of creatives so they get paid properly!
Of course, if you want a little extra Goblin in your game, there's a special tier for a unique, handwritten starting room for your Ship on the JUNK SHIP TABLE to give you a fun jumping-off point on your first game! This here is for the Goblins who want an utterly ruined yet completely playable addition to their Print Copy of Space Goblins! I'll personally fill in the first room on your JUNK SHIP TABLE as a seed for your first journey to Junktopia! I may also leave some other notes and graffiti (and a thank you) here and there, who knows where Goblin Inspiration comes from?
Finally, I will lick your zine giving you the absolutely true goblin product. 
Community Copies
This project will be supporting the spread of Community Copies towards those who are unable to financially give to this Kickstarter during its duration. The Community Copies will be broken down as followed:
All digital backers ($10 Pledge) will contribute another digital copy towards the Community Copies stash. This ensures a 1:1 of digital copies for Space Goblins!
All backers who pledge at the Physical Community Copy tier ($25) will secure an additional Physical Zine to be added to the stash and will be offered to those who wish to claim a physical zine!
 People who pledge Only $1 will be reached out to first when the Community Copies are available. Afterward, all unclaimed Community Copies will go on the Space Goblins! itch.io page so anyone can claim them at any point.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my first Kickstarter and also my first time with shipping out zines! All risks and challenges that come with managing orders, shipping out and packaging, as well as hiring and paying an illustrator, layout artist, and editor are on the table. Similarly, I have purposefully overbudgeted a little bit to ensure every collaborator is paid fairly and well and that I don't eat up all profit through shipping and fees. Anything not directly spent towards that will be shared amongst all collaborators equally!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Disk Horse #1: Off to the Races is a Zinequest 2 production by me, Fiona Maeve Geist, my first solo project and, hopefully, a new Zinequest tradition of me making games around design questions. I've worked on a large number of projects including The Ultraviolet Grasslands, Mothership: Dead Planet, Silent Titans, the Demon Collective Volume 1, Troika! Numinous Edition and Beneath the Missing Sea. I am predominately known either for my work on Mothership or as an editor and I would like to share a project I've been toying around with with you. So what is Disk Horse? 
Disk Horse is a spectacular spectacular combining elements of procedural generation, (including of resolution mechanics) with a Powered by the Apocalypse core probably unrecognizable to Meguey and Vincent Baker. The core conceit is replicating a historical game where the originator of the idea that the worlds most popular roleplaying game disconnects you from reality--and precursor to later adherents who argued it teaches you magic or makes you a thrall to satanic forces--paid a DM to run a game for him; in case you are wondering the play report doesn't sound like the world's most popular roleplaying game. This is a game built on the following premise: a gaming table where an investigator is trying to bait their (paid, unprepared, with the wrong book) DM into proving the game 'causes' a social ill and bystander players is a dynamic situation that can play out a lot of ways. I started making tables and moves, the game sort of wrote itself and is finished (~10k words) and in the process of being laid out but i intend to expand non-core aspects through this Kickstarter.
A More Detailed Explanation of the Game is Available Here
Bim (@momatoes) was kind enough to make a promotional image
If you think that this is a little obtuse, a reminder that this is how the world's most popular roleplaying game marketed itself:
While one of the participants creates the whole world in which the adventures are to take place, the balance of the players—as few as two or as many as a dozen or more—create “characters” who will travel about in this make-believe world, interact with its peoples, and seek the fabulous treasures of magic and precious items guarded by dragons, giants, werewolves, and hundreds of other fearsome things. The game organizer, the participant who creates the whole and moderates these adventures, is known as the Dungeon Master, or DM. The other players have personae—fighters, magic-users, thieves, clerics, elves, dwarves, or what have you—who are known as player characters. Player characters have known attributes which are initially determined by rolling the dice… These attributes help to define the role and limits of each character… There is neither an end to the game nor any winner. Each session of play is merely an episode in an ongoing “world.”
—TSR Hobbies, Understanding Dungeons & Dragons, 1979
Disk Horse #1: Off to the Races is slightly more comprehensible.
A sample spread by Dai Shugars (@DM_Shugars)
Disk Horse is ultimately a social game in which individuals play the roles of a Dungeon Master, Investigator or Player-Character adopting the role as appropriate to someone at the imaginary table. Roles wise:
 The DM procedurally generates the rules to the game, presents dramatic situations and monsters and otherwise tries to make sure the P-Cs and Investigator have something to interact with.
 The Investigator paid the DM to run the game and is trying to establish the link between roleplaying games and a randomly rolled social ill on behalf of an organization. The Investigator has moves to making the DM drill down in description to fit their agenda or to tempt Players into behaving accordingly and has a unique randomly generated character sheet.
 The P-Cs (the joke being the role is Player & Character) showed up because the DM asked them to or simply showed up and have their own social agendas and randomly generated character sheets.
All this complication is to say that you play people playing M&M (the in-universe Mazes and Monsters game) for various reasons and trying to achieve them through play (either as their 'Player' or their 'Character'). The game contains a staggering amount of tables in order to keep the game from ever being too repetitive.
What Do You Need Money For?
Simply: I want to deliver this project as a Zinequest compliant zine in A5 with black and white printing, pay myself for my work, pay for a cover, some interior art and other aspects to make the project moderately attractive. In honor of people who want fancy KS exclusives: I'm including a more expensive alternate cover and the ability to leave your thumbprint on the project. If this project takes off, I have plans for trying to stretch the boundaries of Zinequest compliance and aesthetic production and will heap content upon you as well with exclusive goodies for early buy in.
Wait.. how are you budgeting this?
To put it simply: I am allowing myself to fund at a budget where I have to OOP my layout costs and the special cover is a stock image I paid $10 for, I'm willing to do this for the hell of it and "fun" however I define it. There are a huge number of stretch goals because I want people to desire to smash all of the goals and to start with a basic project
Every stretch goal met provides funding to Session Zero. I am trying with stretch goals to pay people I consider friends to expand my silly little dream and make it a more complete, beautiful and interesting game by sharing it with others, every individual who agreed to be a stretch goal gets a PDF, any that fund get a physical copy so no one who agreed to this wastes their time for nothing. Also proceeds are going to Session Zero--which deserves its own explanation, a precis:
"Session Zero is an event that celebrates local game designers in the Philippine tabletop role-playing game community. Last August, we shone the spotlight on talented and passionate creators in a convention filled with creative homebrews, new worlds, systems, and ideas to explore. In total, 50 original and locally-made games were debuted and sold during the 2019 event. We had 20 designers, 20 artists and crafters, 1 publisher, and 2 streaming groups. This year, we hope to run a bigger, better, and more diverse Session Zero, complete with panels, talks, and designers from our friends in #RPGSEA."
-Rachel Teng
I feel that it is important to nourish initiatives to create a broader community without attaching conditions to aid (my donation is for the planners to spend at their discretion). 
In addition, if this project funds, my plan is detailed in a long (not exhaustive! seriously! I'll find more!) list of creators who are offered $150 for their own choice of alternate or new tables, rules and artwork for a companion volume (Disk Horse #1.2: And Hell Rode With Her) putting their unique touch on the game and a $50 donation is made to Session Zero. All designers who feel financially comfortable may donate all or some of their payment to Session Zero. Here is the current roster of stretch goals/contributors.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The project is completely written, in layout and simply needs assets and a print run to finish. I wrote the game itself and began playtesting within a month and have some strong feedback to work off of. The raw text is theoretically already ready and can be easily distributed after the KS concludes, the PDF copy should be ready shortly after and is already underway depending on artwork. The stretch goals are elastic to permit for the vagaries of fate, I plan on April 20th as a deadline for material and am fairly adroit at project management. I am hoping to deliver every physical reward by June. This is a passion project and therefore is not going to have significant rewrites to better acclimate to focus testing or procure a greater market share. Caveat Emptor: the stretch goals explicitly DO NOT promise any particular output by the individuals named, it is simply a one time payment of $150 for what they define as "fair." I cannot control other people. I do, however, have a lot of experience delivering Kickstarters on time and a lot of inspired people have already started fussing with supplemental tables and other work so I do not foresee any problems but life can always happen. The most essential components will be delivered as quickly as possible, mock ups will be uploaded as they are unlocked and will be as accurate to final printing as possible.
